Item_Response: if you are going to go in the sercic you need a talent  and have to be very good at it .

I am 26 years old and my name is Tyler Johnson. I am a tightrope walker. I have a long and busy day ahead of me.

 

       It is 7:00 A.M. and I am going to the pie car for breakfast. I order sausage, eggs, and pancakes. I get some orange juice to go with it. Right now they are setting up the tent for tonight's show.

 

       Now it is 9:30 A.M. and it is time to start practicing for tonight's show. I will be walking above a pool of sharks. I stumbled a few times but never fell.

 

       It is now 3:00 P.M. and practice is over. I get a break time for 30 minutes. I am going back to my trailer to take a nap.

 

       3:30 P.M. It is time to help set everything up for the show tonight. I help set my tightrope and the pool of sharks up for the show.

 

       6:30 P.M. Now it is dinnertime. My friends and I go to the pie car to eat. We are all talking about the big show tonight.

 

       10:30 P.M. Show time! I am the last act of the night. I wait for a hour to go by and I am finally up. The lights face towards center stage. The announcer says,"Now what you've all been waiting for Tylar Johnson!" I step onto the tightrope and I keep my balance until halfway. I look down and I see the sharks going around in circles. I start wobbling and everyone in the crowd gasp. Then I think to myself pull it together Tyler. I get my balance back and walked the rest of the way. Hurray! The crowd goes wild. Everybody applauds and shouts,"Tyler, Tyler, Tyler!"

 

       12:00 A.M. Ah, it's nice to be in bed. It's been a long day. Circus work is hard.

THE  CIRCUS

                                                          A circus life

 

 

              In Tokyo, Japan It as an ordinary day for Chang Hokamaty. As usual he was sitting at his school desk wishing he could be in a circus just like his best friend Po Sushi. Chang is 14 years old wich is a perfect time to join the circus. But his parents say he should focus less on the circus and more on school.

 

 

       "Chang, Chang," Chang's teacher was calling him as he daydreamed about performing in the circus. Then his teacher took her stick and slamed it on chang's desk. '' WHACK!''  '' Huh, oh sorry mrs. pai pai I didn't know you were speaking. ''Yes yes, thats always your excuse.'' ''what were you daydreaming about this time?'' ''oh nothing really just get back to teaching.'' Mrs. Pai Pai went to the front of  the room and started to speak again. ''In a couple weeks the  CIRQUE DU SOLEIL'S CIRCUS SHOW, QUIDAM, will be visiting Tokyo.'' ''Also, one of our former cassmates will be seen at the circus, Po Sushi!'' "I will notify your parents and also you need to have good grades in all subjects to go to the circus!'' Bring, Bring the bell rang and that ment school was over.

 

 

           After school chag ran home as fast as he could so he could get ready for the field trip to the circus. But, when he got home his parents were standing o the front porch holding a sheet of paper that looked like his REPORT CARD!! Oh no, he probabley had horrible grades! Chang's father Bohoke Hokamaty had his serious face on, which ment chang was introuble.

 

          ''Chang what is this on your report card!'' Chang looked down at the card and saw a F in geography! '' An F in geography, father please don't punish me, i'll make it up to you!'' "NO,'' '' thats right chang you can't go on your feild trip unless you have good grades,'' Chang's mother, suru Hokamaty, now spoke. " I do have goo grades, see in math I got an A+ and in science I got an B+!'' "In every suject chang," '' unless you bring up your grads you will not be allowed on the feild trip,'' yes now go get changed into your pj's, dinner is going to be ready soon.''

 

                                                 FOUR WEEKS LATER...

 

              ''Hay chang, do you want to play tag?" "sorry can't I have to get ready for the feild trip tomarrow.''   "Hello po, it's chang," " chang is that you, it's been so long, how've you been?" "wonderful, I can't believe i'm going to my first circus! Po what countries have you gone to?" " There so many I can't name all them, but i've gone to Austrailia, Europe, Africa, and, my favorite one of all the united states!" "awsome!"

 

   

            "WOW!'' "this place is amazing" "now class sit down the show is goig to start!" Mrs. Pai Pai shouted over the noise.

 

             "Welcome everyone, today is where the circus begins." " First up we have Snoodles the clown who Owns no boundries!" "then we have pepi the girl who can ride a horse on te side while holding china glass!" "After that we have tiggy the mean big bad tiger tamer!" And last we have PO the 14 year old boy who willdo an acrobatics act!" "let the show begin!" Throughout the whole show all you herd was gasspes, woos, wows and cheering. At the end of the show chang went back stage to talk to his freind po. "That was amazing!" "thanks.'' "someday i'm going to be in the circus." "no you don't, you have to work till sun up to sundown and no long breaks." "Also, you have to know your talent an the worst of all you never get to see your family and freinds" "actually this is my last show i'm coming back to Tokyo!" "SWEET!"

 

 

     A week later PO Came back and was welcomed with a party. Everyone was happy!

One boring day,Margaret was on the road again with her family.They were driving to their next show.Margaret was in the trailer eating a bag of Hot Puffs when the trailer hit some kind of object.Her father went to see what had happened.The tire was flat when they hit a rock that had a sharp point.

       Their show was in thirty minutes.Luckily,Margaret's dad had an air pump.Her dad spent seven minutes putting air in the tire.But,that didn't work because they still needed tape to stick it on the tire.Her mom found some tape on the side of the driver's seat and gave it to Margaret's dad.

Day At The Circus

                

           By: Katelyn Duong Tran

 

There once was this lady named Mrs. Dunmore. She had two kids of her own. All her life, Mrs. Dunmore 

wanted to be a circus performer. She had many talents but she had one that she was perfectly good at. She was good at being an acrobat. One day when she was driving to work, she passed the circus that had a sign that said," NOW HIRIRING" in bold letters. She was thinking about applying for the job.

 

        Mrs. Dunmore worked until 8:00 pm so when she came home, it was already nightime. Her kids were getting ready for bed. Mrs Dunmore ate dinner and after that, she took a shower. Once she was done, she had to talk to Mr. Dunmore about something. She told Mr. Dunmore about how she just quit her job today and how she was going to apply for the job. Mr. Dunmore was mad. When he saw Mrs. Dunmore's big, happy smile, he was happy.

 

 

         Today was the day Mrs. Dunmore was going to apply for the job at the circus. She walked in and to her suprise, there were eight poeple in line. She had to wait for almost half an hour until in was her turn. The boss of the circus asked her many questions. After the interveiw, she went home. She was very worried about the letter they are going to send to let you know if you got the job or not. Mrs. Dunmore was tired so she went to her bedroom and took a long nap.

 

 

           Once Mrs. Dunmore finished her nap, it was time to pick the kids up fom school. She got in her car and drove over to thier school. When Mrs. Dunmore got to thier house, she got a snack for her kids. She helped them with thier homework if they neded help. Then Mr. Dunmore came home. The family ate dinner and got ready for bed. Mrs. Dunmore got on the bed and fell asleep.

 

 

             The next day, the mailman came. Mrs. Dunmore took the letter from the mailbox. It was the letter from the circus. She went back inside to the house. When she read it, she was suprised. She couldn't believe it. She got the job. She had to start tommorow. From that day on, she was a circus performer. Her and her whole entrire family was happy. They were proud of her too.

The Amazing Alexis

 

         Alexis is an eleven year old girl, she lives in O'Fallon, Missouri. She goes to school at Forest Park Elementary. She lives with her uncle Bozo, his real name isn't Bozo everybody calls him that because that's his clown name. He has a partner named Marty and he's a monkey! Alexis had always dreamed of being in the circus. Everybody said that she wasn't old enough yet. You have to be twelve. She told them well my birthday is coming up soon maybe she could start practicing. Her uncle told her that they would star practicing next week

 

    It has almost been a week since Alexis's uncle said that they could start practicing. She couldn't stop thinking about it. She was so excited that she was going to practice with her uncle tomorrow that she was bouncing off the walls. It was the next day and she woke up very early. When she woke up she ran to her uncles room and shook him until he woke up. He asked her why she was up so early. She said "we start practicing today." Oh  I didn't even remember. Alexis said " I couldn't forget." He said that they would go down stairs to eat breakfast first. they had pancakes, eggs, and bacon.

 

  After breakfast they went out side the first thing that they did out side was stretch. Alexis's uncle said that it is very important to stretch before doing anything in the circus. Then they practiced on their juggling but Alexis didn't know how to juggle. Her uncle had to teacher. After about thirty minutes she finally got it. Then they worked on the balance beam, it turns out that Alexis was pretty good with the balance beam. She had very good balance. Then they had to work on the trapeze but Alexis couldn't do it. She kept trying and trying but she couldn't do it. Since it was getting dark they went in side.

 

   She didn't relize that being in the circus was so hard. Her uncle told her that it is very hard work. He said that since we just started practicing you won't be able to be in the circus even if you are twelve. Alexis said that she didn't want to be in the circus anymore she thought it was to hard. Her uncle wouldn't let her quite he said that he had to do the same thing and now he's in the circus so she can do it to.

 

   It has been three years since Alexis started training and now she's in the circus to. She does so many things inthe circus she's a clown, she's a trapieze artist like she always wanted to be, she a;so works with the elephants and tigers and she couldn't be any happier. If she didn't listen to her uncle she would have never made it to the circus.

Circus                        By Michael smith

 

   I want to go to the circus because it would be cool to see all the things they do.They also don't get a place to call home because the circus is constantly moving. It would be fun to see the gymnast doing the tightrope or the swing thing. One thing I'd like to see is the lion taming.

 

    in this paragraph I will tell more about there life like when they get up when they go to sleep. Okay so when they wake up it is 7:00 AM at that time they also go to the pie cart where they eat. 9:00 AM they go to school and since the circus travels around the world you often go to school with people who speak a different language. 3:00 PM school is over when it is over the kids play on the unicycles, tightrope, and juggling. 3:30 is when they practice and do there chores which is usually feed and give new water to the horses.

 

  I will continue what I saying 6:30 it is time for dinner they go back to the pie cart but they don't usually eat because it is almost time for the show. It is 10:30 the is over and they go back to there sleeping area. Now I will tell you about how bad it is at the circus everybody thinks the circus is great but it is not most people of going back home because on tour they don't get to call a place home. Most people in the circus ran away from home so they could do what they wanted.

 

Now I will tell you about the good things on of the circus the good things are you get to travel the world  and you get a thrill from doing stunts. You also get to have a family of 100 people because they all act like a family. Most people have to join when your young because you can develop your skills young rather than later. It also gives you more experience from the circus. Now you know about the circus so have fun.

This is the life of me, Nicole, and I'm a circus performer. Me and my family work for the Bellini Circus. We live in New York, well, at least right now. Being a circus performer means lots of time on the road. You don't really have a place to call home. You also have to practice a lot. Falling during a show would be pretty embarrassing... Don't think you get out of school either. I'm 11 and I have to go to school on the road. Dinner's aren't as huge as you'd think, being a circus performer and all. Sleep is a little low too. I don't get to bed until about 12:00.

 

  The circus is fun. You get to ride horses and other animals. If you are a acrobat, you get to hang upside down and swing around. Clowns get to honk horns and be silly all day. Imagine that! You can be a tightrope walker, too. They walk on skinny ropes high in the air, and sometimes perform tricks while doing it. Watching the special circus animals is a blast! They're trained to do lots of cool tricks. So, it's not all bad being a circus performer.

 

  Don't let all this ruin your dream if you want to be a circus performer. Hard work isn't always a bad thing. I love life being in the circus, but it's nice to be home every once and a while. All that being said, Circus's are great, and so is being in them!

Hi, my name is Jack

I am a boy from North America who ran away from home to join the circus. I at first was not sure if I wanted to run away but my parents were very mean so I decided to run away.Now I am part of the North American Circus. I am a lion tamer at my circus, but I am not very good yet seeing that I just joined a while ago into the circus. I am working on teaching my lion Pedro how to jump through a hoop! He is not quite ready for it though so we are still working on it.

 

When I first joined the circus I thought it was going to be easy but boy, was I wrong! In the circus I have to get up at 7:05 every

morning so I can get to the pie car to get the bacon and eggs before everyone else. So, after I finish eating my breakfast I have approximately 15 minutes to get ready for school which is at 8:00. That is just my morning, I will tell you more about my afternoon later but right now I am going to take you to my circus school. Well, first I only really do have American classmates, so I don't really have to worry about having to speak any foreign languages. My teacher Mr. Nussbat is really funny and is a great teacher. He really likes to teach math even though I am not that big of a fan of math. Yet today is a special day and Mr. Nussbat knows it, today is my first day of performing at the circus! So today Mr. Nussbat says that today he is going to lets us all out early so we can practice our acts.

 

So, after we get out of school early I quickly make my way over to Pedro my lion so we can work on our tricks for tonight's show.

Me and Pedro then work on our hoop trick and Pedro has finally got it, now we are in good shape to perform tonight. So then after that it is about 4:30 so I head over to the pie car to grab some early dinner because I want to  be able to get some food then head over to the circus tent to get all set up for the circus show. It is now 7:00pm and me and Pedro are about to go on, I hope we can wow the crowd! It is now a bit after ten o' clock and I can still hear the crowds cheering from outside the tent in the trailer where I live. The crowds loved me because they didn't believe that A boy my age could be a lion tamer, but did I show them that I could be! So, now i am sitting in my trailer listening to some music from my iPod since it helps me cool down after an intense night.

 

I hope you liked my story

 

The End

Tom wakes up, he looks at the calender. He gets up and says,"Today is the show for the circus," He walks to the pie car to eat breakfast. As he eats breakfast he realizes how far away he is from home and how much work he has. Then he heads towards class. When you are in the circus you have to learn to speak different languages because of  how many places you go.

LIFE IN CIRCUS

 

 

           I know everybody thinks being in a circus is easy, but it is a busy job. You have to practice some new acts every month. I think it is fun too, but I do a lot of exercise every once in a while. Last week I went to Italy to perform. I had lots of fun there because before the show I went to many gift shops and bought stuff.

 

 

            You also need to wake up early to eat breakfast. I eat breakfast at eight in the morning.  At nine I get ready to change into my normal clothes, at nine thirty I go to school. School is as fun as being in the circus. I like reading, writing, and math, but my favorite part is going to resses. Then at ten through three I prepare for the next show. Next, at three through seven I prepare dinner. And Finally it is show time at eight.

 

 

         Today in my show I did a lot of flips, but my favorite thing to do is make funny jokes at the end of the show. My family's favorite thing to do is play with the wild crowd. They like to give out free stuff like t-shirts, toys, and small glow sticks.

 

 

          This was the best show I have ever done in my whole carrer. If you were in the circus I bet you would love it here. I liked sharing my story with you guys!

The Mystery Tent

      My name is Bellina Fitsburg. I did not want to do this, but now this is my life. I was born January 28, 2002 in La  Circusa, the most popular circus in Paris. My parents, Lucy and Francessco,are trapeze artists, my big brother, Max, is a tightrope walker and was in high school. I am an acrobat performer and am in middle school 6th grade.

      When I was 4 years old all kinds of dancing classes at the school built in the circus. Ballet, Jazz, Tap Dancing, The Salsa and Break Dancing . Then when I was 7 years old I became an acrobat. At first I thought all the training and late night shows was all fun. But then every night I seemed to get more and more tired  and stressed, then along with that I had to go to school and wake up at 7:00 a.m. in the morning.

        I don't know why but I could never go to sleep. Then one night I heard the ring master yelling and  animals roaring and whimpering. The ring master would never do that I thought, so my brain told me it was all just a dream. So I settled down in my small bed and slowly drifted to sleep.

          "Bellina", called my mother. "Coming", I called. I checked my clock, 6:05 a.m.!! "Mom, why so early", I shout. Your school starts early today because you have an extra hour of acrobat classes", my mom shouts back.Uhhhhhhhhh, I think.

            "I.....am.......so......so..............tired"!!, I say. Sulking into bed, I am soooooooooooooooooo tired. But then I perk up, once again I hear the ring master shouting and animals roaring and whimpering. Then I think the animals had been very scared when the ring master came close to them, know that you think of it, the ring master had been glaring at the animals.

          I had to see what was going on. I slippedd out of bed without making a noise and look at the tents, until I see a tent with animals and the ring master in it. I peek in, oh my gosh. He was trying to teach them tricks, but then one did something wrong and he whipped them!!

         I had to report him, it was mean to sabotage animals. I had to run and tell my parents.

        The next morning the ring master was in chains and would remain that way. "We are so proud of you", my family says.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Glenn. He really wanted to be a performer like his parents. They were in a circus. Glenn asked his parents if he could join the circus, and they  loved the idea, because he was in gymnastics, had the right body type, and had all the right skills. When he joinef=d the circus the realized that it wouldn't be all fun and clowning around. It was hard work. When he wakes up at 7:00 he gets dressed, and goes to the pie car for breakfast while the crews are setting up tents lights and music for tonight's show.

 

   Then later at 9:00 is time for school. They have a one-room schoolhouse which travels with them. They did a lot of traveling as a circus. It is just like any school with computers, tests, and report cards. There are circus performers from all over the world, so many classmates speak French, Russian, and Italian.

 

   At 3:00, school is over so it is time for a quick break. The clowns let you play on their unicycles, and juggle. He likes to play with his tiny dog, Seymour. Glenn really wanted to join a soccer team, but they were never in one place enough.

 

   At 3:30, he had to do chores and practice for the show tonight. He took care of the horses for the horseback acts. He was working on leaping of a trampoline onto a horse's back. Other kids were working on juggling or acrobatics. His neighbor was walking baby leopards on a leash. The trainers were working with all different kinds of animals.

 

   At 6:30, his family at dinner at the pie car. They try not to eat much becausetheir show is tonight. They do 10 shows a week: one each Wednesday, plus a manitee on Wednesday, two on Saturday, and two on Sunday.

 

   At 10:30, the show is over and he is wiped out. Walking back to his trailer, he passes the circus offices, concession stands, stables, and trailers. Two days from now they will be in another town.

 

   When it is 12:00, he is in bed. He is thinking about the end of the touring season. It will be nice for him to go home in Florida. When he grows up he still wants to be a circus performer. The circus is fun, but it is a busy and tough life.

Have you ever been to a circus? Well, the circus is a colossal place filled with amazing and bizarre things! Guess what? I know someone who works at one. My best friend Alexis is an acrobat at the Big Blue circus. She has lots of work to do, but she has fun doing it. One summer day she told me every single thing she dose!

 

       First she gets up at 6:46 A.M. every morning. She gets her clothes on and goes to the Pie Car to eat a scrumptious breakfast, if she is not all the way awake, sometimes her mom throws a pie in her face to wake her up! Then she goes to training in the Train to be a better acrobat car. Alexis and her partner Joshua swing from trapezes and jump into each others arms. At approximately 12:13 P.M., she hurries back to the pie car to eat a yummy lunch, it is usually a stake burger and seasoned french fries with a sweat tea on the side. and then she does her chores. She has to groom the horses, dress the monkeys and elephants, practice her part of the show, and get the stage ready. And finally at about 4:35 P.M. the show will go on! It starts with the tamer and lions, followed by the courageous motor cycle drivers, and then the hilarious clowns, then the magical musician, and last but not least the amazing acrobats, Alexis and Joshua! After the show the circus has games and they let you ride ponies, and elephants, and they even let you play with the amazingly bizarre monkeys! When everything is done, she goes to her trailer, which she shares with her mom, brother's, and sister, and gets ready for bed. It is 11:59 P.M. when she gets in bed and starts to fall asleep. The next day she does the same thing over again, whenever she has time she writes me a letter. Most of the letters just say how she has been doing, when she will be in town next, and she asks how I'm doing. I can't wait to see her next week, I think I want to be an acrobat someday, too.

 

 

     I've been thinking and I think I'm going to join the circus. Do you think that is a good idea? I think it sounds pretty fun! Maybe one day Alexis and I can perform together, that would be fun. I'll have to think a little bit longer.

         So, the performers looked at the flyers. The bus driver had read the flyer wrong and they where in New Jersey instead of New York. However, they where to late so they just started to head back to New York.

 

       That next day thay they got to New York and said there sorries and wanted to make it up to the New Yorkers, so they put on the best show they possibly could they were swinging, dancing, flipping, hopping and all and the people were happy and that was a circus day.

My dad, mom, sister, and I scrambled into the car. I was so excited That it felt like i was going to fly out of my seat.

 

When we finally got there, it was amazing. I was able to see performers practicing amazing stunts. There were clown-like people going down the isle interacting with the crowd. And then it all began.

 

It was so amazing seeing people flying through the air, walking on tine wire, and riding a horse trough a ring of fire. I was so sad when it ended, because I didn't want to go back to my boring house, but I had too. I hope I can go to the circus again.

"We're gonna be late!" mom calls out to me as I'm gathering my things. " I know mom!" I said frustrated. My sister then came in to my room and told me that she was going to drivers ed that day and couldn't come to my Ariel practice.That made me even more unhappy.Quickly I through on my dance shoes and sprinted out the door.

       As we were driving I told mom how hard it was going to be for me to be away from her, dad, my sister and my friends for what seemed like forever. Really though it was only a couple of weeks while I was in Las Vegas preforming in Cirque Du Soleil. I was so exited, it was going to be the best weeks of my life. But I was also scared. I knew that it would be really, really hard to go all the way. What if I mess up. I said silently to myself.

        Finally, we were at the dance and Ariel studio. When I walk in I see all of the amazing people on the tight ropes and people holding themselves up on little ribbons, like scarfs,one hundred feet up. "That's going to be you." mom said as she was looking above to see all of the people that do Ariel. "I know" I said with a scared face. She told me not to worry and not to be scared. But how could I not worry, i mean I don't have a spotter in the show and I'm still learning. She kissed my forehead, and my coach came out to come and get me. It was time,time to train. We started with lots of stretching. Leg up and down. Left leg splits now right leg splits, lots of middle splits and a ton of conditioning. "Climb that rope girl, faster faster." came my coach's voice. So faster I went. I was at the top, i rang the bell and slowly, to make sure I didn't tear up my hands, came down. Next it was time for the real work. I harnessed up and in the air I went.

    I flipped and there were definitely a few flops. But over all practice was all right. When I got done I said goodbye to mom and now I was in the hands of my coach. For th next few days I trained long hours. Now it was time to go. we got on th bus and away we went to Las Vegas. Today was the day. My parents were coming to see me preform and so were a whole bunch of my friends. I was nervous, but I knew that I could do it.

  It was time the audience was getting seated. They were announcing that the show was to begin. up up up I climbed, then the music started. It was amazing I was going crazy flips and everything was going so well until, My best friend Alisha's harness broke. She was doing the kind of move here you are required to wear a harness. In a split second, she fell to the ground, the hard stage. There was a massive and ear splitting scream that came from her.Quickly, I descended from my ribbons. She was lying there, for what seemed like forever until someone got to her. She was screaming. I asked her what hurt but she wouldn't say. I helped her sit up and finally, she was taken to a hospital.I had to go with her so did her parents. When we got to the hospital, they took lots of e-rays of her entire body until they were positive at what was broken. She had a fracture in her lower back, a broken ankle, and a sprained wrist. the doctors said that she was lucky to get away with only those injuries. She was finally awake, but she woke only to find herself in pain and we had to tell her that she could never do Ariel again.

    So now you can see that there are many tragedies in this beautiful sport, but it is amazing and should be kept alive forever. When I got home I told my mom that now I had a reason to be scared but I will still keep dreaming. Soon i joined the Cirque du Soleil. I have never looked back. And guess who will be joining me my next show, Alisha! She had lots of surgeries and a ton of physical therapy, but now she's back, and better than ever.

The Missing Elephant                                                                                                                 One day I went to the circus. I was really excited, I couldn't wait to see the different animals, and clowns. When I got there, there was a problem. The circus lost the main elephant. It had been 15 minites ago when the show was supposed to start and they still couldn't find the missing elephant!                                                                                                                                                                                                  They later asked us if we could look for it. I soon got out of my seat and started searching.I looked around the snack bar, but didn't find it. Then I found a door that had a sign on it that said Keep Out. I went inside, there I saw an elephant, with an engured leg. I soon got the staff, and tried not to panic.When the staff came in they took the elphant and put it into an animal hospital. The veternarians were able to heal it's leg. The trainer said I may have saved it , and gave me backstage passes. I was real glad I saved the elaphant,Maggy. The Banzini Bros.

        The Banzini Bros. is an amazing circus to watch, but not so fun for a ten year old little girl to preform every three days on summer vacation. It is very difficult to tame lions to do tricks that make the crowd go wild. I go on tours to preform all the time with my aunt and uncle because they say I have "talent" for teaching their lions to do tricks. They call me, "their big cat whisperer".

 

        The first day is always the most fun. I get to play with the lions that smother you with their long, shiny, and golden manes. I have to keep a journal about the lions writing down, Day one: Lions happy, brushed, and fed.

       

         After playing with the lions, I go to see what my uncle is doing. Since he is the director, he is practicing what to say and what order to say them in. Watching him talk to himself is boring, I thought so I went to see what my was doing.

 

        My aunt walks the tightrope so it is a lot of fun to watch her. She teaches me a lot about tightropes and how she can balance so well. She says the key is concentration, watch something that is moving still, and you know it will not move. " DO NOT look below the tightrope. If you do, you will be afraid at the height you are at, and fall." she tells me.

 

       It is ten o'clock, I usually go to bed at midnight, but my uncle says I have to get some more sleep than usual because I have to preform tomorrow. I am pretty scared because what if I mess up? What if the lions attack me? Well, I guess I will figure out tomorrow.

 

      ''Wake up sleepyhead!'', says my uncle and aunt. ''Todays the Big Top day!'', they coo. They try to make Big Top day sound like a joke. Got to go see the lions and feed them. ''Goodbye, got to feed the big cats!'', I say to them.

 

      The lions look so happy to see me! They growled at me in a playful manner and played with my tangled hair. ''Show is in thirty minutes, feed them, brush your hair, and  get on your costume!, my uncle yells. ''OK.'', I shout back.

 

       UH-OH! Time for the circus! I feel like I have butterflies in my stomach. As I go backstage, I hear,  ''Ladies and gentlemen, children of all ages! Welcome to the Banzini Bros. circus!!!!'' My uncle sounds happy this morning to preform. ''O-o-okay,'' I stutter to myself, I preform after my aunt.''

 

      It's my turn. The lions are ready for me out in the areana. I just need to remember what order I practiced in. 'Introducing.... The lion tamer!''

Hi! I am going to tell you about circus and how many many places we vised a day. We travel  20,000 miles in seven months each year visiting 150 cities. we all work tell sunup to sundown. My typical day for me7:00 ami wake up, I get dressed, and go to the pie car for pankcakes and bacon. the crews are setting up tents,lights, and music fir tonight's show. 9:00 A.M. School time. our one room schoolhouse travels with us. Like any school, ours has computer, tests, and repoort cards. Because the circus performers are from all over  the world many of my classmates speak other languages: French, Russian, and Italian, like my family. As we travel around the  country, our geograph lessons come alive.

                        3:00 P.M. School,s over time for a play with their a quick break. The clowns let me play with their unicycles and juggling balls. I also play with my tiny dog, Noodle; our trailer is too small for a lage pet. I'd like to join a soccer team, but we're never in one place long enough.

                        3:30 P.M. Chores and practice. I feed,water,groom, the horses we use in our houseback acts. Today, my dad practices   somersaultting off a running horse. I'm working on leaping from a trampoline onto the horse's back; it takes balance and concentration. Other kids are practicing juggling and acrobatics. Our neighbor walks baby leopards on a leash. Trainers are working with elephants,lions,and chimpanzees.     

                                                                                                                                                      10:30 P.M.The show  is over. i'm wiped  out. walking back to our trailer, we pass the circus offices,concession stands, stables,and trailers. Two days from now, we'll all set up in another town.

                

                       12:00 A.M. In bad. I'm thinking about the end of our touring season. It will be a nice to go back to our real home in Florida. When I  grow up, will Istill be a circus perfomer like my parents? Who knows? The ciecus is fun, but it's  a busy and tough life.

"Hurry up, the curtains are about to open!" whispered Angelique to me. "Please welcome our professional trapeze artists, Angelique Banquet and Cecile Dockers!" announced the announcer. Just as I finished praying that I wouldn't fall off the tightrope, the curtains opened with an approving applause. Angelique and I cartwheeled and flipped to the base of the ladder and proceeded  to mount it. "We can do this, we can do this, we can do this......" I muttered to both reassure and encourage us. When I reached the top, I mounted the unicycle that I would be riding across the 24-foot long tightrope in just a few seconds. This is my chance. Now or never. All my hard work for months and months and months will be useless if I don't make it, I thought. I started across the tightrope. Slow and steady. Slow and steady. When I reached the end, I dismounted the unicycle and proceeded to take a bow. Now Angelique was up! She did not ride the unicycle, but she did walk on her hands. She reached the end, took a final bow, and the curtains closed.

 

           As I was laying in bed thinking about my next act, I heard Angelique humming in her sleep. It was such a soft, gentle song that I let it gently rock me to sleep.

 

           "6:00!," cried Clooney the loony clown, "Heading to the

      Pie Car in 15 minutes!"Pancakes! Bacon! Eggs! I thought excitedly. After a breakfast of bacon and eggs, ( it was a bummer hat they ran out of pancakes!) it was trapeze time. I headed towards the arena where we practiced and then realized something. Today was the matinee! I checked my watch. 11:55!!!!!!! Oh No! I sprinted to the arena. "Good thing that you got here just in time! We're on in 5 seconds!" said Angelique.

 

           After a perfect performance, I took one final bow. I love circus life, I thought.

Breath, I told myself, just Breath.  It's my first performance in the Bellini Circus.  As I wait for my turn to perform in the morning show I watch acrobats, clowns, and jugglers all dominate the stage, every moment that passes I get more and more nervous.  Finally, my turn.  "You can do it Emma!"  My dad calls from below as I step onstage.  I jump up with the help of  a clown onto a white stallion.  As I stand on the bareback horse a small, pink feather detaches itself and floats down from my skirt and around the horse's head.  Spooked by the sudden surprise that lands on his nose, the stallion rears sending me flying!  My eyes wide I fall into the clown's arms.

 

     The crowd cheers as I stumble offstage thinking it was all an act, but no, it wasn't.  Later at the afternoon show I tremble. I don't want to take that fall again!  I walk out onstage breathing heavily, about to mount I suddenly can't move.  I run offstage as fast as I can.  As soon as I exit my dad walks up to me, "Emma what happened?"  "Dad I just can't do it",  I say with a shrug,"I am not going to mess up again."  He looks at me and says in a lower tone, "Emma you can't give up your dream because of a little mess up!  Look all  performers have their ups and downs but you can't back down."   I smile, maybe I should.  "Alright lets do this!"

 

     I waltz onto the stage, mount the stallion and grin to the world.  Consentrate, I tell myself, I can do this.  As my horse walks parallel with Alisha's we both do a flip ending up on opposite horses.  I do a bridge as the person who guides the horse slows to a stop and I do a kickover off.  I pump my arm in the air. I, Emma, am triumphant.

Wake up! I get up and get dressed the circus life isn't always  easy and fun but I still enjoy it. I go get breakfast at the waffle cart and eat. Afterwards I go to school. At 3:00 we get out and I go back to my home the wide world  circus.

 

        I'm an acrobat, I ride horses swing, on the trapeze, and do high-wire.At 3:45 I do my chores and practice for tonight's show. the crowd is big as usual and as usual the lion tamer a.k.a my dad tames the lion then the the clowns a.k.a my twin big brothers get each other with water then the acrobats go and do our tricks.

 

         After the show we clean up and go to bed. The next day we pack up and head for the next town.We move a lot so i never get to have many friends unless they join the circus.

 

          We have three shows a week three weeks of the month. we travel all over the world so I get to see all kinds of places. there are lots of ups and  downs to circus life.

"Meanwater, Alex!" As Alex walked into the giant tent labeled "TRYOUTS" , my heart began to pound. Would I pass? Would they think my performance was good enough for their team of acrobats? Probably not, I thought. Was all just a dream? Of course not! Alex is here, you can feel your heart pounding, and the cut you got on the rock yesterday is still there! True, I told myself. No point trying to convince myself this is "only a dream".

          Then, just as soon I stopped arguing with myself, a man with a long beard called out stiffly "Ledwin, Jeff!"

          I stepped forward. Would I make the acrobatics team? I looked at the jury. The jury consisted of 3 people; the man with the long beard who called out the names, a young man around the age of 21, (and to my own personal horror) Mr. Rudel Yuo Lungson.

          I panicked. If I didn't make the team this time, someone else would take my spot and my parents would go bankrupt! What should I do? I thought. I've got to do something! And then I realized how long I had been just standing there.

          "HURRY UP!" roared Mr. Lungson. "I want to give you 2 poi--I mean see your performance!"

          Then something slid into place inside my brain. Mr. Lungson is the one that robbed my parents! He's trying to make us go bankrupt! Before I knew it, I was lunging toward Mr. Lungson. He gaped at me (as was everyone else was) for only a few seconds before I had collided with him. His head had collided with the hard dirt floor. Then a horrible RIP! was heard.

          The metal pole was crashing down on Mr. Lungson! I lunged once again, but this time not toward Mr. Lungson, but toward the metal pole. I jumped up, grabbed hold of the pole, and brought the pole down as I landed square on my feet. "RUN!" I commanded Mr. Lungson as I strained to hold up the heavy metal pole.

          CRRACK! I let out a shrill scream. My arm was searing with pain. It felt like someone had lit my arm on fire!

          "He broke his arm!" yelled the young man. "Call an ambulance!"

          The last thing I remember is Mr. Lungson sneering as he stepped on my broken arm. I called his name again and again until he ran out of sight with the young man chasing after him in the summer air. Then I felt a sharp blow to my head.

 

          I then woke up again in a hospital room. "You're safe," said a doctor. " He's been arrested for causing serious injury and inflicting serious pain consciously." That had lifted my spirits. Then, without warning, my insides seemed to be celebrating. And then I knew that I had done the right thing be saving even my enemy's life.

 

                                                          The End!

Nothing Like This

   As Brady watched the circus performing in front of him, he was amazed at how cool the illusions looked. A man floating in air, one on a lion's back. He heard the ring master call for a volunteer to help him with the next part of the act. Brady stood up and waved his hand in the air frantically, he had no idea what he was in for. The ring master walked right up to him and said, "Son, you ready for the time of your life?"

   He lead Brady down the steps and on to the stage. Brady saw a cloth looking thing fall from the ceiling. The ring master said "Grab hold for a wild ride." with a gleam in his eyes. Brady looked at the ring master and grabbed hold of the cloth. The ring master secured him in place and started swinging the cloth. 

   Brady was lifted out of the air and was twirling around. He remembered watching this the last time he came. As he was twirling around it felt like he was flying, the wind rushing at him it felt so good on his face. Soon it was over. As he returned to his seat he made a promise to himself, that he would be in the circus.

  He convinced his mom to let him join just when he turned 11. He didnt know what to do but he got himself in a very famous circus. They tested him on many things and decided that he woiuld be a lion tamer. Nothing like it, a kid who tames lions. It would make millions.

  As he came close to the first beast Brady trembled with fear.He had a whip and a chair in a fancy costume.The lion bared his teeth and lunged. He tried his best to look brave and lashed out with the whip. The lion whimpered and recoiled in fear. Brady went straight up to it and stroked its mane.

  Brady went to the pie car to get some food and saw an old man drinking prune juice. He didn't understand why the old man was there. When Brady went over to the man it seem he allready new what was happening. He stood up and said "I'm here because I'm the old lion tamer, when they run out of lion tamers I take their place, I'm very good with lions."

  He sat Brady down and they started talking all about lion taming and what that man did before he was a lion tamer. The old man shared many stories with Brady and Brady liked them all.

  As he listened he realized that this man had been with lions his whole life and he never wanted to stop. Brady said thank you for the stories and raced off to find the ring master. When he finally found him he told him about the old man and his plan, the ring master loved it. So when Brady's mom came to see the show, she didnt just see Brady, she saw Brady and the old man side by side doing what they loved. That night, as Brady lay in bed, he dreamed about being an old man and telling a new child all the stories of his past.

A Turn of Events at the Circus

 

           Hi. I am Bill the Amazing and I work in Atlanta's Great Traveling Circus.  I will tell you of a turn of events at the circus.  It was a clear morning in Atlanta. Everything went as normal and everyone was getting ready for the big show that night.  Some people that were getting ready were Jill the Trapeze artist, Henry the lion tamer and Dominic the Man that can walk on Fire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Everything went as planned that day until the show.  All the performers did a great job, Henry surprised the audience by doing tricks with the snow leopard instead of his famous lion taming act, Jill did a great job, and Dominic was pure amazing.  Everything was great until my act, the grand finale.  This night I was going to do truly amazing, something that had never been done before.  Anyways, while the stage crew got the stage ready for my act but the snow leopard acted up and it broke Jill's arm.  She had to be transported to the hospital and everyone wanted to be with her because we are like family but the director said that the show must go on.  They also had to get the snow leopard out of the building in case it acted up again and seriously injured someone.

 

            Everyone was waiting for my act, so I toughed out the longing sensation to go to the hospital and I came out to perform my act.  Everyone cheered so loud when I came out it was such a great feeling.  I started to perform my act when, and very surprisingly a giant elephant came from supposedly the neighboring traveling circus that was also in town it came right through the opening in the tent and was raging like a bull.  Instantly I reacted.  My circus training really paid off, I jumped out of the way just in time before the elephant came and would've killed me.  Next, Dominic came out and tried to distract the elephant before it went running into the crowd but even with all his efforts it could not be stopped.  Then I jumped into action and jumped right onto the top of the elephant.  It reared up and I almost fell off but I managed to stay on and grab the reigns that were on the elephant I pulled them as hard as I could and the elephant instantly stopped and was looking very puzzled.  At that moment everything went silent and the chaos stopped.

 

           Then, the elephant just collapsed and the whole crowd gawked at the sight of the beast lying on the ground.  Meanwhile, I had to get off of the elephant which was quite a tricky task.  Right when I got off we could hear the sirens blaring.  Then the animal control came and god bless them.  We all wanted the elephant out of the tent and they did a tremendous job of that.  Soon, Jill heard of this news and the staff at the hospital let her come and see us.  She was so glad that none of us were seriously injured

and everyone else was too.

 

           Soon enough everything was back to normal and luckily no one was hurt during the elephant incident.  They finally let me do my awesome act.  I swallowed 50 swords and 1 lead ball.  I got such a big applause from the audience you wouldn't even believe it and after that night no more incidents occured at Atlanta's Great Traveling Circus.

Four years ago their was what some people called the best circus ever.  Acrobats flipped and twirled and trampeze artist flew sky high from rope to rope.  What caught the attention of the audience was their work ethic and how much fun the performers seemed to have, but the real show stopper was a 15 year old girl acrobat named Elizabeth, who everyone could tell hed that spark and it factor, here is how her journey started.

        Elizabeth was 14 years old when she joined the circus.  Before she joined she practiced 24/7 to be in the circus everday for two years.  When Elizabeth was 4 she got her side and front arieal, 7 back tuck, 8 needle, 9 became a competitive dancer, and at the age of eleven could do 58 turns.  When Elizabeth was 12 she said " I love dance and want to inspire dancers around the world and I want to be in the circus".

         Elizabeth tried out to be an acrobat at 14, 178 other girls wanted that only spot too, but the spot was handed to Elizabeth because of  her flexibility and desire.

          Elizabeth started training two weeks after she got the spot.  She loved working hard everday, doing so many shows, and traveling the world.  The one thing Elizabeth didn't like about being in the circus was that she had to leave her friends and family.  Elizabeth's favorite place to perform was Idaho because her family would come and support her.

          Even though Elizabeth was always working she still got an education.  Today Elizabeth is 19 years old, really smart, and is now in Cirque Du Soleil.  Whenever she thinks of performing she says outloud "Fun, fun, totally fun."

CIRCUS

 

                                                           By: Audrey Ancheta

 

              Life in the circus isn't all about fooling around and having fun. Their life and jobs are harder than you think. The "fun" jobs you could choose from are Acrobat, Lion taming, Clown, Juggling, Ring Master, and Training Animals. These jobs seem fun but they're actually hard. Keep reading and I'll tell you more details about life in the circus.

 

           An acrobat is a thrilling and difficult job. I think it's cool how they can balance on tight rope. Sometimes they use bicycles and carry people on the tightrope! Sometimes they launch each other out of cannons . That is what an acrobat does.

 

           Being a trapeeze is hard. You  jump from rope to rope while doing flips in the air. Sometimes 3 or 4 people are all in the air at once. Then they go back on the ropes with out anyone falling. That's what a trapeeze does.

 

            The ringmaster is basically the host of the show. He makes the announcements about the performers. He usually wears a black. red, and white costume. The ringmaster is always the last act of the performance.That is what a ringmaster does.

 

             Lion tamers teach the lions to do tricks that a lion in the wild wouldn't do. The tamers have to put a cage around the center of the tent just incase one of the lions would jump at the people. Some of the tricks that the tamers teach are to stand up and jump through the hoops.

 

             Animal trainers have the job of training the animals that perform in the circus. They train animals such as horses, lions, snakes, leopards, elephants, seals, and monkeys. The trainers have to make sure they are properly trained so they don't attack the trainers and audience. Trainers also have to make sure that the animals are fed, given water, and groomed.

 

               Now you know how hard it is to work in a circus. The people in the circus have to do their jobs every day. It gets tiring having to do that every day. If you want to join the circus you have to be determined and hard-working daily.That's life in the circus.

 

                 

 

            

              

                                                                THE END

Hi, I'm Klariza. And I want to tell you about my life in the circus. So, maybe some of you may think that the circus is always fun and games. Well, only sometimes. But, most of the time it's just work, work, work.

     

      Here are things that I do in the circus everyday. The first thing I do is wake up in the morning and get dressed. The clothes that I change into have to be just casual clothes. Anyway, the next thing I do is go to the pie car to eat breakfast with the other performers. The next thing I do might surprise some kids.

 

      The next thing I do is go to school. I know, I know it's weird to go to school in the circus. But we circus performers need our education. Without it, we wouldn't have known how to do flips - or anything that we can do. So, it's not that weird anymore right? Good.

 

      Now the next thing I do in the circus is to take a break in school. After the break, we do chores and practice. Chores is the thing I hate the most. But, it's life in the circus. Now for PRACTICE!!!!!! I love practice! Practice is my favorite thing to do in the circus.

 

      After all that practice it's dinnertime! And boy I'm starving! But the thing is, I can't eat to much. Do you know why???? It's because it's almost showtime!!!!! And I am super excited! Wish me luck on my show!

 

      Whew! Show's over. And boy aren't I tired! Everyone did great! Including me. Haha! So, finally it's time for bed.Well, goodnight reader! Zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz...........................

The Worst Circus Show Ever!

 

 

 

Hi my Name is Roger the Clown I have experienced many things, but nothing like last week.

Last week was our worst Circus show yet! Everything went wrong. But thats only because somebody was sabotaging us. One of our biggest rivals.

 

First i'll start with what happend to me, Roger the Clown.It was the middle of July we were doing one of the biggest shows of our careers.Our show was in New England and the Queen of England was watching our show. I had just finished my first act perfectly but then came my unicycle act. I was riding my unicycle around when it broke down I checked it and it turns out somebody screwed of my bolts. I tried to cover it up with my french horn, but something was stuck in it. So I ran of the stage.

 

Next were the Byron Brothers the twin acrobats of the Century. They were doing all there acts correctly until the tightrope act. They climed the ladder smiling at the audience. They were doing great but for their finishing move the amazing thriple backflip. They landed perfectly on the rope but the rope snaped and they fell onto the net.

 

And last the Amazing and Beautiful Miss Pico. She was Dancing Beautiful on Stage.But this was the baddest thing that happened tonight. When she was dancing her heel of her shoe broke and she broke her ankle. But then we saw a strange man leaving the arena with a hat and a big coat. we also saw him with a pocket knife in his hand and a screwdriver in his back pocket. He looked backed and I saw his face  and I knew that face. It was the manager of our rival Circus .

 

I started chasing him and caught him. I turned him in to the cops and he had to serve 5 years of Jail  for sabotage and pay for miss Pico's Medical bill.That was our worst Circus show ever. But the good thing is the Queen of England offered us to do a private show for her because we didn't get to show her our best. So when we did the private sow we Aced it. That was the worst Circus show ever!!!!!!

Hi, my name is Avion and I work with a circus called Smile,

Laughter, and Ta-da. I am the leader for the circus acrobats.

I was 5 when i had decided I wanted to start gymnastics.

I first had to try out. At first I didn't think I had the right body form, but I was determined. Later I got a message that said I made it. I practiced a lot until I was 15 when there were circus tryouts. I asked my gymnast coach ans she said I should go for it, because I had the highest standards in my gymnastics class. I practiced for about 2 1/2 weeks when the day came. When I performed the judge was stunned that I hadn't missed a single test. I was so happy when I made it.

 Everyday is a new, hard, and well practiced day. We do a lot of

traveling we travel about 15,000 miles every 6 months and vist about 125 cities. We have been to every country so far and to half of the states in North America such as South Carolina, Hawaii, and even Florida.

Everday I wake up at 7:30 A.M. and get ready to start doing

warm ups for about 2 hours. Some things I do for warmups are jumping jacks, flips on the trampoline, and tosses. At 9:30 me and the rest of the acrobats line up with their partners. First me and my partner go. We showand tell the rest of the acrobats what they need to do. Sometimes me and my partner will teach them some new acrobatics like the triple toss and throw. Later at 12:00 we have lunch. Then at 12:30 we take class lessons where we learn about the precise angle of our throws and tosses and couple more things like that. Later at 3:00 we have our break were we have to feed and groom the horses, elephants, tigers, and the rest of the animals.Finally at 4:00 for the rest of the day until 8:00 when we leave we practice performing and getting ready.

Since, we travel a lot I don't get to see my family a lot. Plus,

there is no place to call my home when we move all the time. Beside the fact I don't ever get to see my family I live the life here with all of my circus friends and always there to cheer someone up at shows.

There was this family they were clowns they had a busy calendar. At 7:00 a.m. they would wake up and get dressed.  At 8:00 they would go to  a  diner called The Pie Car. At 9:00 they would go to school and learn about circuses.  At 3:00 school would be over  and they come home.  At 3:30  they would have chores  and practice then they have to feed ,water ,and groom the horses. At 6:30 it would be dinner time and they would go to The Pie Car but they wouldn't eat much because  of the show .Then they would get ready for the show  .At 10:30 the show would be over and they would be cleaning up after. And at 12:00 it would be bed time. They would have ten shows a week one each week day  there four afternoon shows. Then there would be two on Saturday and two on Sunday. There son hated it  he wanted to leave the circus  but his parents said ,'' NO.'' Then on one night he packed a bag and  ranaway the next morning they couldn't find him. The police tried finding him but no luck. Then finally he came home and he said that he was sorry that he ran away.n His parents said they  were sorry to. Then he had a much better time at the circus before.

The tightrope walker has to be really carefull , and keep his balance. If he falls he will probably fall down about five to six feet down. If he falls he might brak his head open or he could die.

The circus juggler has to be carefull too because the hoops could fall and knock him out. Then he would have to go to a hospital.

Bob Witly or also none as the great BoBeAtO. He is a man that left his 4 kids back in Germany to go to the circus bob makes abotut minima wange. He likes his his job but misses his kids. So every day when he is done doing his performence wich is swolloing a five foot corndog in his mouth. He goes to his three foot by three foot trailer and look at 4 old beat down pictures of his sons Tydroam, Willised, Smhit, clifreis, That all carries the same last name as vound. Then he leaves his trialer to go mingle with his fellow actreses. so thats bobs life.

Life is a busy life. It's not easy being a acrobat. You have to be the best you can be all the time. Were not just crazy people doing crazy things. Were hardworkers and never stop practicing. This is my life. My crazy life.

 

  My dad runs the circus. That puts a lot of pure presure on me. I always have to be the best or i'm nobody. He runs my life. I never wanted to be in the circus. I want to go to a real school not a school that is in a tralior. I want to be a marine bioligist one day not an acrobat. I want to be who I want to be.

 

  Were on our way to France right now. I'm trying to read but with this group you can't do anything. I would rather be in school then with this group. I love them all with all my heart but this isn't for me. I wish my dad understood.

 

  A few hours later were in France. I want to explore Paris,but we have to go to practice. Our first show is tonight. I'm practicing my acrobat routine. It's really fun. The music is fast and fun. I'm really excited about tonight's show.

 

  The show starts in 20 minutes. I have to talk to my dad though. I think it's time I do. I knock on his door and he says come in. "Dad I need to talk to you."I say. The way I said it sounds like it's life serious. I wish i could've said that different. "OK, what's up buttercup?" "I want to be a marine bioligist. I love this life that I'm living but this is not for me." "I know."He says sadly. "How do you know?" "You are the smartest little girl in the world. You love to do acrobatics but as a hobby. Anybody can read you." Thanks for understanding,dad."

 

  My life has changed scince that talk. I go to marine study school in Hawii. I do acrobatics in the winter. I can do everything I love and be happy!  

             The End!
Hello! I'm an acrobat, and my name's Lily.To become an acrobat,I had alot of training . When I first started, I stunk,but all my trianing got me to where I am now. The amazing acrobat!

You really think the circus is easy huh? Well your wrong hi  im liberty and im an accrobat in the circus. because you see we put a whole lot of time in our show to entertain you. the things we accrobats do are really tricky.  Sometimes in practice  we usually lose our balance on the ropes and fall off. the clowns have lots of stuff to learn like i do like juggling, being funny, riding the unicycle all that stuff is complicated for them but they get through it like we do . it takes constant hours for us to get everything ready for the show its alot and i mean alot of work because most times we cant go home to see our families again cause were so busy we dont have time . Although the circus is fun its tough too.

I awoke early that morning to get ready for our big show that evening. Being up this early usually means you can't sleep, but not for us circus performers we rarely get eight hours of sleep. I walked out of my trailer and down to the pie car for breakfast which is always eggs, bacon and sausage. After eating my breakfast I went to the trailer we use as a schoolhouse to play on the computer for an hour or so. The computers we have are fairly old but they still work alright, I decided it would be wise to check my email which I regret doing now because there was a message from someone named "clowning_around" It stated that if I didn't quit eating five sausages he/she would cut the rope during acrobatics act.

 

 

Well that totally scared me so I went to the big top leader also known as Mrs.Casto who assured me no one would cut my rope or she would cut them. I was more or less relieved to hear that even if I still though clowning_around would cut my rope. I trudged back to the schoolhouse only to find Dylan Thompson playing computer games, I quickly sat down next to him which I also regretted because he smelled like pumpkin pie "yuck". I told him about the email he actually thought it was funny, Really he said no one else is brave enough to go up that high but you I think you'll be safe.

 

 

Having been sadend by Dylan laughing I walked slowly back to my trailer for a nap. I didn't nap long maybe an hour before I heard a knock at my door, I got up and opened it but was surprised by what I saw it Ginechi the italian clown. What brings you here Ginechi I said, Well I heard you got a strange email from someone threatening to cut your rope so I brought you these he said then handed me a bouqet of dragon lilies. I said thank you then shut the door then placed the bouqet on my counter top.

 

 

Four hours later I was in the big top waiting from my acrobatics to do my acrobatics act. Everyone including the clowns assured me that I would be fine but I was suspicious of all of them. Moments later it was time for my act, I slowly walked onstage and up the ladder to the acrobatic post where I jumped off and onto the pedastool then listened for someone to cut the rope holding the pedastool. I listened for about two minutes before I heard someoone sawing at the rope and it was none other than Ginechi himself he soon finished sawing and then I plumetted down onto the cold hard ground.

Crowds roared up as they caught the acrobatic. I was cleaning the dirty horses. The horses moved as i saw the cicus tightrope walker stay balanced on the rope.

 

         My stomach needed some fuel to its engine or else it wouldn't be roaring. People were on unicycles riding down the rope. Circus life is hard we have to do chores, practice then perform

 

    

          I have a friend that speaks Russian. Peple come from all over the world just to perform. They don't the same job as me because they wanted to do something else.

 

 

           We have to leave the circus after they are done. You have to have a specific talent to get started. But the best part of being in a circus is that you get to go all over the world.

The Perfect Pop

 

 

     You are preparing for the big circus act in Columbia, South Carolina. Your act is to be shot fifty feet up in the air out of a cannon, and land on a giant air mattress. You have been practicing for six months and now the big day is here. You are all waiting for the show to start.

     Then you here a big, Booming voice say,"Welcome ladies and gentle men, Are you ready for your mind to be blown?" The crowd roars with excitement. You put in your ear plugs and get ready to open up the show. You walk out to the cannon waving to the crowd. You are nervous and thinking, I hope everything will turn out okay. AS you climb in the cannon the big voice says,"Opening up our show will be this fine young lady being shot out of a cannon." 

Right as the voice finishes you fly out of the cannon, and into the air. Then you find yourself plummeting torward the giant air mattress. As you hit the mattress it pops. It sounds like a giant woopy cusion, and it gets the entire crowd going. You think, What a great way to open up the show!

7:am I wake up, get dressed, and go to the pie car for pancakes and bacon. the crews are setting up tents,lights,and music for to nights show.

Today was my birthday.  For my birthday, my parents had promised to take me to a circus. 

I had lots of fun watching the show.  I even got popcorn.  My favorite part was when an acrobat jumped into an empty seat in crowd.  In another part of the show, two clowns climbed a giant ladder and there was a large pool at the bottom.  One of the clowns pushed the other clown off the ladder.  There was a large splash at the bottom.  The clown that was still on the ladder laughed, but he slipped off the ladder and there was another splash.  The crowd roared with laughter. 

When the show was over,  the people who were in the show gave me a tour of the whole

circus.  They let me ride the horse.  They showed me the elephant.  They let me feed the baby leopard.  They even showed me tricks that weren't even in the show!  When the tour was over, they gave me a present.  It was a keychain that said "No Clowning Around!".  I couldn't wait until the next time the circus comes.

Home Sweet Home

                                       By:Nautalie Hemmat

 

     Tiffany was doing lots of gymnastics when she realized the circus was the best place to be. After 3 years, at Accel Gymanstics she knew she was ready. She was 17 and was looking for a circus to join. She could just imagine the audience and the flashing lights with the elephants and tightrope. One day, when she was on Burlingame Avenue she saw a ad it was for the circus! She got so excited she told her parents.

 

     When she told them that she has been dreaming of this moment for 3 years and she thought that it was wonderful. Fortunately, they let her go. As fast as lightning, she went a packed her luggage. It finally came the day of the audition. The man named Jake approved and she was off to the circus. She had to take on lots of pressure and responsibility. After lots of practice the circus came.

 

   There were at least 500 people in the theater. My heart was pounding and my wrists were sweating I was so nervous. I had been waiting for this moment my whole life and here it came. I ran to the rope and jumped high in the sky. It was a marvelous feeling, I heard o's and aw's from the audience. I started going for the tightrope.. I was never good at tightrope I jumped on and danced. I was so proud of myself I wanted to scream! I knew that this is what I have been waiting for 3 years.

 

   After the performance, I called home but no one seemed to answer. It seemed odd ,they were always home. When I looked to my right I saw my family. I hugged them and said I missed them but truly I hated to leave home. After a little bit I was off to training in the gym where the circus begins. I thought that the circus was amazing and I will continue doing it for many years.

The Circus Life

     Being in the circus might not be as you think. Circus life is hard and tough, but it can also be very fun and exciting!

     Hi, my name is Grace Wilson and I am part of a traveling circus! When i was just 3 years old I began practicing ballet. By the time that I was 12, I was doing ballet, gymnastics, and acrobatics. I worked very hard hoping that one day I could join the circus. By the time I was 15, my dream came true-I worked for a travleng circus!

     Not anyone can just join the circus. Anyone who wants to join has to have a specific talent, a certain body type, and have determination. The circus isn't all fun and games either. Performers work very hard to get ready for the next show.

     There are also some upsides to being in the circus. Performing in a show very exciting and traleving all around the globe is another highpoint. When I first started I didn't want to be so far away from my family, but it was really fun seeing all of the different countries and my family even traveled to places around the globe just to see me perform!

     Performing in the circus is a very fun and exciting life. I've had tons of fun being an acrobat, juggling and traveling around the world, but I have learned one thing, is you set your mind to it, anything is possible.

Hi! My name is Ioannina Sumaraw and I want to tell you about the life of a circus performer! It's actually hard to be a circus performer! Many people think it's all fun, games, laughing, and no bad days, but that is not the life of a circus performer. I will show you what the life of a circus performer really is.

      First, I always have to wake up early in the morning. I don't think there was one day in my circus life that I got to have my own day to myself. I always have to hear an annoying alarm everyday! Well, anyways, next thing! I eat breakfast in my pie car and since I'm always with my family, we all have the same schedule, so we always have breakfast together! After that, I get ready and I go into my one-room schoolhouse that travels with us wherever we go! It's fun because my classmates are from different cultures and I learn more! When I'm done with school, I'm already starting chores and training with my father! I'm always improving and trying new things, so it never gets old. Then, I eat dinner with my family, but not too much since I'm performing tonight. When that's done, I go do my shows! Obviously, when show's over, I'm beat and ready to go to sleep! Bad thing is that in 2 days from now I'm already packing up and going to be tired in another place! Now I'm in bed at MIDNIGHT! It sucks, but overall I have fun being in this job and will never stop! Well, maybe.

        So, that was my life! Now you know what a circus performer really does in this world! Hope you think differently! Bye-bye!

What happens mainly in the circus is that it isn't alway bubble gum and rainbows. You have to get up at sunrise and work until sunset. And you have to do that all week.And not  just anyone can join the circus. You need to be confedint, have the right body,and you need to have a sepicial talent.

In Rome,Italy a 11 year old boy named Frank was in the circus. I, Peter Fan, is a trainer. Every morning I wake up at 7:30 get dressed and then go to the food car. Today we are having a show so the crew is setting up the tents and lights.

At 9:00 I go to school. This school is normal it has computers, tests, homework, and report cards. The circus performers in the circus come from many places and speak French, Russian, Chinese, and Italian. When we learn our geography lessons sometimes we get to see the real deal.

 

3:30 school is over we practice our routine for the show. I am training elephants to blance on a beam. We first try and do it on lower ground. The elephants are sucssesful. Yay, I , the trainer is proud to be with the elephants. At:6:30 we eat in the food car. After a light dinner we get ready for our show in the afternoon.

 

9:00 the show is over I was so nervous I almost forgot my part. Now I'm pooped. I go to bed at 11:00. I also think of my home in California wondering if we will be able to stop performing and go back and live a peaceful live at home.

Even before I fell of the tightrope, I was having a sucky day. When I woke up at 7:00 I was on the ground, my blankets thrown all around me and I had a hurting back. By the time I had got my trailer and myself tidy I was 20 minutes late for breakfast. Then when  went to the pie car to grab sommrthing to eat, I discovered that everyone else had finished all the food, so I had to drink only cofee. 

 

Then when I was waking to our one room schoolhouse, I tripped on a bannnana peel and spilled cofee all over myself. When I went to study in the calssromm, everyone started laughing at me, as I was known for my flexibility and balance. Embarresed, I took a towl from the back and dryed myself off.

 

When I was  playing with my friend's juggling balls they all veered off course and fell on my head. In a fit of anger, I rushed off and slammed the door of my trailer. Then someone tried to pull a prank on me by putting a bucket full of water on my door. Me slamming the door had caused it to fall down and spill on my bed. I was so angry that I did not do anyone of my chores. 

 

Then for the finalle of bad things that day, when I was walking on the tightrope with everyone waching me, i fell off!!!

 

It was truly a very bad, no good, stinking day.

There is a lot going on in the circus. We do different kinds of tricks and many shows.

 

At our circus, some of our many performences include acrobatics and tighgtrope walking. We also work with many animals such as horses, leopards, elephants, lions, and chimpanzees.

 

Performing is very fun. If you put your mind to it anything is possible. I started performing when I was 11. Then, I wasn't even close to being perfect but I practiced and practiced. Now instead of only seeing the performences I can do them better than ever.

 

Our circus does ten shows a week. Two on Wednesday, Saturday, and Sunday and one on the rest of the days.

 

The circus is always a big job. There is almost no time to sit down and relax. When I come back from school I only have a short break before I have to go back to chores and then practice.

 

The circus is a big job and there is a lot going on. There are many animals, tricks, performers which means a lot of practice so it leaves almost no time to relax. No matter what, being in the circus is something you won't regret. You will love everything you do.
