Life in a Circus

      I was born in a circus, not like a crazy life, a real live circus with elephants, tigers, trapeze artists, and acrobats. I have been performing since I was five, I am eleven now and I have been riding and doing stunts off and on top of elephants for four years. when I was little, in my first years of preforming, I used to be the smallest and most-loved clown in the show. I used to wear a big fluffy red nose and with white face paint, red dimples, and a big fluffy rainbow-colored  head wig.

                              

                                         Show Time

Show day is my favorite day of the week. We woke up at seven o'clock this morning, ate our breakfast, then started getting ready for the show. Even though most shows start at night,we're different, and our show starts at ten in the morning. I went down to the trailer that I shared with my best friend Kayla, who was also an elephant performer. She was already dressed in her sparkly pink tee-shirt, black skinny jeans, knee-high white boots, white top hat, and a white walking stick with black tips. I know that this seems like a weird outfit to wear for riding an elephant, but we all have to mach the certain elephant that we were riding, so for me that meant white, black, and lime green. I walked over to my closet, and pulled out my outfit that i had had custom made for the biggest show of the year, and i was the opening act. My outfit consisted of black spandex pants, a white ruffled top, an elbow-length lime green jean jacket, a black and white top hat with a white rim, and a black walking stick with white tips. Kayla and I had to use walking sticks because as the opening act we had to open with us on elephants then doing a back flip off and then doing a dance. My dad is the ring master, so he is really important to my act, he needs to be able to direct the elephants in the right direction so i can do my tricks on its back without worrying about actually riding it.                                                          

                                   Lights, Camera, Action!                                                    I am waiting for my elephant to be brought to me when one of the handlers comes and says,"Becca, come quickly, we can't find Leafy!" I could barely hear him but I was so worried about my elephant that I couldn't think, then I came to my senses and ran as fast as I could toward the elephant stables. When I got to the stables I ran as fast as I could toward Leafy stall, but he wasn't there. This had only happened to me once before when I was nine and I forgot to latch the stall all the way, then I remembered where i had found him last time, eating hay! I was so happy that I had an idea where he might be, I took off running again calling his name as I went. When I thought that he was gone for good I reached the hay stack, ant there he was.

 

               The show ran smoothly, and I was the star of the show.  Everyone was amazed at how talented Leafy was and at the end of the show when they called my name i got a standing ovation that lasted for five minutes! This had to be my best show yet, and I was so sad to see it end. I love the circus, we are one big, loud, crazy family.

The Assisstant Clown's Broken Leg

 

     One day I went to a circus. I was thrilled to go. I had never been to the circus. I was going with my parents. They gave me five dollars to go get a drink. While I was walking, I saw one of the clowns. I went up to the clown and shook his hand. He said his name was Sammy. I left, but before I left he gave me a big red nose.

     When I came back, the show had stared. I sat by my parents. I was lucky to have front row seats because I could see everything. A few minutes later I saw Sammy. He said he wanted a volunteer. I raised my hand as fast as I could. He saw me and called me. He told on to his hand. I jumped on. Then he put us through a ring of fire. I was really scared. It was getting really hot so I was slipping. Suddenly, I fell and part of my leg was on fire and I had broken my leg. I screamed really loud.

     I think I had fell unconcious and just had a dream. When I awoke I saw I was in a hospital bed. I saw my parents and they  rushed to me. My mom was sobbing a lot. I looked on the other side and I saw the clown Sammy. Sammy was holding "Sorry" balloons in his hand. I was really sad for Sammy because he could have lost his job. I asked my parents how long had I been unconcious. They said for three days. I looked down at my right foot. I saw part of it was cut off. The other leg was broken really bad. Then I asked Sammy if he had lost his job. He said yes. I felt bad for Sammy.

     Few weeks later I had had surgery. I had got a mechanical right foot. I had crutches for my leg. I was walking with Sammy down the sidewalk. He was looking to get back into clown business. He walked to his old circus. They said he could join but he had to have a professional volunteer for his tricks. Sammy said he would join. Now everybody was happy. Just how I liked it.

One type of circus preformer is an acrobat. An acrobat is a person who does things like flipping off a trampoline into a net, or flips off of those swings that have a bar instead of a seat. Hi, My name is Jack and am an acrobatic performer. Today night we had a show and it was great! There were so many clowns, one wheeled motorcycles, a trapeze and many acrobats. The crowd was wild and there were more than 20,000 people! Let me tell you a full view about it.

 

     Our first act was the trapeze act. The trapezist swung between both ropes and hung upside down. Then his partner lit a torch and set the rope on fire. The trapezist then ran on top of the rope and he jumped back down.

 

     The next act was the acrobatics and the act I was in! I swung on the rope and my partner lit a hoop on fire. I quickly flung and went right through the hoop. After this the crowd cheered.

 

     Our final act was the animal act. We let out the horses and lions. The lions jumped through a ring of fire and then were bouncing on the trapeze. Then the horses ran through the crowd and balanced on the balance beam.

 

     This show was great and I hope our next one is like this one too!

Hi! I'm Jose, and I'm and acrobat. Today night we had a big show in Los Angeles, and it was great! There were clowns, unicyclists, actors who did the trapeze, acrobats like me, and many other people. Let me tell you all about it.

 

Our first act was the trapeze. The actor who did the trapeze swung upside down and right side up near the top of the tent. Meanwhile, a tightrope walker walked across a rope at between two towers. The crowd applauded.

 

The next act was the animal trick act. Five tigers stood on top of each other and the one at the top waved a flag. The crowd liked this a lot. There was huge applause.

 

The act after that was the act I was in. Me and my trapeze partner, Bob, did loops forwards an backwards in the air while swinging back and forth, while at the same time, clowns did acts like walking into each other to make the audience laugh. The audience liked this act the best. They applauded very loudly.

 

The last act was when all the actors came onstage and did their acts at the same time. The audience was laughing and applauding at the same time! After this act was done, the audience gave us circus performers a standing ovation. We bowed.

 

This performance was great. I hope the next one is like this one, too!

Even though you live in a circus, yo still have to go to school. But the cool thing is when you do geography, your lesson can come alive. Now that is cool. Also since you are a circus performer your classmates are from all around the world and they can speak other languages like French, Russian, or Italian.

 

Sometimes, you can take breaks and do other cool things like play with other circus performers. After that, it's back to work. You do your chores and practice your acts. Then you eat and get ready for the night's show. After the show. You pack up for the ride to the next town. Life in the circus can be difficult.

Life in a Circus

 

 

        "Now follow the routine as we planned it, Zachary." "The lion will be in front of the elephants which is in front of the zebras," I said. "We'll also need to get that spotlight in place, Alvin. Yes, it'll come on right after the animals leave. "Now, Rishabh, remeber to give yoiurself a bath after rehearsl." Sigh. "Yes, you have to Rishabh, you're always getting yourself dirty. Brandon, please take the cheetah, the leopard, and the tiger out for a walk. Hurry up people! We only have a few hours left!

        I'm Steven Ho, the circus manager, and we were having the biggest show of the year. We were going to have the chance to perform in front of the presidents all over the world! If they liked our circus, the Wonderful Animal Circus, they would spread the word around and we could be performing all over the world! Not only that, they would give us a lot of money to upgrade our circus!

        I had thought that it would be easy, like every time we perform, but it was a lot harder than I had thought. We had to make sure that the place was clean, unlike before, and we also had to make it so that it looked fancy, also unlike before.

        Finally, it was time. They appeared just very fancily, wearing clothes made from the finest material. I began, "Welcome to the Wonderful Animal Circus! Today, we will show you the wonderful skill of our performers!" They then applauded, to my surprise.

       We did the best we could, going through the whole thing without a single mistake. After it was over, I went over to them and asked,"Well, what do you think of the Wonderful Animal Circus?" They looked at each other, agreed on something and said,"It was wonderful! We were amazed and will spread the word as we promised! We will also give you the money that we also promised you."

        A few days later, I received some mail from each of the presidents. Inside each one was $1,000,000! I was flabbergasted. I couldn't believe it! There was enough money to create two more circuses! We soon attracted a lot more people, and made more money. But the only reason was because the presidents had watched our circus.

You might think what I do. I am a tightrope walker. My story is a very sad one. I used to be a rapper with  my friend Macklemore, but we got sick of the whole business, because rent started becoming high, and we were drove out of our store. So we joined the circus.

Hi, this  is circus actor Saurav Sharma!

I am a tightrope walker. I am known as the best tightrope walker in the world. Most circuses hire me to entertain the audience. I was once called as a tightrope walker from Europe and I fell of the rope. Luckily, there was a trampoline under me and I bounce back up and caught the rope.

The Circus

 

  Everyone thinks circus life is fun, easy, and all you do is clown around. The truth is, circus life is hard, and you need to have a specific talent and train hard. Thats why your friend don't just run away from home and become a famous trapeze artists. That's why, I, Bobby Chan, is here to warn you not everyone could be part of a circus.

 

   Usually, if your a circus performer, you are rarely at home. Instead, you are on a train, traveling around the world. I would rather stay at home than ride on this train, having a headache while typing and reading this story. There's not enough space to play any kind of sport. It's rather boring around here.

 

   During the afternoon, we feed, and groom the animals. we also spend the time training for tonight's performance. We do all kinds of tricks such as juggling, and acrbatics. As I said, it is not as easy as you think. We had to train for years just to get a perfect flip.

 

   I'm wiped out now. It's right now 10:30 P.M., right after the show. I just walked back to the train for a nice long sleep. It's much more conforting to sleep at home rather than over here. I'm warning you: Being a circus performer is not conforting.

Bella lives in a big trailer with her family working in a circus. Bella wakes at 9:00 A.M. School time. Our one-room schoolhouse travels with us. Like any school, ours has computers, tests, and report cards. Because the circus performers are from all over the world, many of my classmates speak other languages:French, Russian, and Italian, like my family.As we travel around the country, our geography lessons come alive.

 

 

         3:00 P.M. School?"s over time for a quick break. The clowns let me play with their unicycles and joggling is too small for a large pet. I"d like to join a soccer team, but we"re never in one place long enough.

 

 

3:30 P.M Chores and practice. I feed, water, and groom the horse use in our horseback acts. Today, my dad practices somersaulting off a running horse. I"m working on leaping from a trampoline onto the horse"s back; it takes balance and concentration. 
Other kids are practicing  joggling and acrobatics. Our neighbor walks baby leopards on a leash. trainers are working with elephants, lions, and chimpanzees.

THE CIRCUS!

Clown Circus

Clap clap clap. The crowd is super amazed about what me and my partner just did. Hi I'm Bob and this a story about me and my circus life.

 

Well at first, there was a town in circus that needed people with special talents and good confidence, they should be confident workers. So I said to myself, " Why not try out. Right?" I didn't know that this was the start of a new life for me, but let me tell you what happened.

 

After a lot of stretching, I was finally ready to get in the circus. I was a super great juggler so I tried to for the clown that juggles. I was one of the two clowns that made the try outs.

 

After that I had a daily schedule and it was pure circus life after that. After a few months it was time for my first show. Me and my partner were juggling together and everything turned out great.

 

This was a clown circus so everyone was a clown, but the main clowns were me and my partner. We had the star act which came at the very end.

 

We tried even harder for the next show. Our starring act was even better. We were juggling flaming torches together. There were six of them.

 

At the next show there was a sign saying:

CLOWN CIRCUS:

STARRING BOB AND HIS AMAZING PARTNER BOBBY

 

That is my story, and now we are in the present. I finally retired after 10 years of performing. Although being in a circus is hard, if you are determined and hard-working, you are a recipe for success.

One day, I entered a circus in Paris, France as a juggler. There were people from France, Japan, and Australia that I met. Here's a typical day for us. 

       At 6:30 A.M., I wake up to go to the pie car to eat breakfast while crews set up the tent. At 7:45 A.M., It's schooltime at the one-room schoolhouse that travels with us. We have school from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M.

       At 3:30 p.m., practice starts. I practice juggling 10 balls for tonight's show. At 7:00 p.m. Dinnertime. I eat rice with egg every Friday, but rice with soup everyday. Our shows are from 7:30-10:00 p.m.

       At 10:30 p.m. I go to sleep, and I think about my real home in California. Every night I think about it. I miss my home, but I have to deal with it.

A Day At the Circus

 

          One day, I woke up and jumped out of my bed. This is unusual for me because usually, I sulk in bed for at least thirty minutes before I drag myself out of my bed. Anyway, I threw on my clothes and clumsily brushed my teeth. I accidentally got toothpaste in my eye but couldn't help rushing. Today, I was going to the circus!

 

          Once  my parents and my sister woke up, I nagged them until they got out of bed. I flew down the stairs and probably set a world record for the fastest time for running down the stairs. I poured myself a bowl of cereal and accidentally poured milk on my shirt. At this point, I decided to slow down a bit. By the time we all ate breakfast, the show was about to start. We sprinted to our old Toyota Prius and started the one hour drive to the Afro Circus

 

           By the time we got there, I could hardly contain my excitement.We grabbed a few bags of popcorn and leisurely stalked to our seats. As we nonchalantly chatted away, we didn't notice the ringmaster come out. Suddenly, the crowd stopped talking as the ringmaster talked about the acts. The show was about to start!

 

          The first act started a few moments after the ringmaster left. An acrobat named Tom came out and did some flips that seemed impossible to human kind! As the acts went by, I watched every one intensely. One of my favorite acts was when a clown juggled on a unicycle while holding a beach ball on his nose. My all time favorite act happened at the end of the show. By then, I felt like anything was possible. For the end of the show, a performer set a ring on fire, and had a tiger jump through it! I watched wide-eyed as the crowd went wild.

 

          As we left the circus, I longed to see more. I asked my parents if we could come back. They thought about it for a moment and said, "maybe another time." As I think about all the circuses I have been to, I always think the Afro circus was the best of them all. You're probably wondering how this circus got it's name now. Why, that's because all the performers wore a rainbow colored Afro on top of their heads!

MY LIFE IN THE CIRCUS

                                     BY RUBEN RIBERA

    The circus is a great thing to watch but have you ever wondered what its like to be in the circus? My names Ruben and I am a tamer for the circus. I realized I wanted to be a tamer when I was 7 because I went  to see the circus. Then I saw the tamer come out with a huge lion, and the lion did what the tamer said. So I went home and told my mom that I wanted to be a tamer. She told me,"If I wanted to be a tamer I would have to practice all day every day." She really didn't want me to go to the circus, but she knew it was my dream.                                                      

   I'm 11 now and I've ben in the circus for 2 years. I've loved being in the circus but I haven't performed yet. But I can't be sad because today is my birthday and my friend Travis said he'll give me my present before tonights show. I've been wondering if I could ever perform in the circus? But everyone says I can't becauger thse I'm younger then them. I asked Travis if he could tell me what he got me for my birthday, but he wouldn't tell me. So he kept practicing for the circus, but I never knew what he does in the circus. He said,"That it was one of the biggest jobs in the circus, so I started of what his job could of been. I thought that he could of been the conductor, but I knew he was to young to be the conductor. But all the other jobs were aready taken so I thought he just helped around the circus.

   It was 4 hours before the circus started and Travis still hasnn't gave me my present, and I couldn't find him. So I just went to help other people get ready for the circus. It's 30 minutes before the circus starts and everyone is ready for the circus but Travis. But then I heard Travis's voice really loud then I figured out what his job is. He was our new announcer! Then he said to the croud,"Please welcome our new tamer Ruben!" Everyone cheered for me as I came out of the back and I saw 100's of people all staring at me. I've never been more scared but excited in my whle life! So if you ever wonder what its like to be in the circus, remember it might be hard but in the end it's always worth it.
                                           THE END

The Circus Junction

     

       One warm windy day I was taking a walk through the neighborhood. As I was walking I happened to see a poster that said "Circus in town, get your tickets before its to late!" I was so exited I went right home and told my mother. Unfortunately my mother didn't like the circus. I begged her and told her it would be at a fair, finally she said yes.

 

     It was a week from now but I was still so eager. I bought three tickets one for me, one for my friend, and one for my mother just in case she changes her mind. It was Friday now and tomorrow was the show. I could barely sleep soon I fell into a deep sleep. When I woke up it was already 8:05 and the show started at 8:00! I was late!

 

       I quickly woke up my mother and we drove off it was 8:09 we made it there with just enough time to meet Daisy. I begged my mom one more time and told her I bought her a ticket, she said yes. It turns out the show was also running late we made it just in time!

 

    The show was amazing it had acrobats, monkeys, clowns, juggling,elephants, and so much more. It turns out my mom loved the performance she was cheering and clapping the whole way though it! afterwards we played many games at the fair I even got a goldfish! When it was 9:00 P.M. I headed home.

 

      I said goodbye to Daisy and went to bed. My mom told me she thought the circus was a fraud and thanked me for showing her what a circus was all about. I will never forget the day I went to the circus with my mom and Daisy! The End!

What's exciting about the circus is you get to do the most amazing tricks and stunts at  certain shows.My name is Alex and I am a circus juggler.My usual routine is I wake up in the morning,eat breakfast,and get ready for school.After school I do my homework and change for my  juggling practice.When I get home I change to go to bed and brush my teeth. 

    The next day, I get to rest.It's Saturday morning,I have no practice until next week.Sometimes when I go to school kids ask me how it's like to work in a circus.I tell them it's easy I say at certain times I get to juggle easy things like bean bags,rings,and bowling pins.In harder times I have to juggle either in high places or walk on a rope while juggling.

     On Monday, I have to start my routine all over again and have juggling practices.When I get to practice today my teacher tells me I am old enough to juggle objects that are a little more harder to juggle for my age.I got excited but nervous at the same time.I told my parents what they told me at practice.They told me they were excited for me and to try my best.So I did what they told me.The next day at practice I did try my best.My teacher told me I am going to try to juggle three objects and shes going to throw things in while i am juggling.               

       Next week is my first annual circus show in Los Angles.I am so excited to perform in this show.My teacher told me I can try my new juggling trick in the show as a grand finale.Today I am going to practice for the show.The first three objects I am going to juggle are a ball,a bean bag,and a ring.       

      Today is the day that I perform in the circus show.It's close to the end of the show and I'm all ready to perform.It's the end of the show and I get my things all together.I'm done with the show.I did it!I performed in the show.Finally I'm done with the circus business until next year.

Life in the Circus

 

In the circus, you have to prepare for a lot of training to be in the circus. You could also train on a special talent that you excell at. In the circus, you wake up at sunrise and go to bed at sundown. Also if you are a kid traveling with the circus, you have to go to school in a one room schoolhouse that travels with the circus. After school, you have a break before practice for the actual circus. After practice, you have dinner. After dinner, the real circus show begins.People go on unicycles, go on horses, swinging acrobats, yelling hyenas, and dancing elephants. After the show, all the circus preformers, clowns, animals, and kids go to sleep in their trailers. By then, it is past sundown. The next day, they will be either be having a regular day or they will be traveling to an other city, or state, or country, or continent. Maybe someday you will grow up to be a circus preformer.

Today I got the chance to perform with my family members. I got to walk the tight rope. I trained the whole day and I did did it. I would walk  across a tight rope and then, clilmb down and do a flip from a trampoline on the one of the horses.

 

Tonight was the night of the performance. I was walking the tight rope. I thought I was doing good, then I fell off. I landed on one of the horses and she was very startled. She bucked me off and I dived into a pool of water. I was  fine, but that was a very scary circus expeirence.

First thing as a circus you wake up really early in the morning you have to wake up at 7:00 A.M.  you have to travel 20,000 miles in seven months each year ,visiting 150 cities. We work to sunup to sun down.

By the way my name is Jojo that's my nick name our school room travels with us we have a dog named tank he's very playful.We practices a lot to get ready for the show.We don't eat much because we are going to performing tonight.

 We do 10 shows a week  one each weekday,plus a matinee on Wednesday, two on Saturday, and two on Sunday.

Performing in California

 

      Once upon a time there was a girl named Lizbeth who has been living most of her life in a circus. She had been performing in the circus since she was very young. She loved to perform in front of audiences and wasn't very shy. She rode in trailers to go to new places and was usually busy when she was going to perform that day. Her mind was also very full on the days she had to perform because she was always trying to remember her performances. But every year she is always very excited to perform.

       Every year when Lizbeth performs she is excited when she goes to California because she gets to see her friends who live there. When she is there Lizbeth also has time to hang out with her friends when she has time. Sometimes they even stay a little longer so she can have more time with them.

       When Lizbeth and the rest of the circus performers visit California they usually do the same type of theme,which is animals. Here is one of the schedules Lizbeth did while in California:

 

      7:00 A.M. They all wake up,get dressed, then go eat breakfast. While they go to the breakfast are there are circus people already setting up the area for the performance.
The area is green with some trees surrounding it. Everything they are setting up is red and white. We sometimes help them set up some things if we have some spare time.

 

 

      9:00 A.M.- 3:00 P.M. Lizbeth has school, it is kind of like a regular school. The school goes everywhere they go since they don't spend much time in one place for Lizbeth to go to school. She learns almost the same things other people learn at other schools, but she learns about performing and other things about the circus the most at school.

 

      3:00 P.M. Lizbeth's school is finally over she gets some time for free time. For her break she sometimes practices for her  performances. Lizbeth also sometimes plays with some of the equipment there. Some of the things she does would be to juggle, play with her pet cat, Fluffy, or just watches some of the circus animals. She sometimes even gets to go hang out with her friends.

 

      3:30 P.M. Lizbeth practices some more for her performance until she thinks she has had enough practice. Lizbeth is going to be involved on riding a horse her performance. She very happy because she loves to ride horses. For that performance it will mostly be about horses.

 

      6:00 P.M. Lizbeth and the rest of the members eat a little bit of dinner, then they get ready to perform.

 

      6:30 P.M. They wait a while while everyone is entering. Lizbeth takes a peek to see if she sees her friend, which she does, and she is very excited to perform.There are many lights there but as the show starts the lights lower just a bit. They all enter riding a horse. Lizbeth's horse is white with some brown spots. As she looks at the audiences she smiles big at her friends.

 

      10:30 P.M. The show is finally over everyone just wants to go back to the trailers and rest. While everyone is getting ready to sleep Lizbeth is just thinking when she will see her friends again.

       As you can see, Lizbeth was very happy to see her friends in California and can't wait to go next year again!

Circus Life

 

My name is Bella, I work at a circus.

Every day very early in the morning I wake up get dressed and head over to the Pie car where I have breakfast. Still like any other child I go to school but in a one room school-car. After schools over I do some chores like polishing the tricycles and feeding the circus animals. Then after my chores I, practice my act and my feats.

Finally I end my day with dinnertime.

But NO, I head over to the show and let the audience see my amazing act!

After the show, I take a shower, brush my teeth, and head to bed. Then I think to myself: All in a days work at the circus.

One day my best friend and I were walking home from school and we saw a poster for help wanted at the circus. We both agreed to do it and if only one of us gets accepted the other doesn't go unless we have no choice what so ever."I can't wait for the auditions." Vanessa said. "Niether can I well oh yah did you read when the audition is and where or even what time it is?" I asked " Umm maybe I'm not sure if I did or not." "Vanessa come on, I'll look at it tomorrow." "Night" "Night".

The next day we  went to the form and it was that day so we went to the auditions and I got in but she didn't and she told me that if I didn't go she would hancough me to the circus owners car.

So I went it lasted for six months I txted her every night before I went to bed. In the circus i did trapeze and I always got the most attention. The six months where over an I finally got to go home. I think I'll do this next year. And that's my circus story.

Life In The Circus

  Hi, my name is Joelle Luoma and I live with my family on a train. We are a part of the circus called the Luoma Circus. Every week we perform at least 7 shows, each one in a different town. I love performing as a circus acrobat but there are some different ups and downs of the circus life. We have to stay up late and rise early, plus amongst all of the commotion the children still have to go to school. I also have chores which aren't so bad because I get to work with different animals that most people don't get to see. Another good thing is that I get to travel around the world and see many places and meet different people who speak different languages. I guess overall I really like the circus life and think that it is better than regular everyday life. If you want to join the circus do it quick because it is lots of fun!

During a circus you have to first get ready and eat a good breakfast.In order to have a good circus you need good sleep. You also need to get the tent set up and get the animals ready.

             When you start you need to get out their and have fun. their would be horses,elephants,lions, jaguars ,accrobatics,clowns and much more.

             At the end you would have to clean up after the watchers,animals, and yourself. When you get home you take a good rest and prepare for the next circus act.

One day in the magical season of fall, I was with my circus family. We were setting up our tents and as we were doing so a family came up."We are the Jeuffers and we would like to buy front row seats to spectate your circus, Cirque De Lo, and its acts."As I heard that, I shivered. I just knew they were inspectors. If they gave us a bad review, the circus would be ruined." Okay sir. " I took the money and gave them their tickets. Hopefully, they wouldn't come for the matinee. And then they were off, as quick as a blink of the eye. I called David, our lion tamer, over and told him about the inspectors. He looked scared, and may I remind you he was a lion tamer, so he called the owner.The owner, whose name is Lou, warned everybody, all the clowns, acrobats, tamers, and all the rest. "We better make a really good show tonight for if we do horrible we go out of business!" yelled out Lou. And that didn't take a nanosecond for everybody to get practicing. I was just watching, for I just sold lemonade and tickets. The show was going to be a spectacular. Everybody looked so graceful practicing, but I,Timmy, just knew something was going to happen.                                                                                As the day went on, the tent got fully set up. Dawn was coming and everybody was on their toes. "Everybody it's showtime!!" exclaimed Lou, who look like he wasn't scared, but everybody knew he was shaking inside. Then dawn came. Cirque De Lo was about to start. The Jeuffers were the first people to come.Then everybody else came. We started with are opening act with the clowns doing jokes and skits. Then we showed our four graceful acrobats, Trixie, Daisy, Melissa, and Dave. They did amazing stunts in the air and on the ground. Then, they came out with all of them combined, with a pyrotechnic end.The review from the Jeuffers was " Wow!" and "Amazing!" The Cirque De Lo became a big hit. We got even more costumers from that point. A couple years later, a fire broke out and Cirque De Lo became a end. I survived the fire to tell the story.

I, Logan Jenkins, am at the first circus i have went to.  I was really excited i have never been to a circus.  I hope it will be fun because I drove from Alabama to New York.                                                                                                                                                                       I got in my seat and waited for the show to start.Finally the host spoke in the microphone and said,Welcome ladies and gentlemen to our circus. There was something coming out of the curtain but then i realize it was a big elephant.I guess I'm going to be scared for the rest of the show,because i have never been to a circus.                                                                                                                  After two hours of horror i remembered i had a backstage pass.  I didn't want to see more horror but i spent a lot of money on this.The man looked at my pass and said i could go in.  I saw people taking pictures of clowns, petting animal, and  people feeding a lion!                                                                                                                                                                                                                           I  was scared of lions i just wanted to leave.When i was trying to leave a man spoke to me and said, Do you want to work in the circus?  I wanted to say no but something made me say yes.  The man said fallow me and i fallowed him.  He walked inside a big room, the big room had costumes and masks.The man finally said his name, it was Ian Smith.  He was the host.                                                               Ian asked me what i wanted to be in the circus.  I really don't know, I said. The Mmissing Ttiger

           Once upon a time there was a girl named Elizabeth.(Lizzy for short!) Lizzy lives an amazing life at a circus. She got to travel around the world. She see's many different places that have very different people with interesting cultures. Another thing about Lizzy is that she has a best friend that performs with her. Her best friend is a white tiger named  "The amazing Tortellini.".

            Lizzy and Tortellini do a very fun act in the circus. They do a trick  where Lizzy rides in on two white horses. Tortellini is stuck in a cage on the other side of the area being laughed at by three clowns. Lizzy dodges a number of different obstacles and jumps of off the two white horses. she land on a big rubber ball and works her way over to the cage. When she gets there she jumps off of the ball sending it forward and knocking out the first clown. then she uses karate on the other two. She saves the tiger and the crowd go's wild. She often does photo's after each act.

             one day Lizzy got out of bed and went to see Ttortellini but, he wasn't there. she asked the worker that was on cage duty if he knew where the tiger was but he didn't. She looked every where and asked every single worker that she possibly could if they had seen the tiger. They all let her down. The next day her parents,(who were clowns putting on all their makeup for the big shoe tonight), let her go to town. She hung posters up all over town. Soon the news about the missing tiger was every where even on the news. the animal catchers were every where, patrolling the city, dart guns in hand. Lizzy decided to go search for the tiger her self.

               In just seven days she had been to three different states looking and asking people about tortellini. In approximately two months she had been to two different country's and to so many different states that she lost count, and she still had no sign of the tiger. Meanwhile back at home, Lizzy's parents had sent out three search party's every day, three times a day. they were worried sick about their little girl.

              A couple of months later , Lizzy had made it all the way from AAustin Texas, to some where in London. She had not even seen a hair from the soft, furry, coat of the white tiger. " It's like he just dissapeared." She thought. Then all of the  sudden some thing knocks her over from behind, and starts licking all over her face.  When the licking finally stopped, Lizzy looked up and saw some thing that was very unexpected.  Tortellini was standing right in front of her looking as happy as could be. " Tortellini!" screamed Lizzy. " I thought I'd never see you again!!!" And Lizzy took her best friend and went home.

            After about five months of walking, jogging, and running, Lizzy and the tiger finally made it back home. Lizzy was thinking about how her parents were going to act when they saw her. Were they going to ground her for the rest of her life? Were they going to make me clean up elephant poo for a month or two? Well there's only one way to find out. She thought. So she tied Tortellini to a post and went into her parents trailer.  As soon as her parents saw her they jumped up and gave her a giant hug. They told her that they missed her so much and how they wouldn't let the circus go on without you. They also told her how they new that she would find her way back home because she was such a determined young lady. But the two things they didn't do was ground her or make her clean up the Elephant poo.

           Lizzy grew up and started a circus of her own. She had a lot of animals and people doing very different acts. but the best act out of all of them was the one including a little girl and her best friend. The white tiger.

                                                  

 

 The end

One day in the circus a Dad, a son, and a daughter were going to a circus.  Their mom was shopping.  That was her favorite thing to do.  They were in line and saw a clown.  Both the son and the daughter got a balloon animal.  They got their tickets and took a seat front row.

 

During the circus, they saw a tiger, a lion, and a seal.  It was so fun balloons everywhere.  The daughter got scared when the seal jumped through the ring of fire.  At the intermission, the three of them got snacks.  The rest of the circus they had fun watching.

 

After the circus they drove home.  They told their mom all about it.  They had enough time to tell her.  They fell right asleep at 12:00 a.m.  It was the best night of their lives the kids said.

The life at the circus

 

 

               If you think that the circus is fun then you are thinking just like me. Me, Kautious McNeil, loves working at the circus. Me and my family live in a gigantic mansion. We travel all over the world every 6 months. We visit 250 cities each year.

 

           This is the time I get up every day to work:

 

                 6:30 A.M. I get up and brush my teeth, wash my face , take a shower and get dressed.Then I go to the kitchen to get some pancake and sausages.We all setup the lights, the tents, adn music for tonight.

         

 

                   9:30 A.M. is school time, I get all of my books and things for school. Then I put inside my bookbag just in case I need it for school. Just like any other kind of school we had computers, desks and ect. Because, I was a circus performer all over the world, some of my classmates had different languages:Chinese, Japinese, Russian.

The more we would travel the more I would learn about it in school.

 

               3:30 P.M. it is dissmissal time in school, meant that it was time to go home. The clowns let me ride their small cars and their juggling balls. I also played with my puppy,Pluto. Now its almost time for me to practice for the circus. so i put up Pluto and began to clean up.

 

                   6:30 P.M. dinner time now. after I have finish dinner, now it's time to go to the show. We do a show every saturday and friday.

now the show is over at  10:45 P.M. I am so tired now, I am so ready to go home and get in the bed and go to sleep.

 

             1:30 A.M. Now I am in bed. I'm dreaming about becoming a acrobat this time. I can not wait until it is time for the touring season. I cannot wait until we go to Flordia for the summer break. Still when I grow up I want to be an acrobat in the circus. Do you think that will happen? It's still tough, busy, and fun just like always.

The Circus!

 

      Have you ever been to the circus? If not well don't worry today I'll tell you all about the circus. I'm Jane Parks I'm originally a Circus Acrobat from Circus Town you may or may not have heard of it but I travel all over the U.S. My mother and father Mr and Mrs Robin and Mike Parks Travel with me. They're also in the circus. My mother is a tightrope walker, and my father is a circus juggler, but lets talk more about the circus and not about me.

 

      The circus is a terrific place. We travel about 20,000 miles every year, you think that's a pain in the neck take a look at my schedule below.

 

    Here's my schedule:

 

   7:00 A.M. - I get up brush my teeth and my hair get dressed and go down to the pie-car to eat breakfast while the crew sets up for tonights performance. (The pie-car is where circus performers go to eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner.)

 

   9:30 A.M.-2:30 P.M. - Time for school. Our school isn't that big it's a one room school house but we still have just about everything regular schools have like computers, tests, report cards and reading logs. Sometimes as we travel we perform with people that don't speak our language like once we were performing in Mexico and most of the students in my class spoke Spanish, I know a little Spanish but not enough to communicate with them so I just stayed quiet.

 

   3:00 P.M.- School is over. This is usually the time to take a break and relax and play with friends or pets. I usually go to play with the my dog Snowball.

 

   3:30 P.M.- 6:00 P.M.- At this time I would probably be doing daily chores and practice. I water, feed, and groom the three horses that we perform with. Then I have to put the head and body piece on the elephants.

 

   6:30 P.M.- Time for dinner. Before our show we go back to the pie-car for dinner, but don't eat to much because after dinner we perform and the last thing you want is to get a stomach ache in the middle of the show, trust me its happened to me before.

 

   7:00 P.M.- Getting ready for the show as I put on my performance suit.

 

   11:00 P.M. - Show is over the day is done. I am exhausted and ready to fall back on the bed and go to sleep.

 

   12:00 A.M.-In bed ... falling .......asleep... Zzz... sorry dozed off there for a second. Well I better end this before I doze off again.

 

 

   Well there you have it, a nice little schedule about what happens in the circus everyday. I'm getting a little tired myself I better hit the hay before I fall asleep too.

A Circus Life

                   It is hard to work at a circus.It is hard to be a circus performer because you have to go to wake up and get ready then you need to go to school, do chores,practice, eat dinner, take a shower, then go to sleep.If you think that working at the circus is really fun, it is but you also have to do your living like any other and especially a lot more.

 

 

                   At 7:00 they have to wake up and get dress.Then they go to a pie car to eat breakfast.Then after they have o prepare for the show that going to happen tonight.So they first have to set up the tents.When there done doing that they then go fix the lighting.Afterwards they fix up the music and make sure everything is going just fine.

 

                   At 9:00 after they are done setting up for the show tonight,they have to then go to school like any other family.There school might not be like ours but they still have to do test,reports, and a lot of homework.They also have computers like any other school.They don't just do that they also have to speak many different languages  because they travel around the whole world and the countries they sometimes go they speak different languages like French,Russian,and Italian.As they travel around the country their geographic lesson comes alive.

 

                  At 3:30 they have to start doing a lot of chores.First they feed,water, and groom.then they also sometimes practice while doing there chores. So like your dad might uses somersaulting off a running horse.You would work on leaping on a trampoline onto the horses back, it takes a lot of balance and concentration.The others are then practicing juggling and acrobatics.Their neighbors walk baby leopards on a leash.The other trainers are working with the animals such as elephant,lions,and chimpanzees.

 

                 At 6:30 It is dinnertime and the family and they go to eat at the pie car, but they don't really eat much because they are performing and they might do flips and they don't really want to bommet.If you work at the circus you have to work 10 shows a week so if you are going to be a circus person it might be tiring.

 

                 At 10:30 when the show is over you might be wiped out and you have to walk it back to your trailer passing the circus office,conssesion stands, stables and trailers.Then two days from there they would go to another town and setup.

 

                At 12:00 you take a shower and think about how you did in the touring season. You might want to move back to your hometown where you were born.Then you go to sleep.

 

                 When you grow up you may want to be a circus performer and think it will be fun but it may also be a hard challenge because you have lots of things to do  in the morning throughout the night and get to have a little sleep.The circus is fun but is a busy and a tough life.

   And thats my story of how my life is in the circus.

I'm just an average kid, with one exception. I work at the circus. Although most people think that being in the circus is an easy job, they're wrong. I have a very busy schedule. I'm occupied for most of the day.

              In the morning, I go to the pie cart and eat breakfast (7:00 A.M.) then I go to school at 9:00. I learn geography and math today. Soon, my geography lesson will come alive when we move to another city. At three school is over. I get a break for awhile. I get to ride on the unicycles and juggle, but soon my break is over. At three thirty I go do my chores and practice, I groom the horses and give them oats and a bucket of water. I have to keep my skills up so I can do the shows.

               Three hours later at six thirty I go get dinner with my family. We don't eat too much because we have a show and don't want to get cramps. I go to the main circus tent and get ready for the upcoming show. Lights. Camera. Action. The stage comes to life as everyone moves about. I brace myself and do a triple back flip of a diving board into a tub full of water. As I do this I think that it's really strange that my parents want me to do circus. They never get worried that I would fall or sprain an ankle, or even break a bone! I wonder why. Is it because they believe I have something for circus and I'm very talented? Or maybe they're just careless. Whatever the case they don't worry that I'll fall. I come out of the water and a lion jumps over my head. The crowd cheers. I leap out of the water and run up a ladder. A tightrope comes into my field of view and my heart starts thumping. This is my favorite part. I start walking across the tightrope. I pretend to lose my balance halfway through. The crowd gasps. Just as it seems I'm going to fall I grab the rope with my feet and lift my arms up to pull myself across. I get off the ladder at the other end and leap onto a horse that then throws me right onto another horse. That horse throws me up in the air and I come falling back to the earth, but, a lion comes and breaks my fall. I get off and take a bow. The crowd goes wild. They talk with each other and make gestures with their hands.

               All the performers go back to there trailers. I'm exhausted, but I can't wait until the next show. Now it's ten thirty so I go back to my trailer. On the way there are lots of venders and booths, but most don't have anyone in them. When I get back to my trailer I plop down on my bed, exhausted. I can't wait until the next show. I think about how in two days I'll be leaving this city and move to the next. I drift off to sleep on a matter of minutes.

The Chicago Circus

                

          

 

                       There once was a circus in Chicago. It had all kinds of animals, elephants, lions, tigers, bears, ponies, horses.  We have kids on motor cycles riding in cages shaped like a ball, the bear juggling on top of a ball, the horses and ponies dancing to Mexican music, the elephant squirting water to the audience, lions doing the hula hoop, and the tiger goes through a hoop, but, the hoop is on fire.   One day Melanie went to school and handed out flyers for the show.  The flyers worked because a lot of people came.  But this show was not good because the tiger got on fire when he went through the hoop. Then the whole tent got on fire. It was a disaster.  Then they lost the job.

 

                     

 

                     It was a month later, Melanie's dad got a call on his phone. I wake up in the at 7:00 A.M. in the morning. I look out the trailer window to see the birds are still chirping for the sun to rise and I can smell the sent of pancakes and bacon coming from the pie car. My favorite! I run over to dad's bed and tug his covers off with a rip. Oops, i probably shouldn't tell him about that, good thing he was asleep. I walk away like nothing happened, suddenly i hear a loud roar. Uh oh was a lion loose. I turned around to see my dad was the one making all that noise. Seriously. "Somebody was bugging me in my sleep!" my dad says loudly. I start laughing so hard I fall over. He does this almost every morning, it's hilarious. We walk over to the pie car and gobble down our breakfast. School starts at 9:00 A.M. so i have to get ready fast. In our school people speak different languages. Another thing cool about our school is that as we travel on tour for our circus our social studies lessons come to life. 3:00 P.M. School is over and I get to play around a bit with the clowns. This is the only free time I have during the day. 3:30 P.M. and it's time to practice my act. Today I am practicing jumping from a trampoline onto a horses back. My dad is practicing somersaulting off of a running horse. 6:30 P.M. is when dinner comes around I can't pick out the sent of what the cooks are cooking, but I know it is something light on our stomachs because we can't eat to much before the night shows. Today especially because it is a Wednesday and we have a matinee after the main show. We go through the show with no problem. During the show it is fun to see the audience come alive with you and your acts. 10:30 and the show is over I am wiped out. It is late at night now and I'm thinking if I will stay in the circus like my parents or not. "The circus sure is fun," I think to myself, "but it can definitely be busy and for sure tough."

In the story Life's a Circus,  Bella Castini know differently. She was a clown. She live in a trailer. She would travel 20,000 miles in 7 months each year. In 1 year she would visit 150 cities. Bella would work from a sunup to a sundown.

      Bella had to do a lot of stuff as a kid. At 7:00 A.M. she have to wake up, get dressed, and go to the pie car for pancakes and bacon. At 9:00 A.M. it was school time. Her one-room schoolhouse travels with her. At 3:00 P.M. school is over for a quick break. 

      At  3:30 it would be time for her chores and practice. At 6:30 P.M. it would be dinner time for them. They would go in the pie car to eat. They would also perform 10 shows a week. At 10:30 P.M. the show time is over. Bella would be wiped out. The last thing they would do was at 12:00 A.M. By that time she would be thinking about the end of touring season.

           9:00 A.M.School.School travels with us.Circus performers are from all around the world so they speak different languages: French ,Russian, Italian and more.3:00 P.M.Schools over,after we take a quick break we play with the clowns unicycles and juggling balls.

            3:30 P.M.Chores and Practice: Feed, water groom horses so the horses will be ready for the show.My family

practices somersaulting off a running horse.I work on leaping from a trampoline onto the horses back it takes balance!other kids are practicing juggling and acrobatics.

             6:30 A.M.Dinner we go to the pie car and eat we don't eat much because we have to do are show.10 shows a week :one each weekday plus a matinee on Wednesday , Saturday and Sunday two shows.10:30 P.M. shows over were tired and wiped out we give are all in are shows to make sure they adiance enjoys it as much as we do.

              12:00 A.M. in bed thinking about our season tour I am so excited for every state to see are circus we are going to practice and work as hard as we can!

Being in a circus has its ups and downs. It takes dedication, skills,and confidence. Not everyone can be in a circus and if you are going to be in one you need to know that your scudele will be filled. Every minute counts.

The Circus

 

              This was a big day. Maggie had been in the circus for a long time but she had never been in a show before. This was her day and she was determined to make it perfect. If she messed up she would promise herself never to go into public again.

              She got herself dressed into her nicest clothes and decided to go out into the fresh morning air. Once she got outside she ran over to the gym to practice her part in the show. When she got there she noticed her dad was already there practicing tightrope walking.

             When she walked in she startled him and made him fall. She wasn't afraid for him though because she knew her father was a great acrobat too. She watched him fall and then bounce off air as he grabbed the rope to stop himself from falling all of the way.

              That night, the night of the show, Maggie was more nervous than ever. She kept on trying to run back to her camper but her dad stopped her every time. Maggie had to be an acrobat and didn't want to have to do that in front of millions of people because she was afraid she would mess up.

              It was finally her turn and she went out onto the stage. She jumped up onto the rope and started to climb as high as she could. Then she started to swing the rope and hung upside down while it was swinging. She heard ooh and aah as she did the rest of her part without any mistakes.

              At the end she was so relieved that she had done it right she decided she wanted to be in the circus forever. Even though she did make mistakes sometimes, Maggie grew up to be a famous acrobat.

THE CIRCUS

                                          

                                                   by: Annabella  Esquivel

 

                                 

 

       Stephanie Roberts, a 12 year-old girl, who is in the circus, has a very full, adventorous, and exciting life. Every day of her life is full of tamed lions, flexible acrobats, horn hoking clowns, and cheers from the audience when she does a show.

 

  

         Stepahanie's act in the circus is the tightrope, cannon balling, and doing acrobat acts. " The cannon balling is my favorite act because, when my brother lights the cannon with a match, I feel like I'm flying." qoutes Stephanie.

 

 

         If you thought Stephanie travels alone in the circus, well, you thought wrong! she travels in the circus with her older brother Scott, older sister Samantha, younger brother Jimmy, mom Jessica, and dad Brian. Each year, Stephanie and her family travel hundreds and thousands of miles.

 

 

        Being in the circus can be fun and games and all, but there's also your studies and dedication that you put into your act in the circus. Stephanie and her family also travel with lots of helpers that help with putting up the tents, music, lights, and training for their acts.

 

 

          Stephanie and her family live in an R.V. during the circus. They eat in there, play games, and eat. When the Roberts family are not doing the circus, they spend thier time in thier two story house on the beach in Miami, Flordia. The Roberts family do the show 7 times a week. One each day of the week. They do the circus for 2 1/2 months and then go home. That is "THE CIRCUS"

If you want to work in a circus,you would have a busy schedule.You would have to wake up at 7:00 A.M. to get dressed,and go to the pie car for pancakes and bacon.The crews are setting up tents, lights, and music for the show.That is alot already, I would be sleepy.They are setting up for the show.If I was at that show I wouldn't be able to wait.

 

     Then at 9:00 A.M. you would have to go to school.The one-room schoolhouse would travel with you.Like other schools your school has computers,tests,and you get report cards.Circus performers are from all over the world, many of the performers speak other languages like French, Russian, and Italian.As you travel around the world,your geography lessons come alive.

 

     Then at 3:00 P.M. school will be over,you will have a break.you might see clowns there sense it is a circus school.If you do see a clown they might let you play on their unicycles and juggle their balls.You can also play with one of the circus dogs.They might even have a tiger there, but I would stay away from that if I were you.

 

     Then at 3:30 P.M.Time to do chores and practice.You would have to treat the horse.You wiil have to groom it and feed it.You might see people somersaulting off a horse.You might see people jumping from a trampoline onto the horse's back.

 

     At 6:30 P.M. It would be dinnertime.For dinnertime you have to go to the pie car again.You don't want to eat alot because you have to preform at the circus.You would have to do 10 shows.After the show is over,you would walk back to the trailer, and wipe off all of the makeup.After you wipe off all of your makeup you would go back home and do all of that stuff the next day.

My life in the Circus is pretty hard because we have to travel 20,000 miles, in 7 months each year.We visit 150 cities. Here a typical day for me:

      

                7:00 A.M. 

I wake up,get dressed,and go to the pie car (1) for pancakes and bacon. The crews are setting up tents,lights, and music for tonight's show.

         

            9:00 A.M. School time.

           Our one-room schoolhouse travels with us. Like any school,ours has computers,tests, and report cards.Because the circus performers are from all over the world, many of my classmates speak other languages:French,Russian, and Italian, like my family. As we travel around the country, our geography lessons come alive.

   
3:00  P.M.  School's over.

school's over-time for quick break. The clowns let me play with their unicycles(2) and juggling balls. I also play with my tiny dog, Noble; our trailer is too small for a large pet. I'd like to join a soccer team, but we're never in one place long enough.

 

 

    3:30 P.M. Chores and practice.

I feed, water, and groom(3) the horses we use in our horseback acts. Today, my dad practices somersaulting off a running horse. I'm working in leaping from a trampoline onto the horse's back; it takes balance and concentration.Other kids are practicing juggling and acrobatics. Our neighbor walks baby leopardson a leash. Trainers are working with elephants,Lions, and chimpanzees.

 

 

   6:30 P.M. Dinnertime.

My family and I go to the pie car to eat , but we don't eat that much because we're preforming tonight. We do 10 shows a week: one each weekday,plus a matinee(4) on Wednesday, two on Saturday, and tow on Sunday.

 

     10:30 P.M. The show is over.

I'm wiped out(5). Walking back to our trailer, we pass the circus offices, concession stands, stable, and trainers. Two days from now, we'll all set up in another town.

    

       12:00 A.M.  In bed.

I'm thinking about the end of our real home in Florida. When i grow up, will i still be a circus performer like my parents? Who I still be a citrus performer like my parents? Who knows? The citrus is fun, but it's a busy and tough life.

  

          This is how you can be a circus performer go to htt://WWW.kidzworld.com/article/4481-becoming-a-circus-performer

 

         Becoming a Circus Performer

 

         Have you ever dreamed of running away from  home and joining the circus? Think you have what it takes to be a acrobat or a trapeze artist, you think you have what it takes? To find out some of the ins and outs of becoming a circus performer, kidzworld  spoke with Philippa Handball, an acrobat and dancer with Cirque du Soleil's circus, Quidam.

 

         Circus Performers - Getting Started

 

     Not everyone can get in the circus and become an acrobat or a trapeze artist. You have to have the right body type and a specific talent. When Philippa's was five years old she stared in the circus. She did  Ballet , and  musical theater and all kinds of music, singing, acting and home craft. When Philippa was 11 years old she know what she want to be when she grow up a performer. So, she went for it. She gave up everthing else and concentraed  on her way for dancing and performing.

 

            Circus Performers - The Upside

 

      Philippa got the change to go travel the world.  she go to see many different places and meet many different people. she traveled with 100 people.

   Circus Performers - The Downside

 

   The circus is not high-flying fun and games and clowing areund, but it is more than  just fun and ggames you have to work hard every day. But you can have some fun but you have to work. The circus you have to send time away form home. You have to do shows on the  weekdays and on the weekends. You do not get to seeyour family. You have to work long hours and weekends as well. You have to want it if you want to be a perfomer because you do not get to  see your family and you have to work long house.

I am a circus performer.  There is a lot of interesting stuff about being a circus performer.  It is all just really hard work.

       My life in the curcus is tough.  You have to wake up really early every morning.  Right when you get there you have to do some drills to get you pumped up.  Those drills are so tiring though. Those drills take up about a half hour of our time already.

      The good things about the curcus is you wilol meet a lot of partners in your group.  They are all really nice too.  Your group is the one you will be working in.  There is usually about ten people in your group.  It can be really fun sometimes.

      The curcus life is really tough.  It is easy to get used to the stratagies.  The curcus life is tough but fun.

Life in the circus

 

 

          At 7:00 A.M Mia has to wake up, got dressed, went to there car and ate pancakes and bacon when the crew is setting up the cameras,the tent, lights, music, and more.

 

 

9:00 A.M Mia has to go to school and do homework, other work, test, and a lot more but most of the people in her class speak different languages that she does not like at all. All Mia wishes is if she could be in a class with all Americans. But Mias class come true like the geography because they travel around the county.

 

 

3:00 PM Mia's classes are over and she gets a break before the show. She plays on the clowns unicycle and plays with her cute little dog named Noddle. But Mia wishes she had more to her life. She wants to join a soccer team, or play a fun sport. She wants to go back to her home state Michigan, But she is to busy working in the circus when she feels like she does not belong beacuse she is only 11.

 

 

4:00 PM Mia does her chores and practices for the the circus because she has 10 shows a week and when she is done she is wiped out because there shows are so long. But this show was going to be  her best show because it was time for her to step up her game and become a acrobat!

 

6:00 PM My family and I eat dinner but not to much dinner because tonight we had a show coming up. We eat like that on a normal basic scedueal.

 

 

10:00 PM Mia comes back from the circus and she was so happy and tired. Happy because she did so great in that performance she wishes she could do it again. Then she thinks that she can do it again because she will do it tomorrow and that made her think being in the circus is what she is good at and that she is going to stay in the circus for now and see that happens next!

 

 

12:00 PM Mia is in her bed thinking about how good she did last night and how she wants to do it again because she never gave up on what she did so she could be moved up to a trapized artist acrbat or even a tightrope walker.

 

 

 

By: Courtney

At 6:30 A.M Lily Variant and James Variant's alarm goes off. They open their sleepy eyes and stare out at their magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower. The sun is just coming up and is peaking through the holes of the Eiffel Tower. The crisp autumn air fills their lungs as a breeze enters through their open window. They drag themselves out of bed and into the bathroom. They are in a circus in Paris, France and are the famous twin trapeze artists with an act called Fire and Ice.

 

     Half an hour later they are roaming along the cobblestone streets of Paris looking for their favorite chocolate shop, A Dream in Chocolate. Finally they spot the chocolate shop. It has old stone walls, a wooden door, a small sign above the door with fading purple paint, and three stone steps that lead up to the shop. It has a strong aroma of cocoa that you can smell from a mile away. They walk up the steps and into the shop. The store is amazing! It has rows of truffles, chocolate eggs, chocolate bark, chocolate hearts, chocolate covered strawberries and more all sorted by milk chocolate, white chocolate , and dark chocolate. The twins walk up to the counter and order their favorite, dark chocolate hot cocoa with milk chocolate truffles dipped in it.

 

    Once they finish the hot cocoa they sneak back into the circus arena. They are not supposed to eat at chocolate shops, they are supposed to eat at the circus's pie car. At 8:30 they rush the circus's school where they learn French, English, Math, Spelling and much more. They listen to their teacher drown on and on until finally at 1:00 schools over. They walk to the circus arena to start practicing. The circus arena is a large tent rainbow colored with bright gold stars and flashing colored lights. During the show it is where everyone preforms, where all the seats are, and where they will be selling sickly sweet cotton candy that dissolves in your mouth faster than any other kind and buttery popcorn that smells so good you just can't resist.

 

      James and Lily harness up and practice dancing through the air, flipping and catching each other. Finally it is time for the real show. James and Lily watch eagerly as other people preform tricks with lions and juggle swords until finally the announcer calls, " And now introducing the fantastic, the amazing, the thrilling, Fire and Ice!" James and Lily hold their poses as they get hoisted up into the air , then finally the break their poses and burst into a scene of dancing a flipping and spinning in mid air so magical that it transports you to a different world.

 

       At 10:30 the show is over and James and Lily get out their costumes and curl up into bed until tomorrow when they wake up and go through the routine all over again.

The Perfect Show

 

It was a bright sunny day in March.All the kids were outside because it was to hot to be inside.Everyone was outside eating ice cream or getting wet.Everyone except Mackenzie.

 

She was inside practicing to be a acrobat.That was the only thing she wanted to be.She had gave up everything else but being an acrobat.She specifically wanted to be a acrobat.Not a lion tamer,not a ring master,not a clown,NO,she wanted to be an acrobat.

 

"MACKENZIE!I told you to go outside two hours ago."Mackenzie's mom yelled."Hey mom!Guess what?I'm going to win this contest the 5th grade teachers are doing!And what is the prize Mackenzie?Two TICKETS TO SEE ONE SHOW AT THE CIRCUS!AND WE GET TO MEET AND TAKE A PICTURE WITH ONE OF THE PERFORMERS!That sounds lovely Mackenzie.All I have to do is come in 1st,2nd,3rd,4th,or 5th in the marathon they are having.The only problem is,it's tomorrow"

 

Sure enough the day was here.Mackenzie took everything she needed.She took her high flying air breathing running shoes.The marathon was in the morning.All the contestants were stretching.Mackenzie started to get nervous.READY,SET,GO!The race was off!Mackenzie was in second place so far.She tried to get to first but Randy,the fastest fifth grade runner,was in first.They all had to run 4 laps.Mackenzie was on her last lap.She was in 2nd place,about to catch up to Randy.They were around the corner,almost to the finish line.Mackenzie caught up to Randy!She won and finished in 1st place!She was the HAPPIEST girl on earth.Mackenzie got a trophy and 2 tickets to go to the circus!

 

The rest of the week went by fast.All she could think about was the circus on Saturday.By the time it was Friday,She did her homework faster than usual,she ate her dinner faster than usual,and she even went to bed earlier than usual.It was Saturday.Mackenzie couldn't wait to go.She was so eager she kept telling her mom to wake up at 6:00 in the morning and telling her the show already started.It was 10:00 now,the show starts a 12:00 noon.Mackenzie was already ready to go.By the time they got there it was 11:30,perfect timing to get their ticket,buy some snacks inside,and sit down.The lights started to dim.Mackenzie was starting to get goosebumps.The show started with clowns,acrobats,and ring masters.It was just like Mackenzie dreamed.The next act was some elephants and a lion tamer.The last act was a tightrope walker.He was so high,he gave Mackenzie and her mom goosebumps.The show was over.

 

"Now it's time to meet some acrobats!"And we get to take a picture with them!"Mackenzie was so amazed when she met them.When she got home,all she would talk about was the circus.Her mom didn't mind Mackenzie talking about it all day.But she would get annoyed of Mackenzie if she talked about the circus for the rest of the week.Mackenzie yelled,"BEST DAY EVER!!!!!

 

 

 

                                    THE END

On a nice summer day I saw a circus phamphlent saying NEED CIRCUS PERFORMERS. I took the phamphlet and looked at where the circus was. I was pretty good doing flips and somersaults I thought if I joined the circus I could go all over the continent. I registered to practice and see if they'll hire me. Next, it was my turn to perform for the judges. I said to myself quietly "I can do this". I did some cart wheels then a somersault, jumped on trapoline then flipped in the air. Then the judges talked for a couple minutes and said that I was hired to do the circus. I had to pack my stuff to go on the world tour

 

       On the way I packed my clothes and things I needed and things that I could remember about my family. I took my suitcase outside and said good bye  to my family I thought to my self if  I really want to do the circus or stay here with my family. I went to the person who was in charge of the circus I was hired to. Then I asked hime if I could my family a few times a year here and they said only once a year or twice a year. I told him that I'd like to do that so I could come visit my mom and dad and my sisters. I was really excited because I LOVED traveling but I love my family too. But I would send the some of my money that I earned from performing in the circus to my family so they'll remember me.

 

       Me and some other people from the circus got to go to Japan, Australia, Wisconson and lots of other places. I stayed as a circus performer to earn some money and have some fun with it I also got to visit my family. It was really fun to do this job because you get to learn about each other and it's like my circus family on my trip. We stay'd together on our tours we were never left behind or been mean to each other. It was a fun time doing this and having more friends but I had to leave my best freiends behind after I left for the circus.

 

      One Monday night I thought to myself I have'nt gotten to see my family and friends in a while I quitted my circus life after 4 years of being in the circus. I missed everyone in my home town and some new neighbors came to move in. I thought I could open a little circus show once in a while with no tours. That means I could live on my dream and stille stay with my family.

I hope some of my circus friends come visit me some times. I sure miss them too.

The Circus Trick

 

 

       When I went to the circus with my friends, I was looking forward to it, especially the trapeze. When it came, the performers barely did anything. All they did was jump from one trapeze to the other until they reached the tightrope pole. It was simple as that. I told my friends that I could learn how to that in a couple of hours. As soon as I finished my sentences, I got transformed in to a circus performer! I was in practice, doing the trick I saw the performers doing. I then started doing the trick, but I missed getting onto the first trapeze. I brushed myself off, then tried again. this time I made it to the second trapeze. I realized this would take a while to learn how to do this.

 

        When I got back from the schoolroom (I was about my age when I was in my own body) I learned how much free time I had. About a half hour. At home, I had a few hours of free time. I realized the circus life wasn't so easy.

 

         Eventually, After a couple hours, I learned the trick. It was just in time, because the show was about to go on! I had a bit of time to eat at the pie car, but only a few minutes. The food was hamburgers. Not the best I've had.

 

         At the show, I was after the tigers, and before the clowns. The tigers were a big hit, I got a good bit of applause, and the clowns were a riot. (a good type of riot) After the show, I cleaned up like everybody else. Sure it was quick, but I was wiped out. I got in bed at about twelve thirty (12:30).

 

         The next morning, I packed up to go to Belize. Wherever that is. The show was easy, but I really couldn't understand anything. I was part of a South American tour. I went to Brazil, Argentina, and Chile. I wonder why the circus was such a big thing there.

 

         The circus life is a lot harder than I expected. I thought it would take an hour or two for learning the trick, but this was a lot harder than I expected. Suddenly, I turned into myself again! I wondered how it happened how it all happened, but I was happy that I was back in my old body again. I learned that the circus is harder than it looks.

 

         I learned not to underestimate anybody or anything (especially the circus). I tried to explain what happened to my friends, but decided to not tell that. Nobody really knows what happened right then and there. I guess that I froze time or something. Strange!

Circus

                                                        By:  Kelly Felice

 

  Here I am.  My first show now that I'm a pro circus entertainer!  According to my paper i have to meet at the pie car for breakfast.  Do I get pie for breakfast? Aperantly no, how sad. Turns out i just get pancakes and bacon.  More healthy than pie of course but I'm sure that everyone would want pie for breakfast. 

 

What I have to go to school?  i thought that going to the circus would get me out of school!  Wow school ends at 3:00 instead of 3:15?  Awesome kinda.   We still do have to learn all the subjects but our school day is a little shorter. I have to do chores too?  Why i thought the circus was a no rules zone no fair!    I have to feed brush and groom the horses enven though I don't even ride them.  So not fair!

 

Dinner time but why not so much? I don't think any of us can eat that much cause 1.  newbes might be nervous and some might be sick if they eat too much.  Why cant we eat after we preform! Inside the Big Top

 

Hi I'm Mo! I'm in a circus! I know what your thinking! Mo can't be in the circus, she's only 10! Well guess what. I can! But it's not all fun and games. My life is a lot like yours. But you know, In a clowning around type of way. I go to school just like you were we learn and play. But I do something you probably don't! I perform!

 

 

            I have to perform 10 times a week! Once every week day and twice every weekend day. But it's not too bad. I get to do awesome stuff like tightrope and trapeze and my personal favorite, Horse back riding! Horse back riding is when you do stunts while riding on a horse. And that's hard!

 

 

           Another thing I get to do is travel. I travel to different places every week! The bad part is I don't really have a place to call home. And I never really get to see my family. Sometimes I wish I was back home when I lived in Kentucky. but then I would never get to see my parents and little sister Hannah. I still just wish my agenda wasn't so crowded.

 

 

           So in conclusion, My life is ruff tough but fun all at the same time.
