I am 13 years old and my name is Lindy Park. I am a very busy circus performer because being in the circus is lots and lots of work. I do many different things at every show. For example,sometimes I do comedy as a clown,train animals to do tricks,flip as an acrobat,and most of the stuff you usually see in the circus. Today, I'm in the trailer lounge,while a show is going on,eating pie and resting because I broke my leg being an acrobat yesterday. So the story is when yesterday my mom and dad were finished riding the elephants while I was dressing up with my older brother , Mike who was a clown that day, in the dressing trailer. When the clowns were finished with their act then it was my turn to perform. So I started of on a tall balance beam flipping and standing on my hands. Then I climbed up a mountainous ladder to a thin rope with a huge net under the rope about 100 feet below and then started hanging off of it with my legs and doing flips with catching the rope again with my hand. On my 6th trick, I tried to do a trick that I've succeeded before where I hold the rope with my mouth and spin in a circle with my body. It was all fun and games when I then noticed that the rope was bigger than the ones I've used before. I suddenly let loose of the rope because it was too big for my mouth and fell to the net painfully on my leg. The good news was that the audience thought that was the end of my act and clapped without noticing my slight tears. But the bad news was that my leg was broken and I tried hard not to limp on my way back to the trailer which had made my leg hurt even more. So it was very hard but, I've still got a show today just being a clown on a wagon while my brother and dad (who are clowns) fall while pushing my wagon. When the act was finished, my brother helped me do chores when  a week passed everything was perfect until my mom got pregnant and had my baby brother,Joey. He turned out to be the funniest clown while only being 4 years old. So life as a circus performer is hard  but I managed to get through. I wonder what's going to happen next in my circus life.

My name is Bart, and I am ten years old. I have been in the circus for about 10 weeks now, and I haven't seen my family for a while. I got into the circus by hard work, and dropping everything I did so I could just focus on the circus. There are some down sides to being in the circus. you have to work about 24 hours a day and you almost never get to see your family, but I'm OK here because I have a friend my age named Dan.

 

       Now I will tell you about my day. It all started at 6:00 am when I went to the pie car to get some breakfast. As usual, me and Dan met up in the hallway. "Are you ready for the big performance tonight." asked Dan. "I sure am." I replied. Oh yeah, I forgot too tell you about Dan. He is ten like me, and we are both jugglers. We have a juggling act together and, it will be the grand finale in tonight's show. 

 

       Me and Dan finally get to the pie car, and eat our pancake breakfast. We talk about what we should add to our performance. " I think we should stick with the flaming torch juggling act." said Dan, and I agreed. We had worked on it for a while now and the grand finale was a good time to reveal it. 

 

 

                                                             ~

 

        A few hours went by and we were at school. Today, me and Dan just wanted school to be over so we could practice the act, but we still had geography left to do. Geography comes alive in the circus because you study the places you travel to. Mrs. Worm, our teacher, does a really good job of it. 

 

        After school me and Dan practice. Practice goes fairly smooth except for one mess ups. In the act, me and Dan are tossing pins to each other. Dan accidentally threw it when I wasn't looking and it hit me in the face. " Sorry Bart, are you OK?" said Dan. I was OK, but I wouldn't have been if the torch was lit!

 

 

                                                            ~

 

                                 

          It is 7:00, and it is time to start the show! The clowns come out first (Maggie, and James) and get the audience rolling in the isles. Next comes out Phil the tight rope walker, and he rides a unicycle across the tight rope. Next Pablo does an amazing trick where he gets a horse to sit down! After that, Bob the acrobat, did a triple back flip of a diving board into a kiddie pool. Now, its finally our turn. Me and Dan are too nervous too explain. We start to juggle, and we we get into a serious juggling rhythm. Before we know the act is over, we didn't mess up, AND THE CROWD GOES WILD! We did it!

LIFE AT THE CIRCUS

 

 

                     If you think you can just join the circus the blink of an eye you are wrong.  Joining the circus is hard you have to have the right kind of skills and everything.  You have to learn how to juggle good and to ride a unicycle.  For me joining the circus was just part of my family so basically I had no choice.  Oh yea and I forgot to mention that you if you want to be an acrobat you have to be at least a decent dancer, but you definetly have to be very flexible.

 

 

               I guess im pretty good at dancing, but definetly most of the adults there are a lot better.  I keep my head held high because I know I wll get there.  My mom is an acrobat.  She is the best one I have ever seen.  It really isn't fair to me, because I try my hardest all the time, but like I said I keep my head held high.

 

 

                      My dad has one of the most fun jobs, well, I think it would be. He is the announcer that may not sound very fun but my dad makes it look like fun.  When he does the announcing he makes all of these funny jokes.  Even though he has told them all to me before I laugh every single time.  The bad thing sometimes about the circus is I never get to see family or friends, but I like what I do so I deal with it.

 

 

                 When I get older since im already an acrobat I want to be an even better one when I get older.  Maybe one like my mom.  She knows how to do everything when it comes to acrobatic things.  I hope  you understand how fun but hard sometimes the circus can be from my writing.

Being a person in the Circus is something that you have to work up to. You can't just decide you want to go and sign up or audition a short speech. You have to have a purpose, a talent, and you have to be able to have fun and not give up if you do something wrong the first time. When you are in the Circus you have to be ready for an adventure of a lifetime. But first, you have to think if this work fits your personality.

There are three very important keys for being in the Circus. Number one, bravery. In the Circus, there are very scary acts that you have to put on for the audience. So you have to work hard to be brave in those acts. The second key is working hard. In a Circus, you have to work really hard and put 100% work into it. The third key is endurance. You have to have a lot of endurance when working in the Circus. Like when you have to work hard, you won't just give up if you mess up.

Despite the hard things in the Circus, you can have a really good time. You can acomplish things you have never acomplished before. You also get to go around the world to some really fun places. You can perform really fun things and you can expeirience things that you have never before.

So, if you want to join the Circus, you might want to keep this for the times you want to give up and go home.

A Day In the Circus.

       Sarah's mom was an acrobat in a circus coming to our town so Sarah invited Megan, Stella, and me to the circus. So at 9:00 A.M. we all met at her house and went to the circus. "Hey, I am so happy you all could make it,"said Sarah. "Of course, why would we miss it?" I said. We all headed to watch the show. "I am going to get some popcorn," Sarah said. "Okay, butcome back sorton. The show is going to start," said Megan. "Okay. I will come back soon," Sarah promised. 30 minutes passed. Sarah did not come back yet. We all suspeccted something. So we left the show and went to find Sarah. So I called Sarah. I heard a cell phone ring near us. It was weird but I knew SArah ws near us. I just couldn't find her. "Hello?" I asked. " This is Sarah. Sorry I did not come back.. I had to um go to the restroom?" she said in a strange way. " Well we are glad you are okay. We thought you were kidnapped or something. Anyways, where are you?" I questioned. "Well, I am near the trash can in front of you," Sarah said. I looked up. I saw a clown that looked a lot like Sarah. Sarah wsa making balloon animals for little children. She walked toward us. " Hi everybody. It's me, Sarah, your friend,"she said. We all were surpirsed. " Look, I didn't want to tell you all because I knew you would laugh at me. Sorry," Sarah said. "We don't care. We are your friends so we don't care if you are a clown and look silly. We care only about you. We judge on what the inside has. Not the outside. We are your friends so we won't laugh at you," Megan replied. We all nodded. Then we all shared secrets about ourselves that nobody knew so our friendship would be stronger.

the circus life

 

       if you want to become a performer, you have to have some sort of special talent. when i first started the circus it was tough for me because i was the youngest and everyone else was very experienced.at first i was shy to practice in front of everyone else,but now that I've been with them almost a year, i feel like they are my family.during a tour we have to get a lot of practice and a lot of sleep.you might think the circus life is easy,but when you experience it its a whole lot harder than you think it was.here is what i have to do everyday.

        

        6:30 a.m. i wake up greet my circus family and eat some breakfast,fix up the tent,make sure the lights are working and feed the animals.

 

        9:30 a.m  go to my tutor's room and start school with the other circus kids.we don't have computers like regular schools,but we do have lots of books that are informative and really help us.not all of us speak the same language, so its tough to understand what some people are saying,but we still are friends.

 

        at around 2:00 p.m. we start practicing for the nights show. i get to practice with my friends, but we do different acts so we cant practice the same thing.my act is to juggle while riding a unicycle.

 

        at 4:00 p.m. we get to take a break and eat lunch.when i finish eating the clowns let me play with their stuff.once i got the flower and gave to my mom then the flower squirted water in her face.i played with one of my friends called Rosa.Rosa is from Mexico so she only speaks Spanish but i understand her and she understands me.

 

        7:00p.m. we are getting ready to start the show.first my dad introduces all the acts. then music starts playing and we start off with the horses.

 

        9:30 p.m. the show is over and we are getting ready to sleep.

There was a chill in the air as I stepped down from the steps of the trailer. I really wanted to go back inside and read, but I knew I couldn't because I had a responsibility. I had to feed and groom each horse to perfection. Good thing there were only two of them. When I got to the stables, they were empty! I looked in the makeshift barn and all around, but I couldn't find them! Then I heard a:

"Nay!"

 

I turned around to find both horses standing a few yards away.

 

How should I get them in their stables? I thought.

 

Then I see the big box of oats and an idea was born.

 

I know what I'll do. I thought. I'll put a trail of oats leading to the stables! When the horses start eating the oats, they will end up in the stables.

 

I carefully placed the oats into a trail. As soon as I set two oats up, they were consumed. Little by little I got the horses back into the stables.

 

When I went home that night, I was quite pleased with myself because I thought of a soultion to a problem.

Noah Jamani

 

 

                                                Life at the Circus                                                                         

 

 

 

 

                           At the circus, there are many events the performers do. In my story, I will describe what events take place in a circus. You will also see a circus performer's every day activity. They work from dawn to dusk every single day. For a circus performer, work can be hard and fun. 

 

               

                             The sun's up and the day has begun. You get dressed and have breakfast at the pie car with the other performers. The crew is setting up for the show. After breakfast you go to school with classmates from all over the world. You learn about geography lessons and whats planned for the long day ahead.

  

 

 

                             After school you head on out for a break. You can play with the other performers or practice for the show. About thirty minutes later you practice and feed the animals. Whatever act you were assigned you practice and get warmed up. You can also help other performers do their activiy for the show.

 

 

           

 

                            A few hours later it is dinnertime. You have a light dinner because of the show. Then you get some practice and head on out for the show. The show has begun and you watch from behind the curtains as the other performers do their act. Now it is your turn for your act. The crowd applaudes after your amazing act as you step of the stage.

 

 

                       Once the show ends you head back to your trailer. The long day is over.You get a good nights sleep for the long day tomorrow. Tomorrow you hit the road again preparing for the next show. This is everyday life of a circus performer.

The audience filled the tent. A spotlight light flashed on me, I did my intro to the crowd and tumbled into the back of the tent were i wasnt seen. John, the anocer began to welcome the audience he talked some more then it was time for me to go back on this time with my friend,sally. We did our acrobat rountine we we hit our pose the crowd cheered. still performing out came Tom and Greg the Lion! "Its a lion!" a kid in the crowd said exictedly. "this is greg the lion folks!" Tom siad pointing to the lion. On my rope i flipped and landed on the ground on my feet of course. 

After the act the clowns went out on unicycles and small cars. After a ton of performing the show was over in two days we would be going to a new town to perform. I was very wiped out, before bed i went to the pie car to get a snack then i was off to bed.

    The next day i woke up got dressed then went to the pie car to get breakfast. I saw the crew setting up tents and lights and music for the mantinee (afternoon show).

   At 1:00pm i went to groom,feed, and give water to the horses which we use for the horseback acts. At 3 it was time for the mantinee, which was amazing everyone performed so well. After the show i got ready for the next. When i was in bed that night i was thinking if when i am older i'll still be a circus perfomer. The circus is fun but its tough at times.

Living In The Circus

 

     Every day while I'm on tour for the Cirque du Soleil, I perform as one of the acrobats and dancers. Living in the circus is fun and a great experience,but it can be really tough. We do fun stuff like when we perform. performing in the circus is so fun,but can get tough. you have to practice and stay fit. You don't really get to see your family either. Living in the circus can get complicated.

     When you first enter the circus you must have a special talent, the right body type, determination, and you have to put your heart into what you're doing. When you are in the circus you get the opportunity to travel the world. You get to go to Australia, Japan, and all over North America. Being in the circus gave me chances to meet new people from all over the world.You become so used to the people you work with that they become your family.

     Even though the circus can be fun and gives you amazing opportunities, it isn't all fun and games. You have to work long days and spend a lot of time away from home and your family. On tour you don't really have anywhere to call home. You have to work long hours and work from sunup to sundown. You practice your routine, go to school, you do chores, perform, and go to sleep. The circus isn't all fun.

     The circus is very fun but has its downside.You must stay fit and healthy for performing. Living with the circus gives extraordinary chances. You get to meet new people and make new friends. Living in the circus gives me amazing possibilities and is amazing.

7:00, my clock reads. I know I have to get out of bed, bout last night's performance was a lot of work. Not like any other shows weren't a lot of work. I roll out of bed and hobble over to my small wardrobe, tucked away into the corner. I sleepily take off my pajamas and put on a pair of jeans and the yarn sweatshirt my grandma knitted for me last summer. I slide the door aside and step out into the misty morning air.

 

     Some circus performers are setting up the big tent while others are practicing their acts. I look at my watch. 8:55, it reads. Oh my gosh!

A lot of people might think it is easy to be a part of the circus and that it would be all fun and games. And the circus is really fun, but it takes a lot of hard work and dedication. You have to have all the right skills and you have to do a lot of traveling, you have to stay healthy and fit and give up things in order to perform.

 

Here are some pros of being a performer in the circus-


When you perform in front of an audience and they cheer it makes me feel really proud.
I get to travel to places all around the world, this can be good or bad. Sometimes I get homesick, but it is really cool to meet people from other countries.
It is really fun performing for a live audience and they get to see how hard that I worked.

Here are the cons of being a circus performer-


I spend pretty much all of my free time practicing for live performances.
I work really long hours.
I don't dee my friends or family that often.
I don't get to experience a lot of things besides performing.

 

But, although I get homesick a lot I do have a lot of fun. I wish I could have a little more time to spend with friends, but all around I'm pretty happy with what I do.

Life in a Circus

 

    Life in a circus can be difficult and hard work, but it also can be exciting and fun. You have to train, perform in many different places, and you live a normal life to. Also, you have to be fit for the job.

 

Benifets of Being a Performer

 

   The circus can be fun and exciting if you look at it this way. You will have have one specific job like an acrobat, trapeze artist, lion tamer, working with elephants,jugguling, ride unicycles, and many many other amazing talents that you will have to work with. Being a tapeze artist is my dream. I love to swing, jump, and im very flexiable. I think I wiuld be good at this job, but i have never tried it so I would have to train alot to be a pro. You also have to be brave for some talents.

 

Disadvantages of the Circus

 

   Some of the disadvantages of the circus is that you wont get to hang out with friends, or learn at school,and maybe even not see your family if they are not in the circus with you. Missing your family can be tough if you are a kid. You can't hang out with friends because you will be training or performing. Also, you be able to learn about social studies, science, writing, or math. you might have a school travel with you so you can learn when you have freetime. But you never know how long you'll be in the circus. You might get tired and want to do some other career, or  you might love being in the circus and want to do that for the rest of you life. Also, you might have to put up with the animals and taking care of them.

 

Life Training With the Circus

 

   you have to get up early to train, feed, and get ready for the day. You will have multiple shows in one week and multiple days of moving. Life can be hard when you trainign to be a performer, but it will be worth it. You get to have fun when your performing. Do many amazing, exciting, and fun things while you do you part of the performance but the traing is the hard part. You have to train,train,and train. Hard work for a performer, very hard work.

 

   I hope someday I will be in the circus and get to do some Trapeze and train with the animals. I hope you will consider it too.

Have you ever thought that a circus performer has easy tasks in his life to perform? Well, that's not quite the truth. I, Rebecca, work at the circus for long hours and weekends, practicing for our next performance in America. The entire circus travels around the world performing for a week.

 

       In order to become a circus performer, you first have to practice the two skills required, dancing and performing. A girl I know named Philippa, started stardom when she was five years old. She did musical theater, and ballet and all kinds of music, singing, acting and everything to hone her craft. When Philippa wanted to become a performer, she gave up on everything and practiced only the two skills, dancing and performing.

 

I started practicing when I was the same age as her, and coincidentally, we both ended up performing in the same circus. We would practice balancing on a rope for at least three hours, juggle for two hours, and do splits and somersaults until it was bedtime. The next day, we would set everything up for the performance like tents, popcorn machines, rings, and other tools.

 

We'd dress up in our shining costumes, and rehearse until it was time to start the show. Whenever I perform on walking on the rope, I feel like I'm the highest person in the circus, trying to reach the sky while balancing. It ended up with all the circus performers singing and dancing together in front of the audience. The next day, we traveled to a different country and it would repeat all over again.

 

To conclude, I had a fun time and a great eperience traveling all over the world with my friend, performing amazing skills that a normal person can't do. Right now, we're on our way to Moscow, Russia. I hope you'd see me perform one day!

A CIRCUS GONE WRONG

 

              Once again it is that time of the year when the Bellini Circus comes to town and preforms an amazing show. There is always five performers, who have been practicing one special act.....but the only thing people know about the act is that it involves many animals. That is why everyone is pushing and shoving each other to get tickets. On the day of the circus, there were people holding popcorn, spilling drinks, and trying to get the best seats. The lights went dim, people froze and sat where ever they were. ''Ladies and gentlemen.... please give a round of applause for our Bellini Circus performers!'' Everyone cheered.                                                                The performers brought out lions, bears, tigers, cheetahs, bulls, elephants, and many more animals. Then, they all climbed onto their backs. Everything was going well until a lion roared. The performer jumped off it's back. Then an elephant stomped, and the bull grunted. All the performers jumped off the animals and called for help. They all looked at each other with confused faces. ''We're sorry folks the show has been canceled.'' As everyone was getting up to leave, they heard a huge bang. The animals had broken loose!                          All the animals ran around the circus, then broke out to the streets. Cars screeched on the breaks. People called 911. Animal control came with big trucks. Some of the animals were caught. others were still missing. It wasn't until 7:00 when reports of animals coming into stores and houses were all the calls police got.                                                                                                                                          Some people left town. Others.... like the performers, helped catch the animals. After two days some of the animals were still missing. Sometimes when people saw the animals, they would just scream. Most of them were caught, but then the ones that were still missing went into the city and wrecked many things. Soon after that, the town where the animals had first broken loose decided they would let the city take over.                                                                                                                                                                                          So they did. Three men came and caught the animals. Police tried to figure out why the animals got scared and ran away. they didn't figure it out, but they figured something else out. That the animals at the circus.... were stolen!                                                                      All the performers were arrested and taken to jail. So when the next circus comes to town, watch out. Those animals might just be stolen.

The Circus Life

   

     "Bella, time to get up," my mother yells. I stretch and climb out of bed. I throw on some clothes and head to the pie car for breakfast. Although it's only seven in the morning, the crews are already setting up tents, lights, and music for th?e show tonight.

    "Hey, Bella," my friend, Christina, says.

    "Hi, Christina," I say, smiling.

    We walk into our classroom and the majority of the class is already here. Christina and I finally get out of school and three in the afternoon. I  head to the stalls to feel, water, and groom the horses that we will use in the show. My dad practices somersaulting off a running horse. I work on leaping from a trampoline onto the horse's back. My classmates are practicing juggling and acrobatics.

    It's dinnertime. My family and I head out to the pie car for dinner. I don't eat much because we'll be performing tonight. We do ten shows a week: one each weekday, plus a matinee on Wednesday, two on Saturday, and two on Sunday.

    It's 10:30 P.M. already. The show is over and I'm really tired. We walk back to our trailer, passing the circus offices, concession stands, stables. and trailers. Two day from now, we'll be in a different city.

    At 12 in the morning I'm finally in bed after a grueling day. At the end of the touring season, I will finally be able to go back home, in Florida. It's nice to be in the circus, but sometimes I miss our home in Florida.

The Mess Up

 

Hi, I am Meera. I work at the Circus Argentina as an animal

trainer. You may wonder," Did that actor make a mistake on purpose, or was it an accident?" I have been through a similar situation.

 

It was Thursday and I was traveling with the circus from

Baltimore, Maryland to New York City for the Annual Friday Show.

I was so excited because it was my first annual show. I had been working on training the new lemur named Zed. Zed was not a cooperative little lemur. We worked on his dancing, which took alot of time. Now I hoped we would get it right.

 

Jerry was the seal. Zed hated Jerry. I don't know if they were

scared  of each other, or they just hated each other when they first saw each other.

 

"We are here," my boss, Marta screamed. We all jumped out of

the trailer and into the set-up tent. "Now," said Marta "We have come late, so we are not going to have any time to practice. Start getting dressed!!!" No time to rehearse! We were going to fail! Me and Zed got dressed, and I made sure to keep Jerry away from him. Then I took Zed to the waiting room. "What are we going to do Zed?"I asked. After 30 minutes of waiting, it was our act. I took Zed to the stage, which was already set-up for us. Then, I put Zed down, and introduced us. I turned on the music, and we started to dance. Then, I saw Jerry outside his cage. This was not his act? "Jerry," I said as softly as I could."Go back!!!!" As soon as Zed heard me say "Jerry", he jumped out of the ball pit and on to me! Jerry came out, too, and started to jump with Zed.

 

          After I managed to get the two of them to stop fighting, I stood there, looking so ashamed of myself. Suddenly, a man stood up and cheered. Then everybody cheered! When I got of the stage, I scolded Zed and Jerry for fighting, but also I hugged them. And now, they are best friends. I am happy they became friends that way!!!

MY OWN STORY ABOUT CIRCUS PERFORMERS

 

       I realy want to be a circus perfomer. The reason I want to be a circus perfomer      is  because they get a lot of attention ,and they also get a lot of  money.But the thing that I hate is that I  am risking my life just because they want entertament.

The life of a performer in the circus is fun and tiring. Being a  performer you have to be able to do many things like riding a unicycle or front flipping over a running horse. Well, it takes hard work being a performer or a acrobat in the at about 7:00 AM you have to wake up and eat breakfast. At about 9:00 AM you set up the circus tent and decorations with your fellow performers. At 6:00 PM you have to go eat dinner, but just a little because you have to perform in a couple of minutes.     Finally, at 7:00 you perform at the circus and finally perform with your fellow acrobats and clowns! Flipping, jumping, and even incredible juggling all of you are doing great and the crowd is cheering loud! After many performances and it is finally the end of the tour you will think about going back to your home and rest for a couple of days, you might even even think if your going to keep performing or change to a different job. Late in the night you finally get a very long and slow sleep.

Yes, I got into the circus. I'm so excited for todays show. I heard this is the best circus in the whole world. This week were performing in china. I had never been to china even though I have traveled basically all over the world. This is really exciting.

 

After when i got up and got dressed, it was time for breakfeast.I next went to the school room to trian and learn. Like normal, are school ends at 3:00. We have about six hours of school trianing, it is hard work. Than Finally we have the show. The show ends at about 10:30 and at that day, I'm really tired. But, what we performed today. I'm happy about it.

 

 

I had fun today and I'm happy to have done the circus. It is hard work but fun. I'm at least all ready for another day of the hard work. Now I'm going to sleep dreaming of the circus. Goodnight.

Life in a Circus

 

                     

 

          My name is Marina and I am 10 years old. My parents are acrobats at the cicus, and want me to be working at the circus to. I hoewer have no desire to spend my life preforming. My wish is to become a doctor. No mater what happens, I will try my whole life to become a doctor or atleast a nurse.

 

         We live in a trailer and don't have a particular home state. We travel everywhere for our prefomances. I have to stick to a boring life of a circus girl and my parents that I wont be a doctor. I am dissapointed, but I wont give up.

                 

         (Twenty years later) I did it! I became a doctor. I ran away from my old life to the luxury of being a normal citizen. When I came to Washington it applied to a college for doctors and entered. From now on my life is going to be wonderful.

My job as a circus performer is really fun ,even though it is hard. I am a tightrope walker. It took many years to master this. It is like a game of balancing on a rope. I have to be very careful or I'll fall. I practice by doing it on a thin wood plank, then I went to ropes.

 

   If I fail, I would get fired because the show would be ruined. The audience would get their money back. Good thing I never fell before. I tightrope with fire, crocodiles, and spikes under me. They are just added to make it look more amazing. Of course I wear armor to protect me if I fall.

 

   This job is really fun. I wish I had it the rest of my life. It may look hard, but it is really fun.

I visualize this act going perfectly, then step closer to the trapeze, reach up, grab it, and hold on tight for a moment before stepping off the fifty-foot high platform and arching my body towards the other platform. The feeling of the wind whipping my long, dark hair back has always been one of the greatest things about working with the circus. I'm supposed to be able to spin halfway around the trapeze, ending in a position where I'm standing on my hands, legs stretched like I'm doing the splits. I'm having a hard time centering my balance over the bar, but suddenly, it just feels completely perfect! That's when I remember that I wasn't supposed to stay like that the whole time, and that I need to make a full circle. Once that's done, I leap down to the tightrope, walk across on my hands, and execute a perfect backflip down to the ground.

 

                                 ***************

 

"Holly, that was amazing! How did you do that?" My best friend, Sammy(her real name is Samantha, but she hates it when people call her that), asked me. "Sammy, I told you a million times, practice using something closer to the ground, and gradually work your way up!" She asked the the exact same question every time I finished a show. It gets really annoying really fast. I never really have time to ask her to stop, I'm always practicing, or doing a show with my family and friends. In fact, I met Sammy while we were doing a show in LA. She's been part of the backstage crew for years! we're both fifteen, and she's had to assemble the big top with the rest of the crew. Believe it or not, she's actually in charge of what goes on down on the floor. She's also in charge of the sound systems.

 

                                 ***************

 

THWACKTHWACKTHWACKTHWACKTHWACK! "Mom, is there a deranged woodpecker living by the door that I don't know about?" I laughed. She shook her head. "No, but if you don't hurry up you'll be late for practice." Sammy's voice shouted, "HOLLY, HURRY UP! IT'S SHOWTIME!" I looked at my watch. "Yikes!" This was my first time performing a big act alone. "Good luck, Holly!" Sammy yelled as I ran to the big top.

The Circus by : Austyn Smith

 

 

 

The circus is fun and creative. We are in Paris, France right now. I am the trainer for the baby leapords. We are playing at 9:00 pm tonight. It is going to be so much fun. This is my first time in Paris. I have played all over the world though. I am really good friends with the trainer for the lions.Tonight i think i might teach the leapords a new trick like to play dead. Oh wait im late for dinner time! We eat in the pie car. We usually eat small things.

 

Now it is 8:30 pm. I am so excited. We are probably going to play for one of the biggest crowds we have ever seen before. I am going on right after the lion tamer.

Right now i got my leapords on a leash so they don't run into the crowd. I know some pretty cool people in the circus like the clown with the afro, the guy with the unicycle, and the elephant tamer too. Oh no i got ahead of myself im on in two minutes. Ok now just focus and don't be afraid. So there i am walking out on the platform with my leapords. The crowd is cheering for me this is so exciting.

 

Now i am going to do stuff with the leapords. First they will jump chair to chair. So now jump, jump, jump, and jump. The crowd is cheering and i am crying for my hard work. Then i anounce that I am going to do something i have never done before. I am going to make my leapords play dead. On the count of three i will say boom boom boom and they will all fall. One, Two, Three, boom boom boom. It worked they all falled on to the ground unharmed ofcourse. Now my act is done and i am going in the back room withmy leapords.

 

I now this might sound crazy but when i was in the backroom i was talking to my leapords telling them how good they were.Then after that i went to bed. The next morning i saw everybody and the pie car. When i walked in they all congragulated me. They said it was the best performance i have done so far.So that was my long day at the circus.

Being in the circus is fun. You get to play with animals, make new best friends, practice, what more could you want! To be in the circus you must like pancakes and funny jokes. You have to travel a lot in cars and trains so lets hope you like to change locations a lot. It takes a lot of hard work and dedication but in the end it always turns out ok and you get to do the same act tomorrow and the next and so on.

 

   Some times the circus is not so fun and your stuck missing your family. You even have to get up early and go to bed late every night. Setting up the tent and practicing may not be so fun when that's all you do and you want to do more.

 

   Well that's what I have to say about the circus and I hope you get a good understanding

  How to become a circus freak is to go to school. You have to be able to some sort of trick. My dad first started out as a clown. Then he was a magician. Now he is a acrobat and tightrope walker. In between all that he has time to hang with me.

"But how," asked Bobby Joe. He was surprised that the circus master would ask a boy who is about to turn 11 could flip off of a wire, land on and bounce off of a trampolene, and land on a horse and ride it around the circus rink. "Well, there will be many safety measures," answered the circus master. Bobby shook his head still mystified. "Go to the pie car and eat Bobby," the circus master said. After breakfast, Bobby went to school. When school was over he raced back to the circus. Bobby loved basketball. There was a small wooden hoop and a small basketball that Bobby took with him everywhere. Soon he went to feed the elephants. The monkeys needed serious grooming so he set to that too. An hour later, Bobby was done with his chores. Bobby went into the circus arena and started training for his act. The first few times he lost his balance on the wire and fell but soon he was ready to go! At dinner Bobby barely touched his pie. He was too nervous to eat! Soon the circus master announced that the show was beginning. Behind the stage, despite his small dinner, Bobby had butterflies in his stomach and he felt like throwing up! His heart jumped when the circus master announced his name for the act. He entered the arena. Despite the heating, he was shivering. He climbed up the ladder and began to balance on the wire. The crowd held its breath. Then the moment of truth came. Bobby clenched his eyes shutand flipped off of the wire. Bouncing off of the trampoline, he let go of all the excitement he had been holding back. When he opened his eyes he was perfectly landed on the horse. He had done it!

In the circus people do daring things. The travel around the world which is very hard since they have to get use to the new environment. The have the same grading process and same school prosedgers as us. They get there meals from a car. Circus life is hard with all the training and all the taming, juggling, and acrobatics.

Life in a Circus

 

           Have you ever wondered what it is like to be part of a circus? Well, now I can tell you. Many people may think that being part of a circus is very fun, but it has its ups and downs. It is very hard to stay away from home and travel to 150 cities in only one year. Also, to be a part of a circus, you need the right body type, a specific talent, and be very determined. On a typical day, I wake up at 7:00 and sleep at 12:00.

             But circus life also is fun. Think about it. I perform every day in front of many people. I practice tricks such as leaping from a trampoline onto a horses back, and also somersalting off a running horse. After school, the clowns let me play with their unicycles and juggling balls.

 

             Also, being a part of the circus also means traveling the world. I love visiting different places and meeting new people. Of course, that also means that I cannot go back to my home until after the end of our touring season. That is the part that I don't like about the circus. I have to be away from home for seven months each year!

 

             Another thing that I dont like about being a part of the circus is that I cannot be a part of any sports teams. We never stay in one place long enough to join any classes, and more importantly, I never have time to join a sports team.

 

             And don't forget, I also have to do chores and pratice my tricks and flips. I feed, water, and groom the horses every day so that they will be clean and ready for the big show. We do 10 shows a week: one each weekday, plus an afternoon show on Wendesday, two on Saturday, and two on Sunday.

 

              Now you know that the circus is fun, but it is mostly a busy and tough life.

"Whoa," I said to the horse. I was the trainer and I had to train horse to listen to my commands. The act was that the  horse was suppose to run and at the right time an acrobat would jump off the trampoline and land on the horse.

    The horses name, Joe, was a hard to train horse. Whenever I tried to make him calm down the horse would either kick me or runaway. It was hard for me to train him, he wouldn't listen.

    Not only that, I had to train a group of elephants to walk together and stand on their back legs. I had learned my lesson with elephants. The last time I tried to whip the elephant but instead, he barged out to the circus and ran away. This time I was much kinder to the elephant.

    Finally, after days of practice it was time for the circus. The performer jumped on to the horse, the elephants ran together, and all the other performers did their parts.

    I was wiped out after the performance, but now it was time to move on to the next show. A show miles away.

I'm in my dressing room looking in the closet."What to wear? I'm so nervous, I've never been in front of so many people. What if I mess up? Everyone would laugh at me," I think. "We are on in 10 minutes," someone calls from the front. To my surprise someone opens the door. It's my mom. "Are you nervous," she asks me. "Very," I reply. "It's normal, happened to me on my first preformance. I was just like how you are now, but I was 9 you are 11," she said. "On in 5 minutes," someone calls again from the front. "I used to hate that, it just added to my stress."she said. "What if I fall, what if I mess up, if I'm to nervous to move? Everyone would laugh at me," I said in tears. "I thought that to, but I was fine because I beleived in myself, thats what you need to do. Just beleive in yourself and you will be fine I know you can do it. I beleive in you," she said. "I will be right there with you" she said. She starts to walk away. "Thank you mom," I said just before she walked out the door. "your welcome sweety," mom said. "We are on in 3, 2, 1,"someone shouts again in the front. I walked on stage and walked on the tight rope with mom. "Do you beleiven yourself," she askes me. "Yes i do," I reply.

A Day at the Circus

 

               Today was the best day ever! It was because me and my family went to the circus. When my mother told me I  was very excited so the next day I got up super early to get ready. Finally we got in the car and left i couldn't wait to get there. I had never been to the circus but I always heard about it from my friends. I would always ask my parents and they would usually say maybe I was so happy today it was a yes!

 

 

                When I got out of the car there was a man wearing a tall hat. He welcomed us and asked for our tickets my dad took them out of his pocket and gave them to the man and the man let us in. Right when I walked through the yellow curtains my eyes lit up I saw the juggler and he was on a unicycle! I had always wanted to ride, or even see a unicycle. Then my dad motioned us to our seat. And that was my first memory of my first circus.

 

 

              My name is Andrew I am a juggler in the circus just like i had dreamed. When I was 11 (a year after I went to the circus) I asked my parents for a unicycle for my birthday. They must have thought I was crazy because they both stared at each other then back at me. I told them I wanted to try and ride it like the man at the circus. They told me that unicycles were very hard to ride and that the man was a professional, they also didn't want me to get injured but I didn't care.

 

 

                Instead of getting a unicycle for my 12th birthday I got a set of juggle balls. I thought if my parents weren't going to let me get a unicycle I should learn how to juggle first. At first I tried with two balls, one in each hand. I tossed the right one to the left hand and caught it so I had two balls in my left hand. After I got pretty good at that I tried with three balls but I couldn't do it. The next week I got a phone call from my friend nick asking him if I wanted to come with him and his family to the circus. I asked my mom and she said yes. When I got there we were late so we sat down immediately. During the show when the juggler came out he asked for a volunteer. I raised my hand up high. He closed his eyes and turned around and pointed straight at me.

 

 

                 

                Nervously I walked down to him. He told me that he was going to teach me how to ride a unicycle. I got so excited and by the end of the day I could do it, I could ride a unicycle! After the show I still couldn't juggle so I went up to him and asked him if he could teach me, he gave me his card and walked away. Later that night I told my parents everything and asked if I could call the juggler. They said that I could so I did and he said he would give me lessons.

 And that is how I became a famous circus juggler.

Life in a circus

   

      life in a circus is very hard.  At 7am they wake up to get dressed and go to the pie car for breakfast they also have to set up tents,lights,and music for the show.

at 9am they have to go to school.  they're one room school house travels with them.  like any school,ours has computers,tests,and report cards.  Because the circus performers are from different country s.      

       Also at 3:30 pm they have to do chores and practice.  Bella has to feed,water,and groom the horses they use in there horse back act.  her dad practices somersaulting of a running horse.  Bella practices on leaping from a  trampoline onto a horses back ;it takes balance and concentration.  Other kids are practicing juggling and acrobatics.  They're neighbor walks baby leopards on a leash.  Trainers work with Elephants,Lions, and chimpanzees.

        At 6:30 pm it is dinner time.  Bella's family go to the pie car to eat but they don't eat much.  They do 10 shows a week.  They do one each week day,plus a matinee on Wednesday, two on Saturday,and two on Sunday.  They have to travel to different places in the wold to perform.

        After the show they are all tired.  To get back to their trailer they have to pass the circus offices, concession stands, stables, and trailers.  Two days later they will be set up again.  But first they have to travel to that place.  They begin the day the same way all over again.

        Working in a circus is good because you learn different languages.  Also because you could make other people feel happy.  Clowns paint their face with different feeling like happy, or angry.  Clowns make people feel happy that's why they are the main person in the show.  The animal trainers risk them selfs to train lions, elephants, and chimpanzees....

People in the circus have to work in the circus for several hours. Some familiess travel up to 20,000 miles in seven months in each year, visiting more than 150 cities. Some kids work up to sunup and sundown.

 

Usually  most kids wake up a 7:00 A.M. wake up, get dressed, and go to some place to eat for a light but heavy breakfast like pancakes and bacon (that way they don't get sick).

 

Then at 9:00 A.M. it's school time. Some circus people have a one-room schoolhouse. Like any other school theirs just the same. but because circus performers kids are from all over the world the have kids that speak different languages, like French, Russian, and Italian.

 

At 3:00 P.M. school's over and they have time for a quick break.

At 6:30 P.M. It's dinner time and the families can't eat much, because their performing that night. They do 10 shows a week: one each week day, plus a matinee on Wensday, two on Saterday, and two on Sunday.

Life at the circus

By: Devin Tilawen

 

 Hi! I'm Charlie I'm 18 years old and I work at the circus. The trapeze is my specialty. In fact the ring master says I'm his favorite trapeze artist. Even my best friend Jason the lion tamer says I'm good. I'm not so sure though.

 

 Our circus travels all over Europe and Asia performing in places like Russia, France, China, England, and Taiwan but, my favorite place to visit is Italy that's where I'm from.We only take one or two trips a year and that day is today! When were in Italy I'll only have one day to be with my family so I'm going to make the most of it. Jason and his family are from Italy too. Jason's looks almost as exited as I am.

 

 That was the best trip to Italy ever. First I went to my parents house where they had set up a surprise welcome home party for me. Then we went to my favorite pizza place down the street, and I was stuffed by the time we left. After that we went next door to Jason's house. He was so happy to see us. His parents had also thrown him a surprise party too. He offered me cake but I told him I was full.

 

We hang around his place for a few hours. Next it was time to perform Jason and I had convinced the ring master to give our families front row seats right next to each other. Our families looked so happy while we were performing. Finally after the show it was time to hit the road again. Jason and I said our goodbyes as we got in train. We were sad to leave, but I bet next time will be even better.

My Circus Life

 

    I was practicing my rutine and i almost slipped off the bar. Thank goodness there was a net there! I would have hurt myself really bad. Well if your wondereing what I'm talking about, well then im talking about acrobat! The easiest circus performance that you could fall and probaly break something.

     What I have learned from being in acrobatist for awhile, is that it takes a lot of muscles, concentration, and balance. Although it might seem so fun, its not. You could fall or if you look down it might be scary to you. So dont look down. It might seem scary at first  but trust me it gets better.

       A couple years ago my parents joined the circus, my sisters and I  joined with them. At first we were juggleing. Now Im an acrobatist. Well sort of, Im really low to the ground but im still haigh enough to where i need a net under me. One of my sisters is training the horses, my other sister is on the tightrope. She needs really good balance to be on the tightrope, the good thing is that she has a net under her as well, shes gotten the hang of things but she still has fallen. My other sister, shes still trying to get the hang of things. I on the other hand, have never fell. I have slipped before, thats because i was supposed to.

       When I get older i want to stay in the circus although im still in school, i dont mind the chores. I think whenever i do chores its an easier way to get more exersise. Ayway, when I am out of school im still going to be an acrobatist and I'm still going to do all my chores. Now you know about my circus life.

Circus life is pretty hard. I should know. My dad and I travel all over with the circus for shows. I miss my family sometimes, so I call my mom every week. There is some fun to it however.

 

   I am part of a trampoline act in the circus. It is pretty fun! I have to do lot of flips then land on a horse which rides me off stage. It takes a lot of practice to get all the flips and leaps down. All while on a trampoline! If it is pulled of correctly, the act looks amazing and pro-like. Thats what I want it to look like.

 

   There are some bad things about being in the circus. You work long hours (including the weekends) and rarely get a break. You also have poor schooling as well. Plus living in a trailer isn't the best kind of home. Also if you make friends, you will have to leave them. You can not comemit to any sports outside of the circus either.

 

  As you can see, there are good and bad things about being in the circus. So it's yur choice if you want to be in it.

circus life

       Hi my name is Bella Castini i live in a big trailer with my family,we travel a lot i am in a circus i work all day 7am to 12pm at 7am i wake up and get ready for the day when im ready i go to the pie cart for breakfast.At 9am i go to school we have a one room school house there are   other kids from all over the world so they speak diffrent languages; french,russian,and italian.Im buisy all day the rest i do even more at the end of the day i get to play and have fun every night.

The Wrath of the CEO

     "Get back to work all of you! No food! No money!" " I am telling the police, fatso!" WHIP!!! "Owwwwwww!" "Ow, Ow, Ow!" I said. I have just been whipped by the meanest, worst Chief Executive Officer ever. His name is Mr. Meani and we, me and my fellow workers, call him Fatso Meany. He owns the Circus of Awesomeness. We don't ever get a paycheck nor any food. Not even the children! He even put a fence around the circus so we don't run away.

      Well because of all this nonsense we are on strike. The children can't work anyways because they have no food. STOMP STOMP STOMP! Yes! the law enforces are here. They are looking around the circus. Many of the workers thank them for coming here. Then suddenly one of the law enforcers asks all the kids to come to him. He sees that they are starving. So, he tells Mr. Meani that he will have to bring the children home.

       There is a performance tonight and we plan to perform very poorly. The trapeze artist is going to fall of the trapeze. The animal handlers are going to forget the animals in the trailer, and I, the tightrope walker, will cut the rope when I am supposed to walk on it. Minutes before the circus, we practiced how we would mess the show up. During the practice I got bruised badly, and so did the trapeze artist because we fell down, but we still had the heart to spoil the show.

       After the show, the CEO was really mad. He was as mad as a bear who had been disturbed from hibernation. He made us all stand in a line and blindfolded us. Then he whipped each and every one of us a couple times. Some of the older workers were moaning on the floor after that! We got so mad at this that we decided that we had to escape somehow. We brainstormed for hours but then with each idea we ended up realizing that we would be caught. Then I thought why don't we make an underground tunnel that leads us out. So, we started to make this tunnel.

        When we were done with it we decided to make batches of ten and give them names. My batch's name was Gemini. We were supposed to be the last batch to go. The first five batches were a success. When the sixth batch, Draco, went through the tunnel they were discovered by the CEO. The CEO was outrageous he had everyone whipped three times.

         Then Draco went again, this time they escaped. Now that there were only 40 people left, the CEO was realizing that the we were up to something. For this reason, we decided the rest of the batches should go right away. When we were done the CEO was outrageous. He had lost all his workers. When the law enforcers came again they saw that there were no workers and that we had left notes describing how the CEO had treated us. So, Mr. Meani was arrested and put into jail. The remaining of us escaped to the Circus of Kavish and lived happily ever after.

A life in a circus has many ups and downs. Other than ups and downs there are many different activities before and after a circus performence. We do many tricks like acrobatics, gymnastics, juggling, and many different tricks and fun.

 

    First, there is waking up then going to the pie cart, which is the place where all circus performers eat. After breakfast, they go to a school on the go in the trailers. The school has computers, tests, and report cards just like regular schools.

 

   Then they have quick breaks from work. They have fun practicing juggling, trampoline, acrobatics, and gymnastics. Then they have chores and practice for the circus performance. The chores include grooming, watering, and feeding the horses in the stable. They practice jumping on the trampoline and then onto a horse which requires great concentration. Many others are practicing juggling, acrobatics, and gymnastics

 

   Then comes the show at night. Everyone eats before the show but not too much because they are performing later. Then they all go to their trailer and rest for the night. They do the same thing for two days then move on. That is a daily life of a circus performer.

The Life of a Circus Performer

 

I am walking on a tight rope! The crowds cheering for me, as I

am also juggling. I am only a few yards away from the end. Oh no, i start to lose my balance. The crowds worried but I am determined to get across. This is my life in a circus.

Even though I am juggling I try to regain my balance. I am on

balance and the crowd cheers for me. I make it across the tight rope. I then go down and do my next act. I start bouncing o the tampoline and get ready to somersault onto the horse's back. It takes timing.

Life in a Circus

       On a bright sunny day of June 30, 2012, I awoke by the sound of people eating and taking showers at 7:00 am. I got up and quickly went to change and take my shower because I knew this was another day at the circus. After a lunch of pancakes and bacon, I am at school at 9:00 am. I come prepared to school with all my pencils, erasers, notebooks, and textbooks. At 3:00 pm, school is finally over and I take a little break. After I finish my homework I then I practice the stunts I will perform during the circus show tonight. When we finish dinner of pasta and spaghetti and meatballs, we prepare at 6:30 pm and go to our three hour long circus show.

       I walk on two separate tightropes while I juggle five bowling pins while my dad is walking a alleged tiger while riding on a six feet tall unicycle. My mom is walking on a ball while juggling seven bowling pins. We received a wild standing ovation from the audience. After our turn is done, the next group goes on. The next group is even more wild and receives a great applause when a person does a double front flip and lands on his feet gently. Then the next group goes and then it is followed until the last group comes. After the three hour show is over, we walk back to the trailer sluggishly and tired.

       We go to bed and hope to sleep quickly knowing that we have another show to perform the very next day.

The Circus

 

 

Now I know what your thinking, your probably really bored and you have nothing to do and you decided to read the story with the cheesiest title you could find. Well bub, trust me, this is going to be a story for the ages.

 

Now it was a usual circus day with normal circus behavior. Steve the stuntman was perfecting his normal routine of being shot out of a cannon, Dion our head juggler is trying to get a grip on the chainsaws, Alfred was training with animals, and myself, Kamyar the Incredible, was on the tight rope as usual walking back and forth with some tricks through in there as well. Then suddenly, the unthinkable happened. the baddest man on the planet, Billy "the toad" Johnson. He was nicknamed the toad because he really liked swamps and had really bumpy skin. Anyway back to the story. Out of nowhere he broke into the our tent and mugged us. Yah, you read correctly, mugged us, this is no kid story! He stole nearly everything there including some of our extra clothes. We were wondering what we could do with just two days before our big performance. " Hey guys, how about we make an A-Team," said Steve. "That's an awesome idea Steve!" "I call being Mr.T!" Okay Dion, you can be Mr.T."

 

We decided on our new costumes and we became the A-team. We then arrived at the police station to ask them what they know about Billy Johnson. We learned that he loves to disguise himself in a variety of costumes. So we made a plan of action for how we were going to capture "the toad" and we came up with this. Since the police had told us his location by one of their undercover operatives. So we decided that we where going to disguise our van like an ice cream truck, sneak up on him, and arrest him. We were set. Once we were in the same location and spotted "the toad" with his disguise it was go time. Dion and I rolled out of the van and hide close by Billy, while Steve and Alfred we driving the van with the cops in the same direction. Once Dion and I were right behind Mr. Johnson we jumped on him, tied him up, and ploped him onto the van. We then had found all of our things in time for the show. We never heard from Billy "the toad" Johnson ever again. Yes, I know this is about as cheesy as it gets but I will do it anyway. The end.

My life in a circus

Tip tip tap. I just finished my stretches. Now I'm ready to practice my tricks for the contest. First, I start with my triple back flip. Then, I practice my acrobat skills with Joey. OK. I'm ready. The pressure is on as I walk onto the stage. I take a deep breath and show my skills. "Bravo! Bravo!" the manager says." You're hired." This has been the best time of my life.

 

My first day starts off as practicing my trampolining with Joey who was also hired. After everyone have there parts practiced,  our first circus show starts. Everyone swung like colorful butterflies and there were no mistakes. The show was a success! The crowds cheered and we knew they wanted more. So, we continued to have more shows. Gradually, we had a show everyday! Everyone loves our circus and will continue to be successful.

the end

Circus Life

                                     by Nalani Santos

 

Circus life isn't all just fun and games. Circus life isn't easy it's full of difficulties and I, Florence Scaboldi, should know. I live in a trailer with my mama and papa.

 

  Every morning we wake up do our morning routine and then go to the pie car. We eat breakfast while the crews are setting up  tents, lights, and music for tonight's show.

 

  Then, it's time for school in our one-room schoolhouse that travels with us.Our school is like any other. The other circus performers are from all over the world so some of my classmates are: French, Russian, and Italian like me.

 

  After school it's time for a break I play with the clowns, animals, and my pet Baxter, he's small because we don't have any room in our trailer for a big dog.

 

  Then I have to chores and practice my acrobatics. First, I take care of the horses we use in some of our acts. After that, it's time to practice for the show on the Spanish web and my dad practices carrying my mom, while he's hanging on a rope, with nothing but a kabob skewer!

 

  Time for dinner. My family and I go to the pie car, but eat a little food because we have a show soon. We do ten shows a week: one each weekday, plus two on Saturday and two on Sunday.

 

  At 10:30 P.M. the show is over and I'm exhausted. Walking back to our trailer, we pass the circus offices, concession stands, stables, and trailers. In two days we'll set up for another show.

 

  Later, at midnight I'm thinking about the end of the tour across the country. It would be nice to go back home to Napol, Italy. I think if I will be a circus performer when I'm an adult like my mama and papa? Who knows? The circus is fun, but it's a hard and busy life.

Alysonni's Crazy Circus Life

                                                                    by: Naydeen Garnica

 

 

       Alysonni Aurora Gypsina is a 17 year old Italian acrobat who performs in many circuses around the world. She has an 18 year old partner from Ireland named Alexzanderr Madonicase. They work together during shows and are best friends. But one day, Alysonni's leg and foot broke during one of the tricks in practice. She was taken to the nearest hospital with costume and all and had her leg checked out. When the results came back they showed that her foot was severely fractured and she had to have surgery on it. They thought that she may never be able to do another trick again.

 

       While she was recovering form her surgery for a whole nine months, Alexzanderr came to visit her every day until she went back to her home in Italy. While in Italy Alysonni thought about quitting her dreams of being an acrobat in Cirque Du Soleil. On her 18th birthday she got a call from Alexzanderr asking her to go to one of the shows in Italy. She quickly obliges and 3 days later her and her family go to the circus she once performed at.

 

       At the show, Alexzanderr dedicated his performance to her. After the show they met up and Alexzanderr was so happy to see her. They called each other every day since then. Alysonni had already got her cast off and was almost ready to perform again. She was still anxiously waiting to perform again.

 

After the nine months passed, Alisonni was able to perform again. She was done waiting for the moment when she was finally able to be back and do another performance with Alexzanderr. After awhile, her and Alexzanderr both achieved their dream and made it to a Cirque Du Soleil show and became one of the best duo's in the whole circus industry.

My name is Samuel Adams. My family owns our very own circus. I will tell you my normal day.

 

6:30 a.m.

 

I wake up and get dressed. Then, I go to the cart behind me to eat breakfast. I always have pankakes, baken, and a sausage.

 

7:10 a.m.

 

My family begin to set everything up (whe do have some help though).

 

10:50 a.m.

 

Everything is set up. We relax for a while from all of the hard work.

 

11:30 a.m.-1:10 p.m

 

We eat lunch. I alway have a ham and cheese, PB and J, or grilled cheese samwich.

 

1:15 p.m.

 

We practice until 2:00 p.m.

 

2:05 p.m.

 

I go to school until show time. I learn all different languages, for I need to know how to speak all of the different languages of the places I go to.

 

7:00 p.m

 

Now it is showtime!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

 

11:00 p.m

 

The show is over, and I am wore out.

 

1:00 a.m

 

Time for bed!

circus life

 

 

        In the circus there are many fun things to do, but not everything is. There is a car,  called a pie car. That is where we go to eat. 

 

       I keep a daily schedule on my wall.  And now that i am  telling you about it i might as well show you.  8:00 A.M. i wake up and go to the pie car.  Where we "circus clowns" eat. 

 

     When it is 10:00 A.M. i go to tight rope practice.  This activity is the most dangerous in the circus.  I use special shoes that have squishy bottoms.

 

 

     At 12:00 P.M.  We have our first show.  This show is always different because we can bring the elephants out.  My dad brings the elephants out for the first show only because they are not completely trained yet

 

     4:00 P.M i have free time, sort of like recess the clowns play with me, they act like they are driving motor cycles.  

 

 

      I have school too.  There is a train car in the back end of the train.  That is where my mom teaches me, and my sister haley.

 

     The name of our circus is Wild Thangs.

Life on the Circus

 

It all started in tiny little Italy. Dad came home and we were eating dinner. Then Dad anounounced,"I have been promoted to the circus." Then Mom said,"Yes, that's fantastic, and i have been promoted as well. As an acrobat." I stood up and said,"But, I have school. And I have friends!" "Sorry honey, but you need to go with us." "No, just no!" "Isabel, there is an on the move school. And I'm sure might make a few friends." "No!" Isabel stormed off. She was angry.

                                            Finally, it was morning. Isabel woke up and sat on her bed. Her mom walked into her bedroom. "Mom, was it true, was it true about the circus?" "Yes dear, it is. We start packing tonight." "But mom, I don't want to!" "Hush! I am tired of your anger. Don't say any more." "But," "No!" Isabel's mom stormed out of the room. "I just wanted to say goodbye." Isabel found a bag and started packing. "Dad, Mom is angery at me." "Yes, I know."  "Can I speak to her?" "No, she isn't in the mood." "Oh"

                                  Isabel and her family rode in a train to a big building then started their journey with the circus.

The circus 

 

 

 

          Life is just like a circus you have amazing events. A circus travels around the world  doing amazing acts. If you want to be in a circus you have to have  talent a strong and flexible body and be determined. Although you might think to be a circus preformer does not include learning it actualy does . Traveling around the world includes geography. Have you ever thought what job you would like to have if you were a circus preformer. In my opinion i would be  a acrobatic.

           In the circus you might see exotic animals like elephants, tigers, bears, camels, seals,lions, and horses. You may also see amazing acts like lion taming, trapeeze, acrobatics, clowns, fire eating, and sword eating.The circus is a big group a people who travel around the worl amazing other people. You might also see people from all over the world. they might speak different languages too.

          Have you ever thought if it would be fun to live with a circus. in my opinion it would actualy be fun but hard. It would be fun because you meet people from all around the world and learn how to speak different languages. It would be hard because you would have a lot of chores and you would have to wake up early.There is many fun expieriences in a circus . You would also do the same routine every day.

          In a circus the main colors are red and white well in my opinion there the main colors because they represent the clowns. Clowns are the main act in a circus. Most people go to the circus just to see the clowns. Clowns are funny and amazing.Clowns are probably the main act.

          In a circus there is a total of 12 jobs. There's  trapeez, acrobatics, lion taming, training animals, food vendor, juggling, ticket vendor,ring master,usher, stage hand, clown, merchandise vendor. These are the main jobs in a circus. The jobs are not ordered . This is a circus.

Working At The Circus

 

 

 

               If you are just starting out at a circus you might want to clear your schedule. Being a acrobat is a hard and long routine. You will need to learn all the tricks. Other things at a circus is easier. If you fall when doing you acroat tricks it heurts if theres no net or if it riped.?

 

               If you want to do somthing else you also need to practice that. Juggiling is hard, that takes concertation and skill. You need to have even objects. If you don't have even stuff you will mess up and get embaressed. If you use sharp things you need to be extra careful.

 

               Other things are a bit easier. Taming animals is easier because the animals are half trained at the zoo and half at the circus. Only certain animals are at the circus. Monkeys, tigers, and dogs are the main animals at the circus. There are so many I named a few.

 

               

                Also another job is mortor cycling. Where you are in a big cage and do tricks and loops. It is the coolest thing you could ever imagine and see. It is the most popular thing to do.but it takes major concentration.

What Happens In The Circus?

 

         Have you ever wondered what happens in the circus Annavelle knows shes in the animal act.Everybody plays and horses around.But if you think its all fun and games your wrong.They have to practice and practice."Its not just thinking that everythings going to go well in the show" says Abigal whose in the pony act."You need to know the shows going to go well and be confident it well" said Fernando the juggler.

 

        Ana the boss and dancing salsa master said, that you practice and never everthink the circus is a joke.Junior the tightrope walker said that it is really hard to walk on a rope.You need to be really focused and need to be goood at balancing."You really need to be careful with the horeses they are tricky" said Angel he's in the horse act.I'm the animal trainer Guadalupe.We have five dogs Paloma,Pepe,Bonbon,Diego, and Gita.

 

        Then theres the youngest performers Hector,who we call Juju is 5.Ariana is 6.Their in the acrobats act.Nows the clown Miguel,who we call Miguelito.He is 7 and extremely funny!The dogs are funny too.Once they did a pyrimid and fell,then they got in a fight because when they fell they all hit each other.Once in a while we all throw a free show for everyone.We also have a motorcycle guy,Arturo.We have a elephant named Tom and a cheetah named Jerry.Outside we have a pony ride and a cheetah run.The two ponys are called Chunky and Munchy.We are all the Circus Family.

My big suprise

by Abby Neal

 

The day before the big suprise I went to my G-mom and G-dad's house(who are my grandma and grandpa.)they said they had a suprise for me and my little brother Gavin, who was 4 at the time.We were so excited but G-mom said "we can't do it untill tomarrow, ok".

 

 

We both  said ok.Gavin said "I wonder what it will be, maybe a new pool or a big huge new playhouse"  "I don't think it's going to be that big" I replied back to him.the rest of the day me and Gavin couldn't stop thinking about the big suprise we just couldn't seem to get it out of out head's.

 

 

That night I couldn't go to sleep because I cept wondering what it was.I tried to turn music on and that didn't work,I tried to close my eyes and that didn't work,And I tried to count sheep but that didn't work either so I just stayed awake but all of the sudden I hear a sound in Gavin's room so I go in there the lights are on and he's under the cover's playing on his leap pad.

 

 

So I sneak up to him  and pull the covers off real fast and he gaspes.He say's "sissy" real loud I say "shhhhhhh try to be more quiet".He say's "ok I can't go to sleep so I decided that I would  play on my leap pad".

 

 

So I say "can I play on It too"? "sure" Gavin replied.So me and Gavin played on it for hour's and hour's untill I look at Gavin's Angry  bird alarm clock and it was exactly 1:00 AM in the morning.All of the sudden I tell Gavin really fast its 1:00 in the morning.

 

 

Gavin say's "we better get some sleep" I agreed with him let's get some sleep.Gavin put's his leap pad up and jump's in bed.I go back in my room and fall right back to sleep.

 

 

In the morning I get up wake Gavin up and we go into the bathroom to brush our teeth we look in the mirror and we both have bags under our eyes so I go through G-moms makeup bag and find some liquid foundation so I put it under our eyes and we looked good as new.

 

 

We all got dressed and got in the car G-mom and G-dad drove us to our big suprise.IT WAS A CARNIVAL!!!!!!!!! Me and Gavin were siked we all ran out of the car after we parked and dashed right through the door when we all got in there,there were thousands of  people.

 

 

 

So me and Gavin held G-mom and G-dad's hand we stopped by the cotten candy magine and the popcorn stand and got all kinds of stuff.When we walked through the doors to get our seats it said "The Amazing Ring Ling Brothers.

 

 

 

When we got our seats the lights went off and the big speakers said "welcome to the ringling brothers stadium.when the show started we all were so excited.Once they started everybody screamed and shouted they were so excited  and so were we.

 

 

they jougled and walked a rope over a shark tank and made clowns pop out of a teeny car and people were also spinning on giant ropes.And a whole lot of other stuff that was really cool like make lions jump over you it was fantastic.

 

 

When we got home we were worn out we went right to sleep on the couch it wore us out. and that was our big suprise.

 

THE END
Me and my family went to the circus. It was lots of fun.

Life In the Circus

 

        Life in the circus isn't always easy.  Trust me.  Performing in the circus takes a lot of practice, time, skill, and talent.  We practice five days a week until 8:30 p.m. 

 

   

        The circus, of course, travels all the time so we are never in the same town for more than three days.  When we travel we ride with all of the circus performers and all of the technical and stunt crew.  We have been to 35 states so far and we are not stopping now!

 

 

       When we perform we do six different acts. My stunt is walking on the tightrope.  Really fun!!!!  When I turn 16 I will move on to doing the acrobatic stunts.  The other stunts are the clowns, acrobats,jugglers,the circus horses, and then my favorite one the canon shooting.  Yes, these stunts are dangerous but, it's all worth it in the end.

 

 

        We are having a contest that anyone can enter and win a free trip and more!  So, enter, try to win, and if you win I'll see you there!!!!  Good luck!!!!!!!!!!

In the circus life you can't just go join the circus. You have to have a specific talent. You need to understand that at 7:00 A.M. you wake up get dressed and go to the pie car. 9:00 A.M. School time. Our one room school house travels with us. 3:00 P.M.Schools over,time for a quick break.3:30 P.M. Chores and practice.6:30 P.M. Dinnertime. 10:30 P.M. The show is over :00 A.M. In bed thinking about the end of our touring season. One of the upsides is that you get to travel all around the world. You get to work in Australia, Japan and all over North America. The circus has given me the opportunity to go to so many different places and meet so many different people. I travel on the road with 100 people who are like a circus family to me. When you're young it's the time to do it. It's the time to travel, the time to grow and experience your life. It's great to see the faces of the audience just jump alive when I make eye contact with them during a performance. Despite what many people think the life of a circus performer isn't all high flying fun its just great to see the fans.
