            But a guy swinging from tight ropes fell and broke his leag. An ambulance came right away. So thats when the show ended.   

           Going to a circus is fun. Alot of coool charitars and animals. You should go to a circus i know you will like it. You will have a blast!

One fine day a girl named Fluffleluffagus was on summer vacation. She was so bored, then on t.v she saw the circus was looking for new performers and she suddenly had an idea that just popped into her head, she could join the.................. CIRCUS!!! But how would she tell her mom, should she run away, no that would scare her mom half to death, maybe she could slip a note into her bedroom, or maybe she should tell her mom face to face, no because she would then get really MAD. So she decided to slip a note into her mom's bedroom. Then she was off to the circus.

 

          She finally reached the circus in Idaho. She made it into the circus because the boss was a clown, so he'd hire anybody. She did her first performance after two weeks of training but she couldn't hold on so she decided to do a trick where she tied 100 balloons to her waist in just the nick of time before she hit the ground she started floating up , everyone was amazed! Most people were so astounded that they passed out.

 

          She missed her mom and she asked the clown to see if she could call her and this is what the clown said, "I can't let you do that,

because my boss will hit me with a bat". So she just turned away and she decided it was time to go home. She missed her mom and she missed her puppy, Noodles. So she left a not near the front door near the boss's office. Then she was off to her real home.

 

          It took her three days and three nights before she reached her front door. She rung the doorbell and her mother was in tears and swooped her up in her arms and did not want to let go. As soon as she let her down Noodles came running and licked her face clean. They were so happy after that. And Fluffleluffagus never ran away again.

Anyone who thinks circus life is nonstop play is crazy.   I, Bella Castini, know differently.   I live in a big trailer with my family.   We travel 20,000 miles in seven monthes each year, visiting 150 cities.   I work from sunup to sundown.   Here's a typical day for me: 7:00 A.M I wake up, get dressed, and go to the pie car1 for pancakes and bacon.   The crews are setting up tents, lights, and music for tonight's show.   9:00 A.M. School time. Our one-room schoolhouse travels with us.   Like any school, ours has computers, tests, and report cards.   Because the circus performers are from all over the world, many of my classmates speak other languages: Franch,Russian, and Italian, like my family.   As we travel around the country, our geography lessons come alive.   3:00 P.M. School's over---time for a quick break.   The clowns let me play with their unicycle and juggling balls

She was ruhed to the hospital in a circus ambulance and was told her cuncussion would disable her for the rest of her life. She was up set about having to leave the circus but Amber was glad she could stay home. Amber still went and watched the circus but never performed again in her life.

A Wonderful Circus

 

 

          Hello! My name is Casandra the Great. I am a magican that works here in the circus. Life here is always fun, but it is also tough.Our whole family works in the circus. We each have a different act. My brother is a clown, my sisters are acrobats, and my mom and dad are animal trainers. It's a lot of fun especially when you make someone happy. People think that being in a circus is a lot of fun, and it is, but it also requires hard work. If you want to know more about the circus life, keep reading!

 

          The first thing I do is wake up in the morning and go to the pie cart to eat breakfast. If none of my family is up I go to wake them up to give me breakfast. Then I get ready to go to school. I know what your thinking, "how does this girl go to school if she keeps moving", the truth is we have a trailer that looks a lot like a classroom and all the kids go there so we could learn. For our recess, We go to the horses and ride them. We also go and see what the clowns are doing like my brother. After our recess, we go back to the trailer and start learning again until lunch. For lunch, we all go to eat corndogs, hotdogs, and popcorn. This is just in the moring! Of course we get out of the classroom in the afternoon, but this is what we do in the morning! Are you starting to see that being in a circus is hard work! If you don't keep reading.

 

          When we get out of the classroom, I go into my trailer and just relax. I might also go and play with my brother and sisters. I would also play with my dog Coco. He is a small dog. Then I start getting ready for the show. We all start practicing for the show. Of course I always practice on my brother. I always do tricks on them to see how my tricks end up. I always need to concentrate on my tricks. If I lose my concentration I will mess up real bad! I always need to think on that day's show. Then when we are finish practicing, we go to the piecart and eat. We are not allowed to eat a lot though. This is in the afternoon! Next, is the show.

 

          The show is finally here! This is always the time when everybody is nervous except me. I am always the opening act. It's always a great honor when you get the opening act. It is also awesome that you get to amaze them first. We always need to worry about who goes on first and second and so on. There is especially some preformers that get sick because they are really nervous. Now you know that it is a hard job.

 

          Now you know! It isn't a easy job. To be a circus preformer you will need to be confident and determined. You would also have to be used to staying up late. If you have all these traits then join! you would love it!

Life In The Circus

 

 

     

     Life in the circus is really entertaining to the crowd. The circus is fun and entertaining because circus clowns are trying to make people laugh. Acrobats fly around and do backflips and frontflips to the audience. Circus jugglers maybe juggle rings, chainsaws, and other fun and dangerous things. The tightrope walker tries to balance on two feet and tries to balance on one foot. That is how life in a circus is really entertaining.

 

     Circus clowns are funny and make people laugh. They do juggling, funny jokes, other tricks, and fun things. Clowns can make little kids cry when they show up. They can do a lot of daring tricks. They can also do magic to kids and grown ups.

 

     Acrobats make people amazed when they do amazing stunts. They can also do backflips amd frontflips. They can also ride a motorcycle and balance it with the rope. Life in the circus is really hard for people who are in the circus show. The acrobats maybe practine in gymnastics and in gymnasiums. They can also swing each other around the circus. When they swing around, they come back to there normal spots. 

 

     A circus tightrope walker amazes people when they balance on one rope. They can use two long sticks and put it on there feet and still they can still balance on one rope. They can use a unicycle and can ride across the rope and doesn't fall. The experience of a tightrope walker is to be determined and be really good at balancing. I think tightrope walkers have the hardest job in the circus.

 

     Circus animals do a lot of animal tricks in front of people. The trainer of the animals must work hard in this job. The animals can do tricks like balancing on a ball, being disappeared in the cage, and jumping on rock to rock. Animals like horses can jump and can stand up for a certain time. It takes a lot of work to be a trainer of all the animals in the circus.

 

     It takes a lot of work to be part of the circus. Being an animal trainer is really hard, but you still have to strike hard in it. My favorite circus part is the acrobats. I like it because they do awsome stunts. Philippa said that when you're young It's time to do it. It takes a lot of work to be in a circus job because you don't have time to rest and you are busy everyday.

Crazy Circus Life

                                  By:Sydney Cox

 

 

6:00 AM-Wake-up-Get ready for the day-Breakfast

   Today I woke up, it was Saturday in New York,that means two circuses for today.I threw on my Miss Me Jeans,My hot pink Hollister T-Shirt,and put on my American Eagle Super Sparkly black Flats,Then I went to the Pie car and ate four stacks of pancakes.I was starving, we had a big day ahead of us.By the way my name is Sydney.

 

7:00 AM-Practice For the afternoon show

     I am the oldest tight rope and trapeze artist,So, I work with Zack. Zack is the oldest (and rudest) male trapeze artist and he is only twelve!So that leaves all the other girls working with the younger boys. I'm only eleven and all the other girls and boys ten and younger.In practice we learned how to hold each other by the arms and legs while one of us are keeping us both up in the air without slipping its the hardest thing that the younger kids are allowed to do.

 

11:00 AM-Lunch and prep for show

     At lunch I had two burgers each.Fortunately Zack and I had to stop eating to to go to our separate dressing rooms toget into our matching outfits ecept that mine was a dress and his were pants and a shirt.My dress is purple with  strips of blue on my skirt.And Zack's outfit was a purple shirt and blue pants with purple stripes on the outside of the legs.

 

12:20 PM-Afternoon Show

    We Had a blast during the trapeze act it was sooo fun we were swinging from one side to another and forming U shapes with each-other. Our parents said that it was the best act that they had seen in years!

 

5:30-Snack-Practice For Late Night Show

    Since we did such a great job at the afternoon performance our pernets moved us to the advanced trapeze group.So we got to just watch what the advanced group did but I have to be honest, we still did better than the advanced adults.

 

 

7:30 PM-Late Night Show

     During the late night show the adults seemed to like us better than the kids earlier that day! It was an amazing event.The Adults loved us and we loved them I mean after all we are better than the adult trapeze artists.

 

 

10:00 PM-Dinner-Bed time

      We had Tacos For dinner that night because of our prefomance and went to bed.Every night i go to bed thinking about our house in California, I miss it a lot sometimes, epically on nights like this.Even though I hate Zack, I had a fun time with him tonight.

 

 

 

                            THE END

My Life In The Circus

In a circus, a traveling circus, I walked around to view the trainers. They were getting ready for tonight's big show. It was hard to focus. I knew I needed to practice, but my mind kept telling me not to. I was tight-rope walking over fire.

   "Okay." I was talking to myself. When did I ever talk to myself? I was nervous. Very nervous. I was aware there is going to be a net between me and the fire, but I don't trust nets. I have fell through one twice already. I was balancing two feet above the ground when Autumn walked in. Autumn was a horse trainer, and a very good one. She could persude a horse to jump through fire!

      "Oww!" I fell on the ground. She startled me. "Oh! Sorry." Autumn helped me up. "I need to talk to you about your act." I was comfortly seated in a chair. "My act? Why?" I asked. "I know your'e nervous, everyone is. But the audience doesn't want a net to help you." Autumn was trying to sound as calm as possible, but it was hard not to. I just stared ahead. Out to the circus tent. I could hear beyond to red and orange stripes, into the big tent with bleachers and trainers.

     "Hello?" Autumn wasn't very patient. "Oh! Sorry. I-I am afraid. Even without the net that never really works, I'm really nervous." Now I was pacing around the caravan. I didn't know what to do. I know, I needed to be confident, but how could I? I needed balance, and when you're scared that doesn't help. But I agreed to walk on a string, anyways.

     "Balance!" Autumn yelled at me from nearly thirty feet below. "That doesn't help." I whispered. At least there wasn't any fire yet. There would be at dress rehersal. "What?!" Autumn couldn't hear me. "I said," I finished the rope. "I said, yelling doesn't help." Now I was climbing down the ladder. "Okay. Dress rehersal in an hour." Autumn walked out of the wide, open tent.  

     Dress rehersal was fine. I just did not look down. If I did, I would fall into flames.I survived-dress rehersal! Now for the the real show. I stood up by the tight-rope the whole time before my act, posing and pretending to be scared at dangerous stunts. It was time. I closed my eyes. "Don't look down. Don't look." I forced myself. Alright. There was a twist.

Circus Life

     

       "Hey, you, yeah you, right there!", ALL of you folks that think that the circus is fun, listen to me.... IT'S NOT!!! Well, that's what I think. Good afternoon welcome to the circus. My name is Abbie and I've worked in the circus for eight years now.My job is to train and do shows with big cats.

This is our every day scedual:

 

7:00 a.m-get dressed and go to the pie cart to eat breafast

 

7:30a.m-feed the lions, tigers,and leporids

 

8:00a.m-give baths and groom the tigers ,lions ,and lepords

 

8:30a.m-train the tigers,lions,and lepords new tricks

 

9:00a.m-time for afternoon shows

 

9:30a.m-eat lunch

 

10:00a.m- feed the tigers,lions, and lepords again

 

10:30a.m-review tricks again

 

11:00a.m-practice show

 

11:30a.m-then do a actual show

 

12:00a.m-feed the animals again

 

12:30a.m-review the tricks

 

1:00-6:00p.m do shows

 

6:30p.m -eat dinner

 

7:30p.m go to sleep

Bella wakes up and goes to a pie car and she gets her pancakes and bacon while the crews set up the tents,lights,and music for there tonight shows.At 9:00 A.M. she has to go to school her is one of the trailers that travel with the circus.

 

      At 3:00 P.M. she comes back from her school then she star playing with her dog name Noodle. she does not have enough time to play with her dog because she needs to practice for the circus and that takes a lot of practice and time away.Bella has to do her chores, her chores are to she feeds,she waters the plants,and she grooms the horse that they use in their horseback acts.

                          And thats the life of  Bella Castini

"The Time we Went  Camping"

                  It's true that here in the circus we work hard,but we never miss an opportunity to have fun. In fact,last spring,we went camping in a forest in North America. It was the best time of our lives. It was also way better than shoveling the poop off the training equipment. Although it was the only camping trip of our lives,it was still the best camping trip of our lives.

                   Our day started out like any other ordinary day; wake up,eat,and go to school. After practicing our routines,we dressed for the show. After the show,instead of going to our trailers  and putting on our pajamas,the ringmaster announced that we would be going camping with the rest of the circus. I was excited of course, but my parents looked as if they had won the lottery. They were as happy as clams to take a rest from work. Naturally,there was a catch to skipping work...we had to bring food for everyone! Not even that could take away the excitment of going camping for the first time in our lives. So the next day,after the show, we packed our bags and went to the forest behind the circus tents. Since we had to bring food,my mom brought s'mores,potato salad,fried chicken,and chips & dip. Man,did we eat a lot! Within the first hour of our trip,we had already finished half of the chicken. While eating,we were telling scary stories. When it came the time for me to tell my terrifying tale,my parents didn't want me to get nightmares,so they decided it was time for me to begin going to sleep. The kids had to sleep in the tents with our names written down on them. As soon as I found the tent labled,"Carlita," I was amazed by its level of comfort. Knowing that I would have to get up early,I fell sound asleep. In the morning,when I woke up,the adults were already packing up the leftover food and tents. We all walked back to the circus and put away our things. It was the best camping trip ever!

                   After that camping trip,I never stopped asking if we could go camping again. Even though the ringmaster said,"no" constantly,I just knew that we had to go camping again. There is nothing better than going camping.

                                                   Day 1 on the job!

 

    The first day went great, I practiced  on the tightrope, The first thing you have to do is stretch you have to stretch so you feel all loosen up in your body. Then you stand on the tightrope and balance yourself on it , it's kinda of hard at first but you will get use to it. The circus director (the boss) asked me if i wanted to go on tour and go all around the around the world with them and guess what i said "YES" screaming. So I went to tell my mom  when I  got home from  work I saw my mom cooking dinner  I told her  "Mom my boss wants me to go on tour with them" and she just stood there looking at me. ONE DAY I WANT TO BE IN A CIRCUS AND I TOLD MY MOM I WANT TO BE IN A CIRCUS

That Day at the Circus

 

It was a normal day here at the circus when suddenly I heard a screeching scream.

I step out of my trailer and I saw Bo Bo the clown running in circles screaming ''The horses are gone''. I looked over to the stables where the horses were suppose to be and there was still a fresh stack of hay. We feed the horses every night so who ever feed them last must of forgot to close the corral gate.

        As I walk over to see the chores list I hear another scream but this time it was Jay Jay the clown. I walked over to see what was going on and there was one of the 5 horse laying on the ground. I took its pluse and it was still breathing so we called the circuses vet. She said the horse is ok it justs has a broken leg and is banned from preforming for 2 months.

         We were about to keep on folowing the horseshoe tracks when we heared a thumping noise. It was the other four horse but they were running to the train tracks and the train was coming. We all got in to the nearest car which was a small clown car. Luckly I was wit the two smalls clowns so it was easy getting in. We flew over to the train tracks right when the train came 3 of the horses did not run but Lucky the daredevil horse did.

          The shows about to start and we still haven't found lucky so, we decide we will call it a night and look for him tomorrow. We only had 2 horses that were usable so we did are best but the audience wasn't pleased. We ended the circus early and I went to put the horses away and there was lucky standing  in the corral.

         I couldn't belive my eyes. The one place we did not look there he was. After I put the horses back a ran into the pie cart and told everyone luckys back.After that the whole group decided to put on the show tomorrowfor all the people that came tonight fio free.All the audience loved it and the horses too.

One day when no one was looking. I snuck out of my house, and ran away forever. Sooner or later I joined the circus figuring I had nothing better to do. So what the circus looks dumb, because I found out that the circus is not dumb the moment I first performed. My name is Max Robinson, and this is the story of my life. Being in the circus was fun and all, but it was really tough too. Every day I had to wake up at 6:00 in the morning for breakfast. Then it was straight to school. My school was only 1 room, and wasn't very big, but I got used to it. It all happened when a new kid joined the circus, and at that time I was the best. His name was John hart. He was new so he wasn't the best, but in 2-3 weeks he was the best he was better than me. It all happened so fast that I didn't believe it. Everyone was cheering for him after he did his 360 somersault off the rope onto the horse. After that performance everyone was cheering for him and not for me. I couldn't take it, and then it happened. I got too jealous, and set up a revenge plot for his next performance. He broke a leg that day. Everyone found out it was me, and asked me why did I do it. Well that was a question I couldn't answer either. So I stand corrected, this isn't the story of my life. It was the story of how I ruined my life, and how I ruined John Harts life too.

                              The End

Something that happens in the circus.

   Circus days are very different than a normal day at home. A tipical day for a  girl that's in the circus starts out at 7:00 A.M. She gets up, gets dressed and goes to a pie car to have breakfast. At 9:00 A.M. it's time for her to go to school. 3:00 P.M. When's schools out there's a quick break before you have to go practice for the show tonight.

6:30 P.M. Dinnertime, they normaly don't eat a lot because of the show that night. 10:30 P.M. The show is over and your super tired.

12:00 A.M. Laying in bed thinking how the show went.

 

   When your in the circus you travel to many different places. It's a fun experience in your life, but also a diffucult one to. Your always away from your family until the season is over. Plus your working with people all over the world. Like from France, Russa, Itally, and much more.

 

   Just geting the chance to join the circus is hard. You have to practice, practice, and practice some more just to become a acrobat or trapeze. You need to have the right body type and be very determined. Like I said it takes years of practice just to get the move right. If you join the circus you to be certain that's what you want to do.

 

   The last other thing about the circus is the jobs. If you join the circus you could be a Circus clown, Circus acrobats, Circus juggler, Circus tightrope walker, or train Circus horses.

Do like thrills and hard work? Performing in front of hundreds of people? If you do. then the circus life is for you. If you have a really good talent, like juggling or acrobatics, you can join the circus and show the crowd what you're made of. Of course, fame doesn't come without hard work, so you must practice and concentrate on your act.

 

Once you have your act done to perfection, it is now your time to shine! You will probably have several shows each week and you can impress the whole audience with your skills. Now, after a perfomance you will probably be dead tired, but you cannot sleep in the next morning. You must prepare and prctice your next act.

 

Now, if you are a kid travelling with your parents, life is just as hard and fun. You must wake up at 7 AM and go to school. After school you can play with the clowns or do whatever you wish. Then it is chore time. You must make sure the animals and equipment are in top shape, so you have to inspect and feed the equipment and horses. Finally you have to perform in a show they might have that night. The day starts all over again the next morning.

 

In conclusion, if you like thrills, hard work, and performing, the circus is for you. You can perform, play with the clowns, and help out the perfomers. I think the circus would be great, however it requires a demanding amount of work and practice.

Sarah on The Tight Rope

By: Gaelle Desert

 

As Sarah Miller stood on the tight rope she tried to concentrate on what her father had taught her, 'Remember concentrate and think of nothing else but the tight rope '. Her thought trailed off as she got to the end of the rope. As soon as she flipped in the air landed on her feet juggling the audience jumped to their feet clapping of amazement. " I did it!" Sarah ran out to meet the rest of the circus crew.

 

        She felt the warmth of her mother and father as she hugged them both with joy. When the audience left, Sarah and her little brother headed out to their small trailer and got ready for bed. At 12:00 p.m Sarah was wiped out and exhausted from all the excitement. Sarah knew that she had better go to sleep. Tomorrow they were going to Dallas, Texas for another performance.

 

        The next morning, Sarah did her regular chores, grooming the horses, feeding the elephants, e.t.c. When she was done, she helped her father and brother load the animals for the next trip. After gathering the animals they boarded the trailor and drove to Texas. When they arrived at 6:00 a.m Everyone began getting ready for the upcoming performance.

 

        When it was time, the audience gave a round of appluase and they started the show. In came the elephants balancing on a ball while holding each others trunks. Then, it was time for Sarah to perform.

As she began climbing the ladder, she thought and remembered the same routine she practiced, just like it was in the begginning.

Being part of the circus

 

 

Your Day

    Everyday, you wake up and get ready for your school day. You will learn normal subjects and be taught like normal kids. You then prepare for your show that night. You might practice tightrope, maybe flipping, jumping, flying, etc. Being part of the circus takes dignity, agility, balance, coordination, concentration, and integrity. Preparing for the circus may take a lot of time. As you get ready for the show you may feel scared. You must overcome that fear and get ready.

 

    Your part of the show that night may be different then some others. Your act may involve teamwork. Just do your best. Soon the show is over and you go back to your trailer. It has been a long day, but you have another big one tomorrow!

 

Your Traveling

    You usually travel to many cities to preform, and that may take several months to go everywhere. Your geography lessons might just be where your heading. Many circus groups travel to different countries, sometimes even different continents! If you get homesick easily, the circus probably isn't for you!

 

The pros and cons

There are good things and bad things about being in a circus. The good thing, is you get to do many performances and visit all over the world. But you don't see your family very often. You are usually away for weeks, months, even years at a time.

 

Conclusion

Many people do the circus. They do all kinds of performances, travel the world, and do what they love. But being a performer can take years and a lot of practice. But if you can do it, you can be a great circus performer!

The day of the big night finally came. We were in Washington D.C, ready to preform for the president.

         Seals were honking, clowns were busy pushing custard pie down their trousers, horses were training, and acrobats were flying.

        "Alana, your turn," the kid in front of me called.

         I bravely started to climb up the ladder, my palms already starting to sweat.

         Bradley, the kid who was in my performance, swung off, his feet curled tightly around the swing. Ha came closer, so I jumped off and stretched out my hands.

                                                   *   *   *

        The practice went flawlessly and as a reward, everyone was treated to a restaurant. The food was delicious, and I was confident we would do great.

        Then it was finally time.

        "LADIES AND GENTLEMEN! TO START OFF OUR PERFORMANCE, WE PRESENT TO YOU, THE HORSES AND THE ACROBATS!" announced the ring master.

        There were neighs, and suddenly, a bright flash of light. I confidently strode to the middle of the ring, which beheld a the two ladders and the swings. Bradley mirrored my move.

        When I finally got to the ladder, I gave myself a quick "Don't screw up" lecture. Then I started to climb, and the act began.

        Bradley swung off, and I reached down. He flipped me over, where I got a hold of my own swing. Then I swung myself on the bar two times, and at the flip of the last one, Bradley jumped off and I grabbed a hold of him. Next, Bradley flipped off and I followed him.

       But something went wrong, horribly wrong. Either Bradley didn't flip fast enough to catch me, or I followed too soon, but I started falling, to the ground below. We were pros, and we didn't have a net. I wanted to scream, but I didn't want to humiliate the circus or anyone! So I just shut my mouth up, and pretended it it was part of the act.

       "Pancake Alana in three... two..." I silently thought to myself.

       Suddenly, out of nowhere, I heard a shrill whinny. There was a thump, and I landed on a horse.

       Desert Storm! He had caught me and was now trotting at the edge of the ring. Every one was clapping, wolf whistling, cheering, and whooping.

       Then, Desert Storm stopped in front of a man in a black suit. THE PRESIDENT!

       "Oh jeez. Please let the president like it!" I prayed.

       The president smiled and stood up.

       "I LOVE IT!" he declared, in a deep booming voice. The cheers sharpened acutely in volume, and the noise made the ground shake.

       I sighed. All right with the world. And hopefully, no one busts their ear drums.

Living the life of a circus performer is hard. Everything is busy, and there are a lot of customers watching. since I have a first-hand account, let me tell you.

 

    First of all, there are the customers. They never seem pleased enough. We always have to do something new to exite them. Never the old "Clown on a unicycle throwing pies" routine. Always asking for something else.

 

   Next, there are the acrobats. They're friendly, but everytime they talk to me, I have to bring out my phone to get Google Translate. I know they have all their time filled up with practicing, but they could at least learn English! Especially when they're swinging around on the trapeeze and we tell them to stop because it's closing time, they just look at us strangely.

 

   Now this last paragraph is about food. I can't really explain the pie car. Somedays the food is good and it reminds me of old homecooked meals, but that just maked me homesick. Other days... Blech! It tastes like a pile of burnt McDonalds hamburger grease! Those days, well, those days I just eat an energy bar.

 

    That was my first hand account of circus life. I hoped you like it, and notice how fun, and not fun circus life can be. I have to go clean the horses for our next act. Bye!

A Circus Life

     A circus life can be hard, easy, fun, and boring every once and a while even for the preformers! Also did you know that a circus life isn't all easy, and fun and games. Well sometimes it is but not always. What you have to do to get in a circus is you have to have certain things like what your skills are, what you body type is, you should never give up, and you have to be very determined to reach your goals. I will list some up's and some down's about being in a circus!

 

     Circus life isn't always fun. Because you have to learn the new life styles of a circus actor. For example, When you start off your day it is pretty normal and you still have to go to school. But the school is a one-room school house. When school is done you get a while to play but you still have to get ready for the show that you have to do tonight. As a circus preformer you have to do 10 shows a week and that can be really tiring even if you are really good at preforming in a circus.

 

     When your in a circus you have to travel a long ways from place to place so you are always on the road going to a new place. Also you have to give everything up to be a circus preformer because you never stay in one place for about more than 1 week. Finally, you have to work long hard days practicing over and over again what you learned or what you are learning for the show.

     

      Also a circus life can be fun?. For example, if you are a circus preformer you can show your skills to the audiance and also before the manitee/show you can play with the things that you use during the show! Also you meet new people that are from all around the world! so you can learn new languages, and cultures.

 

     Also you can travel all around the world to some places in Aisa, Like Japan and China. Some places in Eupope like the U.K. Also you can travel to a lot of places in North America that you havent been to. Another fun thing is you can learn new skills, tricks but you have to be very determined.  Also you can become really good friends with the new people that you meet that preform with you.

 

    Now you know you have to work long, hard days practicing your skills, you can travel all around the world to some places you have probably never been to.

Dear reader's who are reading this,

 

 

       My name is Callie and my parents are in a circus, we are a circus family. We travel to a bunch of different places around the world. Most people think that circus people think that it is a fun job, and you only have to dress up into costumes and dance around. Well it's not! It is a job to entertain people and make people laugh and say "ooh" it is suppose to look dangerous. I would really like to join gymnastics but we move all the time, my parents think that I basically am in gymnastics.

 

      Tonight we are going to perform in front of a live crowd in Religh, North Carolina. My mom is going to tight rope and do circus acrobats. My dad is going to do stuff with a tiger and an elephant, and also juggle rings. I asked my parents and  since they know that I wants to be in gymnastics I am going to perform gymnastics tricks!And 3, 2, 1 the circus began. All of a sudden my mom goes, then my dad goes 30 minutes later, and last but not least I go on flipping in to the stage.                                                                                                                                                            

 

    Tonight was very tiring night. Now let me call my grandparents, oh ya I remember I forgot there are no phones to use. That's what happens when you are a circus family you usually can't call any family members.  Another downside is that you can't really go to your home and visit your family, what I learned you always stay on the rode. I am going to go to my bedroom and finally go and do something I want to do, so I am going to read.

 

     Morning! Now I have to go to the eating cart and get some eggs and bacon. I eat while my parents start packing up to go to another circus show. I am done eating I go into the car I have to quickly get dressed for the next show my mom has to sit in the back and get some of my makeup on. Since I only got to sleep for 3 hours last night, I sleep on the car ride down to Miami, Florida. We are here my mom and dad quickly rush out of the car and start training the animals and setting up.

 

    Finally, we are done now we get to go see our family. Travel to Neenah, Wisconsin. I haven't seen my family for a year now, I am so excited to see them! Well that is what happens when you are in a circus family there are ups and downs. I hope you learned a lot in my several paragraphs of how a circus family works.

 

 

 

                                          Sincerely. Callie

When I started the circus I was really excited. I had to get used to all the steps I had to do in the morning. It was challenging to remember all the steps. After a few weeks I got the hang of all the steps there were like 7+ things I had to remember. When i forgot to do something I didn't get yelled at. That was good.

 

        Next, I want to tell you that there were down sides to be in the circus. First, I didn't see my family for a long time I couldn't even communicate with them when I was on the road. ONCE upon a time there were kids that was walking around a forest.

They saw a big tall building.They went inside of that building there was a circus going on.They took a seat and watched the show the end

I am going to be telling you about the circus. I am going to tell you about the resources, how many hours it takes in one circus day, and how early you would get up. I am also telling you my opinion on the circus.

 

  The resources you would use are stuff like animas such elephants, horses, and sometimes other mean animals like jaguars. In the story they said a lady would walk jaguars. You also need to practice a lot with the animals. In the story they would practice doing somersaults off a horse and leap off a trampoline onto a horse.

 

  A typical day for someone that works for the circus such as a kid. The kid would get up at 7:00a.m. get ready then go to school at 9:00a.m.. At 3:00p.m. school would be over then at 3:30p.m.. you would practice. At 6:30p.m. you would have dinner then preform. At 10:30p.m. the show would be over then at 12:00a.m. you would be in bed going to sleep.

 

  You would wake up at 7:00 and go to bed around 12:00, which in my opinion I wouldn't like. I dont think I would like the circus because I don't like getting up early. I also think I would be bad at preforming in a circus because I would be scared to ride on animals and do all of the jumping and twisting in the air. Thats my opinion on the circus.

At 7:00 i get dressed and go to the pie car for pancakes and bacon. Then we get ready for tonight's show tonight. Then the crew sets up the music, tents, and the lights and music.

    I go to school at 9:00 A.M. Like any school we have computers, tests, and report cards. Many of mt classmates speak a lot of different languages, like French, Italian, and Russian. So its hard to communicate with other people when I don't know how to speak that language. At 3:00 school ends. Then i get to play with their unicycles and juggling ball.

   At 3:30 P.M. I do chores and practice. I water, groom, and feed the horses I use in our horseback acts. I'm working on leaping from a trampoline onto the horses backs. And i also play with my tiny dog named Noodle; our trailer is way too small for a huge pet. Our neighbor walks baby leopards on a leash, and our trainers are working on elephants, lions, and chimpanzees. Me I do the specialty for the circus. I'm the one who does the walking on the rope one, and I do stunts with the animals.

    For the after show we have a grand slam. We bring lions, elephants, and all kinds of animals that we train. Also we have a fire stunt seen only one in a lifetime! Plus we will even have animals doing stunts in a pool and other things. Ill be doing my finally called the swifter. I get up on stage and grab a partner from a crowd and amaze them with my magic. I will pull a a deck of cards out of my hands and levitate it to whoever I picked. Finally the last part of the show is the flaming hoop. Only I can do this I will run and try to jump the a hoop flaming with fire. When I did it the crowd was going crazy and I was then the best mannish ever.

Emily in the Circus

 

          Crowds of people cheering, clapping, and yelling barged into Emily's head. She tried to ignore all of that so that she can achieve her concentration. Still, she had to get herself to concentrate. She knew that it was very complicated, but she tried her best anyways. She also knew that her family is supporting her even though they weren't there. Emily thought about the time when her family were encouraging and comforting her about her being afraid. One at a time, she rode her unicycle onto a shaky wire. Trying her best, she avoided looking down the ground where the dirty sand was. The dirty sand sort of looked like they were waiting for her to fall down. She tried to do it as cautious as she can, trying not to make a mistake. Slowly and carefully, she rode her unicycle on top of the wire. "Almost there," Emily whispered to herself. Finally, she made it to the end of the wire. When she made it, the people clapped their hands happily.

          

         After all of those concentration, she drank cool refreshing water to calm her fast - breathing down. Her circus mates congratulated her for doing such a complicated work in the circus. She thanked them all, but she still missed her family. Next, her circus teammates and she went to another country ( which is in U.S.A.) Her family were also there so it was very easy for them to enter the circus of where she was performing. When they were in the different circus, she saw her family waving to her and shouting her name. It was Emily's turn to juggle tiny golf balls while riding on a giant ball this time." There is no possibility that I'm going to be harmed here because the giant ball isn't that high," she thought to herself. So again, she did her part and finished her goal of balancing. After that, she said goodbye to her family again hugged each other.

           

        Finally, when they returned to their normal circus, Emily had to do acrobats. She was trained how to be flexible and how to balance more. When she was in front of the stage, many people were cheering her name and clapped their hands. So, she hanged her hands on 2 rings that were tied to a rope( while the rope was hanged on the ceiling).She spun around for about 12 seconds and stopped. While she was up there, she did the splits in the air and also made complicated tricks onto the ropes. Again, the people cheered and clapped their hands. Now that Emily was having fun in the circus, she realized that when she does fun things in the circus, she stops worrying about her family. " Being in a circus is very fun after all..." she whispered at her mind.

"Mama are we almost there?" Kayla asked her mother who was driving towards the large stadium where the circus would be taken place. "Kayla if you ask that one more time I will turn this car around." Her mother said sternly looking at her through the drivers window. "I'm sorry ma I'm just so excited!" Kayla exclaimed excitedly a grin across her face. Her mother laughs slightly. "I understand that Kayla." she says pulling into the parking lot of the stadium. Kayla quickly got out the car and ran to her mothers side opening the door for her then pulling her out of the black vehicle. Kayla practically skips to the opening at the side then walks in quickly. She was chosen to see what happened back stage at a circus! She looked around and saw people ran around franticlly in a hurd ready to start the circus. Everyone was feeled with nerves and excitement. Tonight would be there first circus in the town for the first time! All the circus preformers were running into each other until they heard someone yell. "Watch Out!" then a loud boom then a high pitched cry coming from across the room everyone ran to the cry. "Are you okay?" A tall man in a top hat asked kneeling down next to her just as soon as Kayla got there. The girl whimpered quietly. Kayla looked at ther girls swollen, bruised leg she winced in pain. "I was just walking and then one of the unicycles fell on my leg." She cries out. "Well you can't do the show now Natalie." A young women with oversized glasses said to the girl sitting on the floor. "I can do it." The young girl hissed trying to stand up and then almost falling and almost hit the ground then the women with the oversized glasses held her up. "You can not Natalie! You can't face anymore injuries!" The girl who Kayla now figured out was Natalie sat with her hands to her face sobbing quite loudly. "What act did she preform?" Kayla said building up the courage to even speak. "She worked on the trapeze." The man with the top hat said finally acknowledging her existence. "Oh..." Kayla responded quietly. And then the women looked at Kayla. "Do you want to be our trapeze artist for the night?" she asked. Kayla looked at the lady stunned then at her mother who's face was equally as stunned.Then Kayla's eyes widened in excitement once again. "I would love to!" She exclaimed.

 

Kayla knew all about trapeze artist it was her favorite part of the show. She's always imagined twirling through the air being free and able to fly. It was absoulutly lovely to watch.Trapeze artists would start off swinging on a bar and then would twist through the air and there partner would catch them and they'd continue to do that.

 

About Thity minutes later Kayla stood on a stool with a handle above her ready to be grabbed and Kayla's hands clasped at her side were ready to grab it. She jumped up and grasped the bars tightly and swinged her legs back and forth and then let go twisting and twirling through the air. She was afraid of heights and didn't want to look but she wanted to keep on looking at the ground as she twirled elevation above it and then she did a front turn as the other trapeze artist grabbed her hands and continued swinging. Kayla smiled widely.

 

She would always remember this moment.

anyone who thinks circus life is nonstop is crazy.I,Bella Cassini,know differently.I live in a big trailer with my family we travel 20,000 miles in seven months each year, visiting 150 cities.I work from sunup to sundown.                                                             here's a typical day for me: 7:00 A.M. I wake up ,get dressed, and go to the pie car for pancakes and bacon.the crews are setting up tents, lights, and music for tonight s show.9:00 A.M. school time.

    

  our one-room schoolhouse travels with us. like any school, ours has computers,test, and report cards.

Because the circus performers are from all over the 

world, many of  my classmates speak other languages: French, Russian, and Italian, like my family. As we travel around the country,our geography lessons come alive.

 

          3:00 P.M. School's over--time for a quick.the clowns let me play with their unicycles and  juggling balls. I also play with my tiny dog, noodle; our trailer

is too small for a large pet. I'd like to join a soccer team, but we're never in one place long enough.

I, Sally Hermit, know how to work in the circus and be a circus actor i have been doing that for 4 years it is a struggle at first. Here is a typical day for me:

 

7:00 A.M. I got to wake up, get dressed, and go to the concession stand and order some pancakes, bacon, and sausage. The crews are setting up the stands and tents so we will be ready for tonight's show. 9:00 A.M. Time for us students to go get lessons for tonight's show. We have animals we have to train we have unicycles to ride for us too train with and sometime it is a big struggle. 3:00 P.M. Training is over. I got to go do my chores, feed, and water all of the animals. 6:30 P.M. Dinnertime. My family and i go to the supper concession stand and order some supper we go back to the cart and eat then get ready for the show right now the crew is getting the camera ready to set us on T.V..  10:00 P.M. I am wore out from all of the tricks that was a struggle, now my family is heading back to the cart to get our pajamas on and get ready for bed now we are in bed hope to speak to you guys at the next show. see you then.

A lot of people think that working at a circus is all fun and games.

 

 

 

Circus performers practice,perform,and move every single day.Every morning they wake up and go to the pie cart for breakfest.Then they start unloading the tents for the night's performance.The performers work on their act,they work long and hard until its time for the show.Before the people come,the performers go to the pie cart and have a small dinner and then its time for the show!Each performer does their act until the show is over.The performers get the rest of their dinner at the pie cart and then go to bed.

 

 

The performers keep practicing and performing for the rest of the week until its time to put down the tents and pack up and move to a different city.Circus performers are always practicing,performing,and moving.Thats the life of a circus performer.

You may have heard of the circus or big top and you may think that it must be horible to work in acircus but really it's not so bad as long as you have the right body type, your family is in the same circus as you, you have the ability to sleep short hours, and determination. In the following paragraphs I will tell you about circus life.

 

 Heres some of the many upsides: you travel the world for free, you get to do fun stuff (doing the trapeeze, walking on the type rope, and much more), and you get paid for doing it! Now there is some downsides: you HAVE to travel the world, usualy you dont have a lot of freinds outside the circus if any, you work all day, and eat what you get or don't eat at all. But dont let that stuff get you down.

 

 This paragraph is a usual scedule for our circus. 6:00 am: get up, get dressed, eat, get ready to go to shcool, and go to shcool. 1:00 pm: shcool is over and I go train animals. 1:30 pm: first show of the day starts. 2:30 pm: first show ends and I practice trick arrow shots. 3:00 pm: go to pie car and eat lunch. 3:45 pm: time for a break. 4:00 pm: trapeeze practice. 4:30 pm: clean animals and animal pens. 5:00 pm: second show starts. 6:00 pm: second show ends, eat, and practice anything I already haven't. 10:00 pm: get ready for bed, go to bed.

Mallorie and Rose

 

 

 

       One day, far away pass Boston lives a tiny circus and its crew.The circus was ready to take off when a girl wanted to join them."Can I join you?I think I have what it takes." said the little girl.

       The crew and there leader looked at each other.Then they huddled in a circle and talked."What will we do with the child?What act can she do?"asked a trapeze women.

       "I think I know what to do with her,she can tame the lions!She'll be great!"said the leader,and the group broke up.They all gathered around the girl and sat her down on a stool."Child, you can join the circus, but only if your brave enough to tame the lions!"

        The girl thought about it.Why not? I'm brave! I can do it! She considered the offer and nodded.She was going to join a circus!

        "Well then, let's get you started by letting you meet the lions." said the leader.

 

     

         The lions were so cute!I don't think I saw anything cuter. I just joined the circus a few minutes ago, and so far it's not as bad as I thought it was.Right now the crew is showing me the lions so I can know who they are.

        "Here we have Lisa, she's very shy and she'll grow attached to her trainer quickly.This one here is Roger.He can be very stubborn so watch your back.The last one is Rose. we call her that because she is very sweet and lovable.I think Rose will go perfect with you child."

        "My name is Mallorie by the way." I should have told them my name when I first got here.It sounds so weird calling me child.It sounds like  I'm there kid or something.

        "Mallorie come here and see which lion will chose you.Here's what you do:First put your hand out to each lion,then the lion will sniff it, and if the lion didn't want you it backs away.Now if the lion does chose you it presses it's face against your side.Now chose your lion."

         I walked up to Lisa and put my hand out as I was told.The lion came up and sniffed my hand thoughtfully.It tipped its head to one side then backed away.

        Roger was a different story.The crew had to hold him down for me.I was cautious as I put my hand out, but nothing fatal happened. Roger sniffed my hand quietly then growled.Wow, he really needs some training he's a beast!

        Rose was nice and quiet.She rose to her paws and sniffed my hand.She walked up closer and pressed her face to my side as the leader said one of them would.I stroked her fur and backed away.The leader was right!She was perfect for me!

The Circus Mystery

 

        One day at the Amazing Kalamazoo Circus that my father owns,  I was walking around the clown cabin, when I saw a glass eye, at least that's what I thought it was. I thought they were playing a prank on me like they always do, so I went inside their cabin and said "guys this isn't funny it's gotten really old", and when they saw me they said we didn't pull a prank today. I stared at them like they were maniacs and said "then why is there an eyeball on the ground outside?" They didn't know, so when I went back outside and picked up the eyeball, right as something caught my eye I looked up and they were gone.

 

     As I walked to the pie car I  was thinking so hard that I guess I wasn't looking at where I was going and I ran into Mack, the groomer, and I saw him holding his eye and asked him what had happened to it, but he just ran off. That was very unusual for Mack to do, he was usually very talkative and spunky. That's when it hit me mabye Mack somehow lost his eye. Instead of goig to the pie car I ran to our own cabin, grabbed my journal, and locked myself in the room.  I noted everything that had happened today about finding the eye, seeing mack holding his eye, and the clowns, usually very honest, saying it wasn't a prank.

 

 

 

         When It was time for the show, my dad was frantically looking in his pockets, and saying where did I put it?

At the circus

by:Johannah Pagel

 

            Hi, my name is  Penelope, and I want to share with you a story about the circus. You might think that being in a circus would be fun,and exciting but you are wrong unless you like a schedule like this:

 

 


First you have to get up around 6 o'clock in the morning almost every day then you go to the pie cart and meet your fellow performers and have breakfast
then you go to the school house from 9 - 3 o'clock
Next you go to train for a half an hour sometimes we take a break or play around
then do your chores and train some more
6;30 is dinner!!!!!!!!!
10;30 show is over time to clean up
12 time for bed!

 then do that over and over again until the winter it is especially hard in the summer.

Life in the Circus

 

 

            To be in a circus, you have to have a specific talent, be determined, and have the right body type. You must be up early to eat your breakfast, to practice, and to do any chores you might have like feeding the circus animals or helping to put up the circus tent. You do many performances and travel around the world to do them. depending on when the show ends, you either do or don't get enough sleep.So, circus life can be tough.

LIFE IN A CIRCUS

 

 

   Hi, my name is Perrie. When I was younger i used to use my stripped blankets as a circus and I would try and do all the things they do in circuses!

 

   The main one I was the best at was juggling, ever since then i would juggle and keep juggling. I would juggle while dancing and singing, i would even juggle while i would read and at school!

 

    The most thing i didn't like about the circus is tightrope because i couldn't do it, i would always get mad at MYSELF for nothing, i wanted to get better at it but i couldn't.

    

     Until i turned twelve i  stopped juggling all of a sudden,and i miss it and i haven't been to a circus ever since then, and i wanna see up close now.

 

      I would love it if you could pick me to sit in the front row, and have this one dream come true. Oh, i haven't told you that i have worked at a circus for two years, but anyways thank you for reading this!

life in a surface can be tough because you barley have freinds on the road and you onley stay in 1 place for so long.

       its also fun because you get to do alot of acts.if you do a good act people will want to see you again

       you also go to school with kids you can speak a different language than you.

       life is tough as a circus performer. its not easy to be a circus person!

I wake up in the morning still tired from yesterdays performance It is 7:00 A.M. I get out of bed slowly. Then I go over to my dresser inside our camper and take out some clothes for the day. After I get done getting dressed I meet up with rest of the performers at the pie car for breakfeast. As we eat breakfeast we watch the crews set up the tents, lights and, music for tonights performance.

 

 

     At 9:00 A.M. we take our breakfeast and dump it into the trash and head to the one room schoolhouse that travels along with us on the road. Like any school we have computers, tests and, report cards. Many of my classmates speak different languages such as French, Russian or, Italian like my family. When we travel through the country its like our geography lessons come alive. Today we have a writting assignment we have to write a 5 page story on the american revolution. As the bell for school rings I finish my story turn it in and head down to the break area.

 

 

     3:00P.M. We are at the break area. The clowns let me play with their unicycles and juggling balls. I can almost ride the unicycle without falling off but it is too hard. Allthough the unicycle is too hard i can juggle pretty well. I thank the clowns for them lending me their things and go play with my dog Noodle. He is so small Our trailer is too small for a big dog.

 

 

     3:30 is chores and practice. I go do my first chore wich is to feed, groom and, water the horses. We use these horses in our horseback acts. I finish up my chores and head down to the practice field. As my father practices somersalting off a running horse I practice jumping from a trampoline on to a horses back. To do this stunt takes balance and a lot of concentration. I see other kids practicing juggling and acrobatics. Our neighbor walks baby leapords on a leash. Trainers are also working with elephants, lions, and chimpanzees.

 

 

     6:30 is Dinnertime. My family and I go to the pie car to eat, wile we are there we dont eat much because we have our big performance. We do 10 shows each week: one show for each weekday plus a matinee on Wednesday, two on saturday, and two on Sunday.

 

 

At 8:00 we are getting ready for the show that starts at 8:30.

 

 

8:30 it is time for the show my father and I are the opening act. My dad takes the lead on his horse. I follow ten paces behind running. He sommersalts off the horse and the horse keeps running. I sprint for the trampoline and jumpoff of it doing a flip in midair landing on the horse. I let one hand off the saddle and wave to the crowd as they cheer for us.

 

 

10:30 The show is over and i am so tired. As my family walks back to our trailer we passd the circus office, conssession stands, stables, and trailers. Two days from now we will be set up in another town.

The Missouri State Fair

We have a big show at the Missouri State

 Fair. There are lots of other people here. I'm not the only kid here, either.

There are lots of kids walking to a ride or going into a building. But I'll bet you hardly any of the kids here are in a show. But I am. I'm in the circus.

    Now before you ask, no, I did not run away from home and join the circus. It has been in my family for a long time. 

    I do an act in the show. What I do is several things. I work with the horses. I can make then jump through a hoop. I can also make them jump over obstacles, too.

    I also do a bit of acrobatics. I have been working on doing a flip in the air while on the bars. 

    I love it when the advanced acrobatics do this trick. What they do is first, they need a partner.  Then, they both go out and link arms. One person falls onto the floor then jumps on a trampoline onto a horse. It is AMAZING!!!!!! 

    There are lots of other acts in the show. There are ones with lions and tigers and bears. Also there are ones with monkeys. My sister actually walks Suzie (her favorite monkey) on a leash to the trainer during the show. (Since she is small, we only have her do little thinks.)

    The show is starting!!! Shhhhhh!!!!!

     "Ladies and Gentlemen, children of all ages, welcome to the Krazey Circus!!!" Then the lights go out and the first act starts.

     It's an act I'm in. Suddenly, a hoop is set on fire!!!!! Then the lights come on and you can see a chestnut brown horse jump through the flaming hoop. You can see a golden hoop and a white and black-speckled horse jump through that hoop with a rider with a pink suit on. Then we do the course. We both jump over lots of obstacles. Then our act is over, and another one starts.

    In this one, bears with bow ties dance. Then it is over.

    In this one, monkeys and lions look like they are having a conversation.

    So the show goes on.

    That day through all of the acts I'm not really sure how the rest of our day went. But before I knew it, we were on our way to a county fair, ready to start another day of circus fun.

Niki sighed.

  "Why does this have to happen to me?" asked Niki

  "What is the matter with you? Why do you always complain about your job?asked the ringmaster.

  "Oh, sir, I didn't see you here!Ur?What did you say again?I am so sorry that I did not hear you."replied Niki.

  "Niki, I do know that this is hard work, but you have got to understand that your parents are counting on you. I think you should take a break and think about what I just said to you."

  Niki nodded and went to her tent. She sat down on her bed and began thinking about her parents.

  "Gosh, I think the ringmaster is right, Ishould know how hard it is for my parents to see me go I should work hard and think for my parents"said Niki to herself.

  The next day, Niki was grooming her horse, she needed water so she went to her tent to grab her water bottle,when she came back the ring master was standing there admiring her horse.

  "Sir, are you alright?I do not hope my horse has a problem!

  "Oh Niki, I didn't know that this was your horse, I think you have groomed it well!"answered the ringmaster.

  "Why, thank you! I thought about the words you said to me yesterday, I think you are absolutely right. I agree to what you said to me."

  "Very well, I am sure that your parents are going to be very proud of you!"said the ringmaster.

  Niki blushed at the compliment. The ringmaster walked away and Niki went back to grooming her horse. The day went by quickly. The next day was Wednesdy the show is coming.

  "Oh, I know that I have done this many times, but I have a friend that lives here, and she is going to see me working in a circus and laugh at me!" said Niki freaking out.

  "It is all right Niki. This means that you are a string girl! A circus is hard work and you are a sucess!"said the ringmaster.

  "I owe you too much. You have helped me come this far. THANK YOU!"said Niki.

  "Now go on out and show every one how speacial you are!" said the ringmaster.

  Niki stepped out onto the ring and performed beautifully. Everyone clapped at her amazing performance.

  Niki smiled and bowed to everyone.

 "This is the happiest day of my life!"

My Circus Life

 

Hello my friends. I am the famous Mustache Walker. If you

didn't know, I am a tight rope walker and the manager of the Circular Circus. You must be thinking that life in a circus is very hard because of all the practice and acts that are done. Well that kind of is true, but working in the circus is also very fun. Here are a reason few reasons why.

First, we get to meet a lot of new people. There is a diversity of

people: French, Russian, and Italian. They can be beneficial. Suppose there is a French kid, and he is learning about Venice, Italy. He may not understand something about Venice. He can learn about the place from an Italian kid. The school geography lessons come alive because we go almost everywhere.

Next, we get to do a lot of stunts. Some of them are using

unicycles, juggling balls, somersaulting off a running horse, leaping from a trampoline onto the horse's back, acrobatics, walking baby leopards on a leash, and trainers working with elephants, lions, and chimpanzees. I am a tight rope walker; it takes a lot of balance and concentration. This is not a stunt, but I am also the manager of Circular Circus. This helps because I get to schedule the performances according to the performers convenience.

Now you should be thinking, that life in the circus is not boring

at all, but instead very exciting.

Life At The Circus

                                                                     By:Christian Martinez           

A lot can happen at the circus, for an example there's lots of things you don't normally see every day. You can see different cities like: Ontario, Boston, and Philadelphia. You can also see new states like New York, Massachusetts, Canada, California, Main, Florida,  Idaho, and Maryland.

 

 You can also see cool people doing cool things like: Acrobats, Jugglers, Tightrope Walking, Ringmasters, and Clowns. You can meet new kinds of people who like: the circus, art, juggling, anyone with the same interest as you.

 

 Also you can see what your learning in school in person like: if you learn about the Statue Of Liberty, you pass new your in your circus trailer and you can actually see it, like it said in the story, "It makes geography come alive."

 

 There is a lot of animals you can see to like: Lions, horses, elephants, chimpanzee's, giraffes, some really talented dogs and cats, and sometimes (a) bear(s). A lot of animals are part of the circus.

 

A circus life is a busy life and you need to do a lot in order to make through some dangerous acts. If your an Acrobat, if you miss the target you have to grab you fall either onto a net or on the hard ground. If your a Tightrope Walker and you lose your balance then you also fall to a net or the hard ground. If your a Lion tamer and your trying to tame a lion but happen to get to close, you c an be eaten alive. If your a stilts walker and a stilt breaks you can break your leg. Also if your a juggler and you miss and hit your head.

 

 Life at the circus is fun, hard, dangerous, and filled with learning.

Flying Free: Trapeez Girl

            When I was little, I always wanted to go to the circus. I, Andrea Smith, will tell you how I made my dream turn into reality.

 

            I lived with my older brother, mom, and dad at the time. I liked my older brother, but everyone always told me how I should follow in his footsteps. I wanted to live my own life, not be my brother's shadow. My brother was skilled at many things, but I knew no matter how hard I tried, I would never be like him.

 

             So, on one fine day in August, when I was ten years old, I decided I would run away. My parents actually allowed me to do it, and I believe it was because they thought I would come back. I do visit them sometimes now. I remember packing a large suitcase with food, water, clothes, and all other neccessities. I also remember trying to to stuff my oversized tent into my bulging suitcase. I had forgotten to think of one small detail: If I ever did run away, where would I go?

 

              I had no relatives in America. So, I stayed at my best friend's house for a week. I didn't tell her that I had run away. I just told her I had come over for an extra-long sleepover. Then, I left and roamed the streets, looking for a job. I saw a poster advertising a circus. It said: Come one, come all! Come to our circus-extraordinaire! Cloony Clown's Club auditioning for talented clowns! I remembered my long-forgotten dream of joining the circus. I quickly noted down the address and, dragging my heavy suitcase behind me, ran through the thick crowd, shoving people this way and that.

 

              I reached the circus tent and rushed inside. The words I had failed to notice on the flyer earlier were etched on a large poster on the wall in front of me, plain as day: For talented performers, ages 11 and up!

 

                I couldn't believe it! I had come this close to achieving my goal and now it had slipped from my fingers! But that's when I remembered something: My birthday was on June 12, and today was June 11! I ran outside and sat down next to the large red and white polka-dotted tent. At exactly 11:59 PM, I rushed back inside and said "I'm auditioning for Cloony Clown's Club. I've heard that you need a trapeze artist." as fast as I could. "Well lucky you, there's only one more spot left.",the lady at the counter replied. As she said this, I watched the clock above her head. It read 11: 59 59 sec. "How many years old are you?",the lady asked. And then putting on a big, broad smile, all the while watching the clock, I replied,"Eleven, ma'am, I'm eleven!" "Well then, welcome aboard!" I couldn't have been happier to hear better words!

 

                  And that is the story of how I became the best trapeze artist in Cloony Clown's Club!

I woke up at 7:00 AM. Today was the biggest day of my life, to day there was going to be a circus show. I would show everyone what a great animal trainer I was. It took cooperation for me and my animal. Suddenly, there was a crash. I looked outside, they were setting up the tents.

 

  My name is George Gates and I am an animal trainer at this circus. I have been training since I was 8. Like I said earlier, today was a big day for me. At 7:01 I go down to the pie tent(where I eat breakfeast), then I go back to my tent to change into my circus clothes. At 8:00 the big circus tent is set up and I do a rehearsal. Then at 9:00 we all relax after our rehearsal. I am100% sure I won't make mistake. Then the clock ticks 9:00, We got down to the circus tent and then a bus full of people arrive.

 

 Although my heart is in my throat, I walk straight up to them to greet and welcome them. I can tell by their faces they are eager to watch the circus show. Soon more and more people arrive and soon there are more than an 100 people. We take them toward the circus tent.

 

 My heart is still in my throat. They seat themselves and I perform to them. Showing my circus love I perform without making a mistake.

 

Then it is soon evening I ahve performed all lot. My circus love has been here since I was 8.

I wake up at 7:00 AM. I have breakfast at the pie car. Tents,lights, and music is being set up. A performance awaits me.

 

I am George Callisto, an acrobat from the circus. You may think circus life is crazy and easy however it is really difficult.

 

We have school at 9:00. Like any school we have computers, tests, and report cards however there is lots of diversity with many cultures like Russian, French, Italian, and Scottish just like me. Since we treavel so much our geography lessons come to life.

 

At 3:00 school ends and then comes practice for the show. There are many ineresting parts to it however my favorite is the acrobatics.  The we have a simple dinner at the pie car at 6:30.

 

At 10:00 the show is over. Boy am I tired. It was so much fun seeing all those happy faces in the audience. But now time to get some sleep. Thank You.

The clown went out and did his magic tricks. The acrobats did their long performance. Then it was our turn to perform.

 

We were doing the fire act where we had to juggle juggle three thick  sticks with fire on their edges. Then we anccidently dropped one stick and there was a enormous fire. "Run!" I screamed. Everyone evacuated. I tried to call the firefighters with my cellphone but they didn't understand me because they spoke a different language.

 

I decided to go to nearest city and get water. My crew helped me do that. We got water and got rid of the fire. Our tent was ruined but we were safe and that was the important thing.

My Day at the Circus

I got up from bed at 7:00 A.M. and ate my breakfast in the pie car. There, the crew

was setting up for today's show.

At 9:00 A.M., I went to school. It was just like a normal school with computers,

tests, and report cards. Since the circus performers are from all over the world, my classmates speak many different languages.

After school is over, I take a 30-minute break. I play with the clowns' unicycles

and juggling balls.

Next, I do my chores and practice for the circus. I take care of our horses', the ones

we use in our horseback acts. My dad practiced jumping off a running horse and somersaulting on the ground. I practice jumping through a hula-hoop just a little bit bigger than me. Other kids like me are practicing the tightrope. Trainers are working with many different kinds of animals.

I eat dinner at 6:00 P.M. in the pie car, but don't eat to much since we have a show

coming up.

In the show, we start off with a live band riding on unicycles dressed as clowns.

Next, trainers walk leopards on a leash, while the leopaords juggle three five-pound balls. After that, kids cartwheel up a ladder and dive into a pool of water. Then, a tiger leaps up to the top of a ladder and does monkey bars. Finally, my part and my dad's part comes. My dad starts the horse while I started charging towards the hula-hoop. I jump through the hoop and jump onto the running horse. Meanwhile, my dad jumps off the horse and does two backwards canon-balls in mid-air and a backwards and forwards flip on the ground. After all this, I drive the horse through an obstacle course where dad holds the obstacles.

After the show, everyone claps and applauses for us. We are exhausted and go to

bed late at night. The whole circus crew was ready to travel to another place after a good night's sleep.

Neverlasting Circus                                        Once there was a        boy that loved to do trapeze.  His name was Lloyd.  He lived in San Bernidino.  He's been dreaming of being in a circus one day.  Lloyd watches his favorite circus on tv everyday.  Then an announcment came on after the show.  They said they needed a new   trapeze artist so , they were having a contest and whoever was the best could be            Lloyd thought about it and he decided he needed to talk to his parents first.  They discussed and they agreed for him to enter.  His parents were very supportive and confident in him. So was Lloyd.  He told him self he needed to train really hard to become part of that circus.  He promised himself he would.                                                 Lloyd trained extra hard for the contest.  His parents but him a trapeze set for him to pmudractice on.  He fell a few times but there was a safety net on the bottom.  Then he decided to use the net in his act.  He got the idea from a movie he saw by the name of Madagascar 3.  he ate healthy so he could be fit and he also  exercised doing push-ups, curl-ups, and pull-ups to make sure he had the perfect body for trapeze.            The next day he showed up to the auditions for the circus.  But he was the only one there.  Therefore he got the job.  after his first few shows he started to feel like a stick in the mud.  He wondered what his parents were doing while he was gone.  He wanted to stay in the circus but, really wanted to see his parents.  So, the other members of the circus came to an agreement of how Lloyd can stay in the circus and still see his parents.  They said he can stay with his parents but, when the circus is in San Bernidino he can do his act.                                                                                                      The circus took Lloyd home. When he arrived his parents were on the couch crying.  Lloyd asked what was wrong.  They said they missed him.  Lloyd told them that he's only going to the circus in this city and that any other cities the circus is in he's not going there.

The crowd went wild.

            After the circus Pablo was so tired and was happy he did n`t drop Susan. Pablo's whole family told him he did a great job.

My Treasure

 

 

I wake up and get dressed, ready to work a long day in the

circus. Although some days I feel that I never should of joined the circus, I like being around my friends and fellow animals. The first thing I do when I get up is to get dressed and go to the pie car for breakfast,get the tents ready for tonights show, then start practicing for my acrobatics.

Since then I have never gave up my dream to become an acrobate. The show started and I was full of excitement but with nervisment too. I had swung from the bar handle and was off. My partner had caught me and crowd had roared with excitment. I had done it once more and it finally happenend. The day I had been waiting for had come. I was the star of the show.
