A Trainer's Life

 

          "Now Changhao, be a good monkey," I told my chimpanzee. "Let's try that front snap kick again." Changhao nodded obediently and performed it, this time executing it perfectly. "Great!" I said and gave him a ripe banana. Just then I felt something nudging gently into my leg. I turned around to face a fully grown king cobra!

          "C'mon Triss," I frowned. "You know you can't get attention by interrupting. I'll be with you in a minute. Triss made a face, but slithered away quietly. I worked with Changhao on his lunges and then turned to Triss. After the day was over, I lay in bed thinking. My name is Keith, Keith Reyes. I am an animal trainer at the Classic Carnival, a very successful circus that has thier last show of the American tour coming up in a week. It's a big deal, and the circus promoter will be there. My animals and I are a big part of it and that puts a lot of pressure on me. Best not to worry about it, I thought and fell asleep. 

         I woke up early, at 5:00, and made my way to the pie car. The cook there, Zachary, was an early morning person, and knew I was too. "Hey there," he said. "I got some pancakes for both of us to eat. And I also got some tidbits for your animals." By the way, Zach loves my animals, and they love him back. I chuckled and we made our way to my cart to eat. After that, I set about teaching my newest animal, a bald eagle, some tricks. In all, I have only three animals, but they are the best three animals one could have. Soon my eagle, which I named Leatho, could do a rolling dive, a barrel flip, and had been trained only to bite people who hurt him first. I looked at my watch. It was already lunch! Zachary and I headed to the pie car and Zachary immediately whipped up an all-you-can-eat buffet.

          This time, when I lay in bed, I was content with my training.

          It was the day before the circus! Everybody was rushing, but not me. I had trained my animals well, and we had already rehearsed our performance several times in front of the stage crew. But late in the night, while I was giving my animals their dinner. I saw a darkened shape out of the corner of my eye. I did not sleep well that night.

           I woke up even earlier to do some last minute practice. But when Zachary and I came in, we found the pet yard empty! Just then I noticed some footprints. I followed them into a large tent, while Zach alerted the others. I had never seen that tent before. I quietly slipped into the folding of the tent and saw two men talking. Animal smugglers! With my animals in cages. Rage welled up inside me but I forced myself to stay calm. Those men had guns. I slipped out and found the rest of the circus actors.

           I told them where my animals were and what I was going to do. It was showtime!

           I slipped int the folds of the tent again and chirped like a cricket. Leatho knew that signal and began banging on the cage. The men came over to quiet it while Triss stretched and stretched, and made herself thinner and thinner and got out! Triss, however, went to the bottom of Changhao's cage. Changhao started hooting like a madman and the men grouched over. Changhao immediatley layed them flat with a cross chop while Leatho picked his lock. Leatho them barrel rolled into the men and started pecking them. After doing them justice, he went and picked Changhao's lock. The men saw this and started getting up. But then Triss slithered over, with his hood spread wide. The men, their eyes wide with terror, freaked out and ran out of the tent as fast as the could, where they met the rest of my crew along with the police.

         The police, who had been called by my crew, disarmed and handcuffed the men.

         That night, my animals performed the same trick beautifully on two able-bodied men. The crowd went wild and the circus promoter signed us on another American tour. I went to sleep that night felling happer than ever before.

So one day they sat him down in the pie car and started to talk. "Now Timmy, you have been acting, how do I say this? Well, lets say different," Said Timmys mom, Lily.

 

           "What do you meen?" Said Timmy with  a grim look on his face. "Now son, can you tell us what is going on?" Quetioned Timmy's dad, Tom. "Well, there is just no place to call home. I feel everyday that there is no home so whats the point of being here,"

          Then Timmy got up and went to his room. His parents then fallowed to cheer him up a little. "Honey? Can we come in? We want to talk to you," Said Lily but right after You could hear Timmy say a faint " Sure, Whatever."

 

           Lily and Tom walked in and sat down on his bed. "Timmy, I now it's not the glamorous life you want but this is where we belong. It may just be an old, rusty train to you but we grew up here and this is what we call home and someday I hope you call it home to because this  is where you are going to grow up. Timmy sat up and looked at his parents and finelly said " This is home. I may not have realized it, but this is home.

What Happens At A Circus

 

Have you ever been to a Circus?  Well, If you have'nt I'm going to tell you all about one!  The circus is a fun colorful place full of  interesting people and animals.  A circus is where people come from different states to perform a show for  you.  A circus is also a place where you can enjoy watching unusual acts and laugh at different things.  A circus also has animals that preform tricks for you such as, Jumping through hoops, Standing on two feet, And danceing.  Also there are acrobats who preform different stunts hanging on ropes.

 

First, Circus clowns, Circus clowns are funny people wearing makeup and big floppy shoes.  You may have seen a clown at your circus and if you have'nt here are some common details a clown has, Big floppy shoes, Curly fluffy hair, Silly makeup, And a funny outfit.  Clowns are nice and often play jokes on other clowns.  Jokes are funny to clowns here are some common jokes they play, Pie in the face, water in the face, and loud music in their ears.  Clowns are funny but scary at times to me.

 

Second, Circus acrobats, Circus acrobats are cool interesting people.  They preform tricks on ropes and flip in the air.  Acrobats are like professional ballet dancers but on ropes.  They twirl and slide on ropes to make people think they are going to fall wich leaves them in suspence.  Also, Acrobats have to trust their partner or they might put the partner's life in danger.

 

Third, Circus juggler,  Circus jugglers throw different objects it the air and toss them in a circular motion makeing them come into each hand evenly and the cycle continues on.  Circus jugglers toss things such as, Rings, Sticks, Animals, And balls.  Juggling  requires only one person but you can have at least four in a group.  Jugglers usualy wear puffy red, White, Or blue shirts to make them look interesting.  Also, Jugglers may do tricks while juggling they might flip or ride on a unicycle while they are juggling.

 

Fourth, Circus tightrope walker, Tightrope walkers walk on ropes that are conected to two platforms one is where the walk begins and one is where the walk finishes.  The tightrope walker has a very dangerous job in the circus they walk on a rope several feet above the ground.  Even though the rope is high up they usualy have a net hoisted above the ground just incase they fall.  Tightrope walkers can also do more stunts with their job to make it more interesting and dangerous.  Tightrope walkers can ride motorcycles on a rope, Jump on the rope, And sometimes spin on the rope.

 

Now, Circus horses, Circus horses are fun animals that usualy jump up and down.  Circus horses have to listen to their trainer or they will be excused from the circus.  If the horses are not trained they might go crazy and hurt somebody.  The people who preform with the horses might jump on their backs or stand on their backs as a trick.  The horses are usualy black or white to make them stand out.

 

Later, The circus tent, The circus tent is where everything goes on, the entire show depends on the tent.  The circus tent is the basic traveling home of the circus people.  The circus tent is wide and tall like a small house.  The tents are usualy white and red or white and blue depending on the type of circus.  The circus tent takes a while to put up if you do not have the right kind of help with you.

 

 

Next, The circus lifestyle, The circus life isnt all fun and games all the time.  You have to work all day and all night all the time even on weekends!  Circus performers don't get alot of sleep either they have to be up around six or seven A.M. and the noght before they were up until like twelve P.M. so the few hours they get to sleep is pure gold to them.  How their day starts is go to the pie car to get food for breakfast, Get dressed, Practice for a while, Go to the morning show, Then practice for the matinee.  Pretty harsh living style but the preformers say its all worth it!

 

After that,  Chores a young circus performer has to do, First, they clean animal stables I think that job would be disgusting becaus the animals use the bathroom there.  Then they groom the animals to prepare them for the show.  Next, they feed the animals so they don't get hungry during the show and eat the straw scattered on the ground.  After that, they practice for the upcoming show so they can do a perfect job and please the audience.  Later, They let the animals rest so they will be well rested for the show.

 

Then, Traveling school,  Their school is like no other it travels with them on their trips to different countrys.  It may get hard at times becaus other kids on the school trailer speak different languages and you can not understand what they are saying.  Also when they travel all around the world they see the different cultures that the states have and that makes the lessons come alive.  The school isn't much different from regular schools it's just on wheels.  The school makes it to where the circus children have education while they are on the road.

 

Last,  Circuses are fun at times and hard living at times to.  Would you ever give up seeing your family for the circus life?  I would never do that becaus without my family I would be upset.  Circus life is different from a regular life it has its up sides its down sides and the sides that are just right.  This concludes my report about the circus.

My Debut in The Circus

 

     It is 1/7/2002, when I just joined a job as a circus performer. I was trying to be and acrobat, but it was hard. My partner Manuel is helpng me how to be a good acrobat. Manuel taught me 24/7 until I was ready for my debut.

 

    Finally, my debut came I was so nervous about my first circus show. I was also afraid that I was going to mess up. All the pressure came to me. I waited, waited, and waited until it was Manuel and me. It was our turn to go on next. The clown introduced me to the crowd.

 

     The crowd went wild when they heared that it was my debut. when I went on my stage, I did what I needed to do, which was to entertain the crowd.There were so many people watching the circus, more pressure came. When I went on my first jump I swinged and jumped off. Then, Manuel caught me and put me back on my swing.I couldn't belive I made my first jump.

 

     When I saw my boss smiling at me, I was happy. Happy enough to do my second jump with confidence. So I went off. Good thing there was a net underneath me because i fell, good thing that nothing was hurt. When I was on the net, I springed up and went on my swing and tried my 360 jump again. I did it and Manuel caught me. Everybody was amazed that I made my second jump. They don't know that i have 4 jumps.

 

     When I got back from my ledge, Manuel and I jumped at the same time and did our frontflips off our swings. All of the crowd loved us. Finally, it was my 4th jump. I have to do a backflip while doing a 360. My last jump was hard I missed my first try and my second try. You know what they say third time is the charm. I swinged off my edge and looked at the crowd. They were amazed what Manuel and I were doing. We jumped off the same time, and did our 360 backflip. We got each other's swings and landed on the ledge.

 

     When we got down, we ave each other a high five. We went to our boss and wanted to know how we did. He said great. We were so happy we gave each other another high five. Oh man I can't wait to go back and do the same thing what we did at the end.

 

     While we waited to jump again before the crowd goes home.We needed to get water so we will not be thirsty. After an hour, all of the member went on. We did our acts again all at once. It was so cool and there was confetti. We all bowed to the crowd and said goodnight. I was so sad that the crowd was not here, but couldn't wait for the other crowd for next week.

 

     I couldn't believe that the crowd rated the shoe 5 out of 5 stars. My debut was a success and I did a really good job on my debut day. After this month I have to go to Florida. I can't wait to go in the beach and have fun. Everybody couldn't believe that I only had 6 months to get ready for today and all that work payed off.

         The circus put up a sign up sheet for a clown job. On the first day everybody signed up it seemed like.

         Then when it came to be adition day only two people showed up. It was kind of disappointing ,but it gave the judge a easier choice. The people that had signed up to be a clown were named after Babe Ruth the famous baseball player and Usher. They were both a good clown and definately not shy to a strangers face.

Ok back to the story, I'm getting ready for the big show in Toon Town and then I over hear my boss saying that there is a new person in the circus.then i whisper to myself " I wonder who that is going to be?  

 

      An hour later, Bob saw the new person in my boss'ss room and guess who it was. Roger Rabit!!!  Roger came out of the room and said, " hello"

     Then I said, " Oh, you are the new person."

     "I have some experience in being a tightrope walker," Roger said

     I replied "Then lets see it."

My name is Cassandra. I live in a trailer with my family in the circus. My family consists of my brother Eric, my sister Mile y, my parents and me. My day starts with breakfast in the pie cart and then school starts. My brother is in the high school class and my sister is in preschool. I am in middle school in 6th grade. I go to a special trailer every morning to the sixth grade class which consists of 3 boys and 4 girls, including me. After school I play with my cat Sunny and do my homework. Next I practice my craft.

 

I am a trapeze artist and right now I am practicing flipping off a trapeze and into another trapeze. It requires a lot of skill and patience. My dad is working on his clowning skills and my mom is working on the tightrope. She is preforming a difficult trick in  which she must ride two unicycles stacked on top of each other while on a string tight rope suspended 50 feet in the air. My brother is working on a trick in which he is thrown out of a cannon and my sister is working on doing a flip off a trampoline. My friends do acrobatics and trapeze. Then we have dinner and get into costumes. Mine is a sparkly green costume.

 

The show begins! I do a trick which I learned a long time ago: doing a handstand on my friend'ss head while she is sitting on a trapeze holding a pole which my other friend walks on to get to our trapeze. She then hangs on the seat of the trapeze while it lowers and I get off.

The show ends and I walk back with my family, tired as a sloth.

 

It'ss midnight and I am in bed. I wonder what it is like to be a regular kid, about to see me preform tomorrow.

LIFE IN THE CIRCUS

 

     Life in the circus isn't just fun and games it's hard work.Despite what many people think,the life of a circus performer isn't all high-flying fun and games and clowning around.

 

   To begin with,you have to drive 20,000 miles in seven months each year.Visiting 150 cities from sunup to sundown.First,you wake up at 7:00 A.M to eat and get dressed.Then at 9:00 A.M its school time.Like every school ours has computers,test,and report cards.Many people in the school and circus speak other languages like:French,Russian,and Italian.At 3:30 P.M.Chores and practice.We feed the animals and water them.Then we groom the horses in our horseback acts.At 6:30 P.M.Dinnertime.We go to the pie car to eat,but we dont eat much because we're performing tonight.We do 10 shows a week:one each weekday,plus a matinee on wednesday,two on Saturday,and two on Sunday.10:30 P.M.The show is over.At 12:00 A.M.Its time to go to asleep.

 

    Next,you have to have to have specific talent.You have to be like a acrobat,trapeze artist,circus clown,juggler,tight rope walker,and know how to train animals.You also have to have the right body type and be determined.If your determined you can start at a young age.Like Philippa started when she was 5 years old.She did musical theatre and ballet and all kinds of music,singing,acting and everthing to hone my craft"says Philippa,who also trained in rhythmic gymnastics for years.There are so many people out there who want to do what you do,that you have to go for it.You have to put your heart into it and be certain that's what you want to do

 

    Finally,theres always gonna be bad days or good days.Sometimes theres not always gonna be happy and perfect days as you think circus are.The good part about being in the circus is that you get to travel across the world.The girl that started when she was 5,Phillippa has worked all over the planet,including Australia,Japan and all over North America."The circus has given me the opportunity to go to so many different places and meet so many new people said Phillippa.Now the bad days or downside days.Circus perfomers work long days and spend a lot of time away from home. You have to work a lot of long hours and weekends as well.

 

       As you can see,these are all the things circus have and all the things people have to do to have a good circus.

Here's what a daily basis in the circus is like.

 

At 7:00 a.m, I have to eat breakfast in the pie car and have food like pancakes and bacon, and eggs. The crew is setting up for the show tonight.

 

9:00 a.m., School time, I go to school for six hours each day. Like any school, there is modern technology, tests, and report cards. Since we perform all over the world, many of my classmates speak other languages, so it is sort of a bilingual school. As we travel all over the world, our geography lessons are great help.

 

3:00 p.m. School has just got out. It is sort of like playtime for me because the clowns' let us play with their stuff like riding unicycles and juggling, and we also have a dog and we play with hom afterschool too. I sometimes get bored, but I can always entertain myself.

 

3:30 p.m. We practice what we are going to do tonight for the circus and do chores. The chores can be really boring like I have to pick up the elephants' poop and feed the elephants. I have to practice my acts like riding on the unicycle and juggling. Trainers are doing training with the animals.

 

6:30 p.m. Dinnertime. We eat a small meal before we perform our show because we could get cramps and we are performing tonight. We do 8 shows a week. One eack weekday, and two on each Saturday and one on sunday.

 

10:30 p.m. The show is over. I am exhausted after a big show.We pass the circus offices, concession stands, stables, and trailers. WEe will set up in another town in two days. 

 

12:00 a.m. I am in bed and thinking about the end of our season. It will be very nice to go back to our real home in California. I might be a circus performer, or maybe not. Who Knoes? The circus is fun, but it is a very fun part of the year.

I think it is hard to be in a circus. because you got to go to school to learn.  you have choir's to do.  you have to practice do your homework. after you are finish all of that it will be time to go to bed. you will have no television time. the next day you will haft to start the day all over again.

CIRCUS
                                    By:Alex Solorzano

                                       
      One day my mom got really mad at me for having a bad attitude. So that night I squeezed out my window and headed towards the circus to see if I could get a job.I tried to talk to one of the clowns but he kept shooting me with a water flower.So I went to another clown and he used a hand buzzer on me!The instructor asked me where my mother was and I told him I was an orphan.He asked me if I had any special talent and I said "NO."

Life in the Circus

      Hello my name is Beth T. Lewis and i'm going to teLl you about life in a Circus. Life in a Circus is very difficult, but not for me because I have been in the Circus for 15 years. I started when I was 7 years old, I wanted to do it because my parents has their own circus, so once I saw them doing acrobats I knew from the beginning that's what I wanted to do. I trained for 3 years and when I turned 10 it was my first performance. The performance I had to do was walking on a horse back while it was running. At first I was very scared but then I saw my father show me what I had to do before showtime  to refresh my memory and then I noticed it wasn't that scary after all. It was 5 minutes before show, I was next. Before I went on my father wished me good luck and it was time for me to go on. As I walked onto the platform I noticed how many people came just to watch the Circus, then I said to myself I can't mess up or my parents reputation will be ruined. So, after all I performed my act and I landed it it was perfect everyone loved it. I have been doing the Circus every since.

     Now, I've told my story so it's time for me to tell you the types of training you wil have to do for your entrance in your life in the Circus.

     If you want to be in the Circus you will have to be fit and in shape. You will have to take contortionist and acrobat lessons. Most of all you will have to be determined to do it and not quit and that's how you will get the performing act. I'm gonna tell you only a fewjobs they are gonna have there just incase you will want to do one and I will tell you what types of trainings you will have to do with them.

    The first job I am going to tell you about is acrobats. In order to do acrobats you will have to have great balance and posture. Next, you will have to be in shape and have lots of flexability. The types of training you will have to do is just learnong how to do certain moves and how to hold your self in the air with nothing holding you. Then, you will have to learn how to flip and spin in the air and that's how you do acrobats in the air without nothing holding you but a rubber-band like object that you will have to hold on to in order not to fall out of the air and this will take lots of strength.

    The next job I am going to tell you is about traing lions. To train lions you have to be very brave and have the animals to like you. Warning: If the animals do not like you stay away from them and try to stay calm. The type of training you will have to take is only classes on how to get the animals to do what you say and it will take lots of practice to get the animals to like you. Tip: Give the animal treats after they do what you tell them to do.

   That's all the Tips I have for you today until next time GOOD LUCK! I have a show to do. Good Bye!

The clowns really scared Margret.

           At about ten o'clock the circus show was over. Margret was really tired so when she got home she went straight to bed. That night Margret wished she could  have stayed longer. She hopes that she can go back another time.

The Time I Saved the Circus

 

This day started out like any other summer day. I could here birds chirping outside and my mom cooking breakfast downstairs. I had been anticipating this day for months now. I couldn't wait to go to the circus.

 

I lived far out in a small country town and the circus hadn't come in a long time. My family had a farm and we had many animals but my favorites were horses. My mom once said to our neighbor that I had a real gift with the horses. I knew every thing about them. I had once heard that the circus that was coming had the most amazing horses in the world.

 

Later at the circus we bought our tickets and walked in. The tent was ginormous! It was red and white striped and seemed to go on forever. We quickly took our seats and waited for the show to start. Suddenly a man in stilts walked onto the stage and started speaking in a  low voice." I am sorry but our opening act, the horses, has been canceled due to our sick horse master"

 

I was filled with disappointment and wanted to cry. I could see the horses back in the other room stamping impatiently and wondering where their master was. Suddenly the man on the stilts seemed to remember that this was not in a big city and that most people would own farms and know how to command a horse.  So the man said,  "Although, if anyone knows how to work with a horse we could have them train for a day and you could come back tomorrow." No one was very happy about the fact that they would have to come back tomorrow, not even the performers. They knew it would set back the scheduling for the tour. But they didn't want to disappoint anyone who had paid to see their show.

 

I wasn't even listening to the announcer because I was too sad and lost in thought. But my mom suddenly stood up and said, "My daughter has a wonderful talent with horses, she could do it!" Every one started laughing. The thought of a little girl tending the horses in a circus was just absurd. Despite all the laughter, no one else volunteered. I was going to work in the circus with one of the most amazing horses in the world! I was so excited.

 

Later that afternoon, I started to work with the horses. It was very easy in the beginning but then I learned how to orchestrate much more complex tricks with the horses. I learned that I wouldn't actually be on the horse but that I would just be giving the horses commands.

 

The next day at the show, I got very nervous. Although I had been training non-stop yesterday I still had butterflies in my stomach. Before I knew it, I was walking onstage with the magnificent white horses. The lights started to dim and it seemed like all eyes were on me. I started my first trick. The show was simple at first but throughout my act the tricks got harder and harder. Finally I was finished. I turned and took a bow. I thought I saw out of the corner of my eye the horses bow their long graceful necks too. Everyone started applauding. I was filled with energy and happiness. That was the day I saved the circus.

Ropes To Hopes

 

 

        Katleen is the best gymnastics girl in her class.She is well built and even knows how to work her way into anything. She can balance on a balance beam and even and straight with books on her head (I think that is only a plus though).Katleen is someone that can really be the best at anything.

        One day she was walking in the park with three other friends that were dear to her heart.They stopped by a refreshments stand to get some ice cold water when there it was.The poster for the  new opening in the Cirque Du Soleil.They had heard about it on the news but didn't know they could have a chance.All three girls tore a slip off with the information on it.Katleen really wanted this job as a kid she was always watching the circus with her mom and dad but today she has a shot at being in the circus and having kids watching her perform.She was so excited but then she read that each entry needs to have a opposite gender partner to be able to try out.She automatically thought of her friend Devin.He was her best friend and they would be a perfect pair.Devin was also her crush.She really thought that he was cute but everyone thought she was silly.Right then and there she pulled out her phone and called Devin.He picked up in excitement. He said, "You'll never guess what!I just found a sign up sheet for the Cirque Du Soliel today when i was in the park walking Sally.Do you wanna be my partner." "Yes Devin I'll be your partner.That's exactly what I wanted to ask you too so i guess you beat me to it." said Katleen in a happy voice.The two met up in the park and started to practice right away doing back flips,side aerials,and cartwheels.They looked lovely together let's just hope they can pull it off in three days or all that work is just trash.

     Three days passed and today is the day.Devin and Katleen both met up in the parking lot of the try outs and walked in together as a pair.The two went to the bathrooms and got on their leotards and Katleen got on her tutu.They came back out and got someone to go and take a picture of them in their outfits so that they remember this day forever.About an hour later the pair was called up to get onto the ladder to get on the  rope for acrobats.They both were very nervous.They stepped out on the stage and the music started.Their piece was titled "Butterfly"They got back down the ladder and hugged each other to death.They really did do their best and they both knew it.They were the tenth to last couple to perform.After the end the judge called out  the top three."Kevin and Destiny in third place.Niall and Hailee in second place.Finally Katleen and Devin in first place."The couple jumped up and started screaming at once that means that they won the competition.

     Devin and Katleen both woke up extra early the next Monday to get ready to get on the bus to go to the circus. When they got there everyone was so welcoming to them. They fit straight in with the crowd everyone accepted that they were the new people to their team.When Devin and Katleen got there they ran their routine with all the other people in the circus.Katleen thought that it would be all fun and games until she actually got there

and experienced what it was like to be in the circus.Devin wasn't getting off at the right foot.Everyone loved and hated him for all the wrong reasons.His father was the person that was going to stop the circus from performing.One clown said that her was told that  he  was banished from the earth along with his descendents.Devin was hurt that they thought that he was going to stop them and ruin their chances of being the best.Katleen was sad for Devin.He had always had this problem since people knew who his dad was.

     That night Devin wrote to his mom and said he was thinking of leaving the circus forever.When Katleen heard of this she was disappointed that he didn't want to go through with his promise to never leave her alone.Secretly Katleen wanted him to leave so she can stop worrying about their friendship. She told Devin how she felt and the next day he was gone."What did I do?!" thought Katleen when she read the letter.Her new partner was a guy named Niall.He was at the competition.He said that he loved her performance in the competition.

     Katleen finally got over Devin and just in time because her show was in three days.She and Niall looked awesome together.He loved to be an acrobat with her.She started to practice in her hotel room just so she would be perfect.She didn't even go to her own party because she was practicing.She never wanted to miss over twelve minutes of practice time.This time was very important to her.She was determined to show everyone how graceful she can be. But like every good circus performer she started to miss home.She miss her family and her dog Pepper.She could stand being away for so long.One day she decided that she wanted to leave and get a better job then being in the circus.Niall finally talked her out of it and made her think if she really wanted to sacrifice something so precise to just o she can get a better job.He said,"I understand how you feel.I felt like that when i came to be with you but as you can see I'm as fine as fine can be I'm even better." Niall did have a point  thought Katleen.I can't away something that I've worked very hard for to go to waste.She decided to buckle down and get focused on what she wanted to do and why she wanted to do it.

      Katleen knew that her dad and mom would not approve for her to not get focused and be ready for something as big as this.The big day came the day she wanted to come all her life is finally here.The circus came and now she wanted it to be the very most special day of her career.They didn't think that Niall could perform because he was getting really sick.They were sxcared.So Kateen had to work with an unexperienced guy by the name of Gaert.He was handsome but his acrobatic skills sucked.He never knew which way to turn her but it pulled off and lolooked so unique and special that they had to love him.He brought a good experience to the show it was unique and special in a way that was also very funny.The  Cirque Du Soliel did pretty good thanks to Katleen and her strong courage.

What the story is about is a man named Jo. Jo wanted to be in the circus all his life, so Jo practiced being a clown. Then when he was old enough, he went to find a circus,and he found one! He went inside, there were clowns juggling pies and riding unicycles, acrobats on the high-wire everything was there to see! Jo went inside and asked to be a clown and the owner said "Yes". Jo was in the circus! he dressed up as a clown and went inside, and there was more things inside then outside! There were people grooming the elephants and horses, and acrobats jumping from horse to horse when they were moving! Jo's act was to  juggle with pies and jump on the trampoline! After the circus they all got paid and went home. Jo went home and fell asleep.

 

The next day was the same but they were going to Italy! So, every body went home and packed their things and came back in a few minutes, with things, but some people lived in Italy, most of them lived in Italy. Jo and the others went to the plane and went of to Italy! it took a day to get there because they missed a flight, but they got to Italy the next day. everybody was exited to do the circus with new people! But every body was hungry after the trip, so everybody went into the pie-car and had breakfast. then the people who lived in Italy went to there house and went to get there things.

 

Jo was amassed at what he saw in Italy! he saw different food and different cars. he bought a few different things and he looked at the museum paintings, then it was time to go back to the plane and go to China to perform they went to the plane station, but they missed there flight! it wasn't supposed to come back in a month! they went by car and went to China, but then they found another plane station and then went inside and was just in time to get there plane flight! the plane had to stop for fuel. then they went to China!

 

Jo and everybody else could see China! They landed at an airport and got out, they went to the grassy area and seted up the circus tent and they started the circus and so many people came! Jo had to sleep and ride a unicycle around the tent! So they did the act and then they went inside a SUV and went to sleep. the next morning and went to the plane station to get a ride to Seadle! They were just in time to catch the flight to Seadle!

 

They made it to Seadle and they put up the tent and they went to the piecar to eat. Jo was going to the tent to say "Can I get paid?" The owner said "Yes". Jo got paid and he was going to take a break from the circus and go home. Jo said "Goodbye everyone!" They said "Goodbye Jo!" and he bought a car and went home. Jo said "Im going back to the circus to be with my friend's".

My Day At The Circus

 

 

             Today my mom and I are going to the circus. She bought us backstage passes so we could see all of the animals and performers. I've never been to a circus before but they sound like lots of fun. My dad would have come but he's sick so we sold his ticket, but I still have to tell him what happened.

 

 

              It's 6:00 time to go to the circus it started at 6:30 ,but we went early to see the performers getting ready to perform it was really fun watching them get ready because we got to see the animals do a bunch of tricks like a tiger roll over and sit down all on command. Once they were done more people started to show up that's when I realized that wasn't the real show and that was just practice.

 

 

             When the real show started I was really excited because the first thing you could see on the stage was a man and a woman swinging through the air doing flips and catching each other in mid air.then under them were two clowns riding on the backs of two enormous elephants. Then a man on stilts walked right through the space in-between both elephants then a man riding horseback did a cartwheel on the horses back while the horse was running. Then all of the performers went backstage then the stage was empty, but that wasn't the end even though I thought it was it wasn't because a man with a lion came out and then another man with a tiger then they both started jumping through hoops and sitting and rolling over then they left too it was over.

 

 

              Then we went backstage and met all of the performers even though most of them didn't speak English it was still fun i even got to feed and pet a lion. When my mom told me we had to go I didn't want to, but I knew we had to get home before it got to late so I left. When we got home I told my dad everything we did then went to bed so I could dream about it.

Honochy the Great

 

A long time ago on a small farm a young boy was milking cows when on the horizon he spotted an enormous red tent he curiously ran off to see what was going on. When he arrived men and woman fled inside the tent so did the young boy. Inside his eyes lit up, a circus! 'ooss' and 'aaghs.' Filled the whole tent, as a man walked across a tightrope while balancing an umbrella on his nose.  After hordes of performances it began to get dark. The boy began to run home. Just then he ran into a big muscular man with narrow eyes and a rather large mustache. He picked up the boy and with a gruff voice said 'Watt'ar-ya doin' ramm'n intu' peoples like d'at?' He dropped the boy and the man paced off. On the long walk home he could still hear the croud cheering. What a

"Ahhhh!" a scream came from the tent.  I rushed over to see what happened.  I really hoped it was not somebody from an important act, or anybody.  Everyone in the circus is like a family to me and I would really hate to see them go away.  I ran like the wind over to the tent, my feet were a blur. 

             I am the fastest runner in the circus that is why I do my special act.  I practice everyday to perfect my skills.  My act is I run as fast as I can and then jump onto a swing and do a flip over the fulcrum.  I love seeing the kids faces once I finish because over my experience as a kid I know that kids love fast runners, and people who do flips.  They LOVE seeing someone go head over heels.  I think I have the best act in the circus because I please the kids.  Also I love doing my job.  I love to run and do flips.  Every performer feels that way about their act because they love to do it.  You are not a true performer if you do not like to do what you do. 

            I sped past the animal stalls and my horse named bullzeye, named after my lacrosse stick that I will never forget, whinnied and I replied "Not now bullzeye I have to get to this accident.  Here have an apple."  I grabbed an apple from my backpack and threw it to him quickly.  Something else fell out of my pocket and hit my ankle but I kept running.  Bullzeye is my partner in 2 acts : jumping on a trampoline then doing a flip and jumping on a trampoline then landing on him.  The second one takes a lot of balance and concentration. 

            I burst into the tent and saw a small crowd huddled around someone.  I ran over to him and asked what happened.  He replied "I was on my unicycle and then I fell and hit the rack of knives.  It was the clown.  My best friend, he was like a father to me. 

            I, Bill Gasten, am 23 and just graduated college.  People call me Billy.  My parents worked here until a fatal car accident during the off-season when I was 6.  Instead of going to an orphanage I insisted on staying with the circus.  I really wanted to stay and travel the world and meet new people.  Right now we are in Japan.  The clown, Ron Smith, acted as a father to me.  He is in his later years and had no kids or wife.  I really hoped he was not a goner, he was all I had.
            A bunch more people came to look.  "Ha-ha, I got you good" Ron said.  Nobody laughed.  "Ron its not funny, you really scared us." the manager said.  "Yeah" I added "Its not funny".   "All right everybody go back to work, the red stuff on the floor is ketchup mixed with water and red food coloring." Ron said.  "What, Ron?  Tonight is hot dog night and you know I need a lot of ketchup on my hot dog."  I said.  He must have stolen it from the pie car I thought.  "Actually, I found this over here" Ron said as if reading my mind.  Everybody walked away. The manager shook his head in disgust as he stormed into his office mad that he had to be interrupted reading his emails.
            I went back to practice and had a regular day.

 

            "C'mon fast get everything ready, Billy" someone yelled at me.  I could not find my special safety hook for tonights performance.  Somehow it had fell out of my pocket.  It was hand made for me when I was young and it had my parents names on it with mine.  I needed it. I just could not remember where I had put it.  I had it in my pocket before school but it is nowhere to be seen now.  I had searched everywhere - even in the bathroom and I could not find it.  Good thing I only needed the hook for the last act that I had so maybe I could find it on the stage during one of my other acts.   "And now, we have our very own... Billy Gasten!" I heard being announced.  I got my things and hurried out onto the stage. 

             The crowd roared and I waved to everyone.  Then the music started to play.  I waited for my cue.  Bullzeye charged out of the curtains and towards me.  I pretended to be scared and this was not supposed to happen and once bullzeye got close enough I jumped up and onto his back the did a front flip off.  We had practiced this many times and the crowd loved it.  I pretended to wipe sweat off my forehead just exaggerating a lot and actually I did wipe some sweat off my forehead.  Bullzeye turned and charged again.  This time he jumped up and I slid under him.  I noticed a glint in his teeth.  Wow I though, the dentists have been doing a good job.  We did that a few times until the music ended.  

            Then the curtains closed and I hurried to find the hook.  I ran out and looked again.  I went over to the stalls first because I had been there for a while today after practice.  I found an imprint of the hook in the grass by bullzeye's stall.  Somebody had picked it up, but who?  The I realized that was what had hit my ankle when I ran to Ron.

            I checked my watch and it read 7:03.  Time for my second act because it took about 5 minutes for the stage crew to clean up.

           I hurried back to the tent and got to the stage in my position.  Bullzeye and I did our act.  Again I noticed a glint in bullzeye's teeth, but I thought it was only the golden tooth in the back of bullzeye's mouth.   After I realized that it was hopeless, I would never get the hook in time unless there was a miracle. 

            Time for the hook act.  I waited 5 minutes and then when I was about to go out when bullzeye nudged me.  I turned and said "Not now, bullzeye".  I turned back and started out the door but bullzeye kicked me lightly with his foot.  I turned back and looked at bullzeye in an annoyed way. "Not now bullzeye, I am not in a good mood." I said in an angry tone.  Bullzeye spit something from its mouth.  I looked down at the gooey thing on the ground.  I gasped.  "Thank you bullzeye, you are the best" I said happily.  I picked the object up and wiped the saliva off.  "To Billy" it read "From mom and dad".  The metal with wood reflected all the fun moments I had with my parents.  I ran out onto the stage ready to do anything. 

              When the crowd quieted down I announced "Everybody, there will be one change in the show tonight.  Give us 5 minutes and we will be ready again.  I walked back and pulled the curtains shut.  I called to the stage crew and told them specific orders.  "Get the swing fulcrum raised 20 feet without changing the length of the rope and put the trampoline near it.  Get this done in five minutes."  Nobody objected and they all hurried off to get the tools required.                 

               Life for a circus man is always challenging.

              

               I went over to bullzeye.  "All right bud, we are changing the plans." I said aloud and whispered the rest to him so it would be a suprize for everybody.   I placed something on his neck and left.  I gathered everyone up next "Everybody there has been a change of plans.  You might want to go out to the bleachers and watch this."  I informed.  Everyone did as told.  I stretched my body out to get ready. 

                Bullzeye came over to me and we walked onto the stage.  Everything was in place.  The curtains opened, the music started to play.  I hopped on bullzeye and we set off.  You know how I said I was the fastest in the company, well, correction, Bullzeye is the fastest in the company.  We ran like the wind to the trampoline and as we got 5 feet away I yelled "JUMP!"  Bullzeye jumped and landed perfectly in the center of the trampoline.  We flew diagonally upwards and I closed my eyes and thought.

                Why did I use bullzeye, if we fall we both die.  Bullzeye does not deserve to die.  I said firmly to myself.  Then I thought back.  I remember the time bullzeye was born and my parents said he could be mine.  I remember the dinner before my parents drove away to a place I am not going to now.

               I opened my eyes and looked into the crowd and saw everybody watch in amazement.  I was born to amaze.  And bullzeye was born to amaze,

                                                     and be on target. 

 

               Click. 

 

               The hook got on the swing.

 

               The crowd roared.

A Circus Life                                                                                                          I am exhausted from the show we had tonight.Many people think that the circus life is only fun ,but it isn't true.As an acrobat, I know that that in not true because you have to learn a lot of different tricks and routines.In my opinion, the most difficult routines are the ones where you have to work with a partner because they might let you fall down.                                                                                                                                                    This is the schedule I have on weekdays.

 

 

                7:00 am-wake up

             

 

                7:30 am-eat breakfast

 

                 

                 9:00 am-practice all my routines

 

                

                 12:00 pm-eat lunch

 

 

                 3:00 pm-set up everything for the show

 

 

                 5:00 pm-show starts

 

 

                 7:00 pm-show is over

 

 

                 10:00 pm-think about what is coming tomorrow

 

 

 

                After all that ,i don't have time for myself.The circus life is really busy and tough.

?                     Becoming a Circus Performer

 

       To become a  good circus performer  you need to know somethings about circus stuff because once you become a circus performer you will be a professional at circus things. First you need to practice doing flips and  perfect cart wheels. Then you are going to have to work very hard to do a good job. I think we should practice at least seven times a day for a month then once you get good at it you could practice juggling in the air on a unicycle.

 

                  Another step that will help you be a good circus performer is making a schedule . That could really help you find the right time for practicing. You will have to practice training circus horses. The Story of a Girl Named Hope

 

 

One day a girl named Hope was born into this world.As she grew up and learned to talk,Hope became fascinated with the circus life.By the age of 9 her parents agreed that she could go join the circus.For months she practiced her skills.Hope had wish to be a acrobat.She would do gymnastics for hours a day.Finally the day came when she had to leave her family to join the circus.

 

As hope boarded the circus train she was greeted by clowns and animal trainers.She walked through the train carts.At last she had reached the acrobats cart.Hope was surprised to see people hanging of the roof and beds."Hello!" everyone had shouted.She was smiling with joy as she found her bunk.She was bunking with a acrobat from Russia.The Russian girl was 10,only a year older than Hope."Hi I'm Hope" a silent moment paused between the two girls."Hi I'm Rachel, I am guessing your the new acrobat?". Hope nodded her head right then she knew they would be best friends.

 

The next morning Hope woke up with the rest of the acrobats, at 6:30 A.M.Training started today.Rachel and Hope had been put to work on rope acts.Hope watched Rachel dance between the ropes,back and forth.It was as if Rachel was a professional with the ropes.When Hope got on the ropes, she wasn't to bad for a rookie.Time had flown through the day as Rachel and Hope worked on the ropes."I like you,your my new best friend," Rachel had said with a bright smile to Hope.

 

A few weeks later it had been opening night.It was Hope's first night.Rachel and her watched as the other performers did there act perfectly.All the animals did their act and obeyed their masters/trainers.To Hope the most beautiful act was the horses.They danced and pranced around the ring,coats shining bright in the circus lights.Finally, Hope and Rachel had heard their names being called for their act."This is it!" yelled Rachel over the noise of the crowd."Uh i don't know if i can do this" Hope shakes as she says this.They slowly walked towards their acting spot."The ropes,the ropes" Hope said in her mind."I can do this!!!" shouted Hope over the noise of the crowd and the animals.As Rachel and Hope got on the ropes the crowd went silent.Each grabbed a rope and the gliding above the crowd went smooth as possible.The crowd yelled and shouted their names.

 

Once they got back to their bunks everyone congratulated them "Way to go!" "Nice job!" "Hope you guys do that again" all of theses comments came from professionals."Don't worry we will be doing that again soon" yelled Rachel and Hope from their bunks."I can't wait for tomorrow" said Hope as she yawned."Same, good night Hope" "Good night Rachel".They both turned on their sides and fell asleep as silence fell over the other bunks in the carts.And that is the wonderful story of Hope and Rachel,her new best friend.

The Circus Life

 

     The  people's life at the circus isnt easy because day and night they have to pratice the life of a circus person isnt easy cause they travel 20,000 milesin seven months each year, visiting 150 cities. they do 10 shows a week; one each weekend , plus a mitenee on Wednesday, two on Saturday, and two on Sunday. Although their soppose to to sleep 8 hours of sleep and they only get about 6 hours of sleep.

    

      Her life every day. The first thing that she does in the morning is get dress up, , and go to car pie for pancakes  and bacon. the other people are getting ready fo the show tonight. After breakfast she goes to school there she learns alot of stuff .   Then she does some chores after school like feed, water, and  groom the horses . The horses that they use for the show.

 

     

      People dream of being in the circus an running away from home.But its not just anyone can go and join  the circus  and become an acrobat or trapeze artist. We need to have a specific  talent , the  right body  type  and be  very determined . Like Philippa who also

trained in rhythmic gymnastics for years. Philippa has worked all over  the planet, including Australia, Japan, and all over North America.

Circus Life   

     "Neigh", the horse neighed very loudly.  The crowd shrieks at the horse. John the man who is scaring the horse with a fake gun laughs. Its my turn to go in and tell john to stop that. I'm supposed to be his older sister.

     I shake my finger at him because we aren't aloud to talk in a circus. He puts his head down like a little boy who couldn't go to his friends house. Then he shakes his head and lets the horse be.  I do a back flip to the horse and the crowd cheers. I pet the horse then we skip off behind the curtains. We have to move very fast.

     Soon enough were all out in front of the crowd and holding hands and bowing. Huge smiles are on our faces even though we are extremely tired. Then we skip back behind the curtains and take off all our make up and take our hair out of the amazing design it had.

     My hair is a reddish brownish color. People say it is beautiful. I think it is too. I'm only 12 years old and I'm in the circus. My parents travel with me, other wise I'll get a little home sick if there not with me.

     I slip on my pajamas and have a bed time snack. An apple. I love apples very much. We can only have healthy snacks so I pick apples. They rock.  I have to get a good nights rest for tomorrow. I have a big day coming up on my heels. Good night!!!!

Not just anyone can go and join the circus and become an acrobat or trapeze artist. You need to have a specific talent, the right body type and be very determined. Philippas road to circus stardom started when she was 5 years old. When I was 11, I knew I wanted to be a peformer, so I went for it. I gave up everything else and concentrated on my dancing and performing. There are so many people out there who want to do what you do, that yoy have to go for it. You have to put your heart into it and be certain that thats what you want to do. "Circus Life"                                                                                                                      by Zoei Bristol                                                                             Hi I'm Harper Waldo and I'm a circus performer. I bet you think that being in a circus means that you can have fun all the time. Well, if you thought that you are wrong. I have to work hard every day practicing skills. I'm always busy.                                                 I go to school with all the other kids in the circus. We only have one classroom, but I'm okay with that. Some of the kids speak  different languages, so I know four languages. I know how to speak French, German, Spanish, and English. After school I have to groom.                                                                                                                                         I have to groom the horses for tonight's big show. I also have to groom a elephant! It is the smallest elephant in the world. Her name is Tiny. It's time to start practicing.                  I am watching my sister, Ella, fly through the air. She is a trapeze artist. It is my turn to practice. I am working with Tiny. I do handstands while she is walking I can hold a handstand for two minutes without falling! I did it perfectly. Yay! Now I'm watching my dad. He's a tightrope walker. He walks on a rope fifty feet in the air. He is so good. Now it's my mom's turn to practice then the show will start. My mom is a circus acrobat. She is so flexible it is unbelievable. We also have a human pretzel and a dancing bear! It took years to train him.                                                                                                                        There is only five minutes until the show starts and I'm getting butterflies. I peek out to see the crowd and I faint. When I wake up I see mom.                                                            "Mom is the show over?"                                                                                                    "No, you woke up just in time to do your act." I almost scream. I ran to get ready. Then I realized that I was already ready. I got Tiny and walked out to the stage.                        "Ladies and gentlemen for your next act we have Harper Waldo." I heard the announcer say. I got on Tiny's back and did a handstand for two minutes then I picked up one hand and held it for another two minutes! Then all of the sudden I was swinging through the air with Ella.                                                                                                             After the show we went out side and everyone wanted my autograph. I was so shocked that I said "Me." Then the fans said "Ya, you were awesome." So I had to sign two hundred pictures.                                                                                                                   So my family went to our trailer and the gave me a huge bear hug.                                     "We're so proud of you."they all said at once.

        "Thank you. Ella I didn't know you were going to do that, but it was pretty cool." I said.

        "I thought I'd give the show a twist. Everyone loved it. I think we should do that for every show." said Ella.                                                                                                               "So do we." said mom and dad. So we did that every show and everyone loved it.

Life for a Circus Performer

 

     I, as an acrobat, must work very hard everyday to please the audience. Life as a circus performer can be both hard and fun at the same time. In the mornings I have to wake up early to get dressed and eat breakfast. Then after that I have to start practicing for the night's show. It's not easy for me to do the tricks though. I have to have balance, concentration, and skill. This hard work is very rewarding when the crowd goes wild when I perform my tricks.

     The good parts of being a circus performer is great. You get to travel all over the world for circus performances and you can meet new people. To me the best part of all is when you astound the crowd. When you are break you can explore the place that you are at, learn the people who lives there's cultures, and try new food.

     The bad part of being a circus performer is when you have to work super hard to perform at performances and basically there are performances at least once everyday from Monday to Sunday. You also have to be far away from your family for a long time. You can't call your family too because you don't have anywhere to call.

The Circus Life

                                            By:Kennadi Dykstra

     Have you ever been to a circus? It isn't just nonstop play, in the circus you work from sunup to sundown. Busy right?

     Lets see what a typical day looks like for Bella Castini: 7:00 Wake up, get dressed, go to the pie cart to eat, 9:00 school time, 3:00 school's over---time for a quick break, 3:30 chores and practice, 6:30 dinnertime,7:00 SHOWTIME 10:30 the show is over and finally I am in bed at 12:00.

     There are some upsides of being a circus performers you know like you get to travel all over the world and you get to preform in front of a live audience every time you preform endless people are watching on a TV. I think the upsides are kind of cool.

     In the circus there are some downsides too like circus performers work long and tiring days and they send ALONG TIME away from home (i think they get home sick a lot.)I don't think that sounds very fun.

     But  before you get to do all this you need to know a few things, first: not just anyone can join the circus you need to have the right body type, second: have a specific talent for some it is Circus acrobats for others it is a juggler and for some it is tightrope walking

     Some of the words I used you might not under stand like:

pie car: where circus performers,

unicycle: a bike with only one wheel,

groom: clean and brush,

matinee: afternoon show, and

wiped out: very tired, those were circus terms so unless you want to be a circus performer or you are a circus performer you don't have to know those terms unless you want to.

     So after all those ups, downs late nights early mornings if you still want to be a circus performer and you have the right body type and a spisific talent go ahead and try to become a circus performer just try it who knows it could be fun!!!!!

Life is hard in the circus! You may of heard all the stories of performences and the animals and all that jazz, yeah it's fun but hard.I mean you have to take care of the animals like feed,  them take care of there messes, get them ready for performences, and train them.

      That animal stuff is probably the hardest but dont forget about traveling. We are constantly going somewhere. Like we'll have to go to another place for a performance then to sleep. It's crazy!

       And all the times, are scheduals, there so annoying! We just have to be somewhere at a certain time or else were in trouble. So were constantly being rushed. Like for example, if were not intime for showtime, watch out! It's coming.

       That's what I mean. Life in the circus is fun but very hard.

The Uninvited Performer

 

 

            We were all so excited when we figured out we were going to the circus! Everybody was going crazy! Some people wanted to see the elephants, some the clowns, and some the Trapeze artists. When we were lining up to get on the bus, i was thinking. This is my first time going to circus. It felt like forever getting there, but when we saw that big red tent when knew we were there.

 

           After we got our snacks we got our seats. I had probably about three slushies! So now i really had to go to the bathroom. So I went and asked my teacher , Mrs. Johnson, if i could go. I had to hurry because it was getting ready to start.

 

           When I was looking for a bathroom i got lost. I found a door that I thought led to the bathroom but then I saw all these bright lights! " where am I? " I asked my self. A huge elephant passed by me, then a clown! Then I knew where I was. Backstage where the performers stand before they go on stage! A tall man with a mustache came up to me and asked, "why aren't you changed yet!! We go out in 5 minutes! " He handedd me a colorful sparkly costume to wear. So i went back and changed and it fit! Did you know how fast circus people can do your makeup and hair. It's crazy! I looked in the mirror and said to myself, "wow! I look good! "

 

            Then , I thought, Mrs.Johnson is probably looking for me! She doesn't know that im going to be in the circus. Now, im in big trouble.

 

              The 5 minutes went by and i was on the stage. People were screaming and those lights were really bright! I was looking for the class and Mrs.Johnson but couldn't find them. I had no idea what i was so supposed to do until i looked up and so people on these ropes doing tricks, hanging upside down. I thought, don't tell me I have to do that! Then that man with the mustache was telling me with his hands to go on that empty rope.

 

                Here we go. They pulled the rope higher and higher! It was like I was flying! I was doing flips, twirling all sorts of stuff. It was so exciting! Then our act was over. We waited until everybody was done then we went out and bowed. People were screaming as loud as they could! It felt great.

 

                After the bow I had to go change and find my class quick! I finally found them. I was going up the stairs to my seat and they were going down the stairs. Mrs.Johnson wasn't that mad. All my classmates were saying how good I was and how it was like to be in the circus.

 

                I never thought I would do it but I did. I was in the circus!

       Finally, then Judy was happy and had fun. Her mother was so proud and happy to because Judy had so much fun. Then when Judy came back home she realized how much fun she had and hopes she goes back agian.

Instead of going to Alabama like they were suppose to they went to Texas. In Texas they don`t like clowns as always these two little clowns never listened."Yea-haw" said bob riding a cowboys horse."You better give my horse back you ugly clown" said the old cowboy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          "What did you just call me cowboy? ''Alright you want to play that game huh'' said the cowboy''Sure''said the cowboy ''Billy''called the cowboy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Well like always they both were not even thinking about the circus in Alabama. They are too busy trying to win a horse by boxing a guy named Billy. This is going to be a fair match said the cowboy. Also no blood added Bob. ''Are you ready'' asked the cowboy to both of them and they both said''yes''. ''Let the game Begin said the cowboy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Wham! there came Fred from nowhere hit Billy right in the jaw(his tooth fell out). Whoops Billy swung and then he missed. Boom! Fred had hit Billy again this time in the gut. bam! Fred grabs Billy`s hand and uppercuts him in the jaw again. Don't you give up yet?''bob asked. ''no not yet'' said the cowboy. Ram! Fred  knee Billy in the side Billy falls,but he gets back up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Good thing about it is that they fought all the way to Alabama,but the bad thing was they were on stag boxing now. Bam! Fred kicked Billy in the jaw hit him in the jaw,and knee him in the jaw. Well the contest is that Billy and Fred have to box to get a horse.knockout by Fred! The two clowns have won a horse!'' Nice job Fred'' says Billy not hurt because they were not suppose to hurt each other.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Sometimes you can make a deal if you lose don`t get mad just say good job.Well that's the way the day went for the 2 clowns.Now Fred and Bob are enjoying there new horse.

Life at the circus is pretty hard.  I have to get up early in the morning and do lots of stuff such as going around the world almost everyday. My schedules are so not necessary. All I do every day is just go around the world and do crazy things that doesn't really matter in life. I'm in Europe getting ready to perform the most crazy and not necessary things and the only human beings the only likes it are mostly kids. The grownups just thinks that it is just fake things that we do and its not the exciting to them as its exciting to the kids them selves. So what i think is what the circus clowns should do is just retire and find a job at a fast food restaurant like McDonald's. People are so UN-grateful these days with entertainment and food. Sometimes I just think of myself as an old dumb,stupid circus clown that just belongs in the circus and needs to stay.

Today I have to walk on a tight rope and ride on a lion with fire on it.  I'm going on now I'll be right back. I'm back that was a show. I stand myself corrected because i seen a lot of adults excited and enjoying the show. So i guess its just some adults who just aren't into those circus things. When i was out there I had so much fun and I was happy that almost everyone was cheering for our circus. The tight rope was really hard but i concentrated and did the best i could do and i didn't fall. The lion was a wild one but i rode on it and i was scared because i thought the lion was going to try to eat me but the lion was tamed and it learned not to eat people. Today at the circus was really good if the circus keeps going like this i would stay here until the day I die.  Im super tired of all the things we did its time for me to go to sleep. Good night.

Good morning. I just found out the i graduated from the circus and im going back to California. Im super happy. I think yesterday was meant to happen. Im super happy to be going home but imsad becasue im not being in the curcus anymore. I have to say goodbye to everybodty and thank them for all they did to help me be in this circus.

Im back home in Calfornia. I really miss getting up early in the morning and travling places. But im happy to be back home.

The day of a circus performer

 

 

The day of a circus performer is not a simple thing it is a hard working day.

During the day you have school, chores, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and practicing your circus talent. Your day starts about 6:00 and ends at 12:00 this is how your day would go if you were a circus performer.

 

 


   6:00 wake up and get ready  
In the morning I wake up, and go to the pie car with my family we eat a big breakfast to get lots of energy, and we talk a little. Its usually a slow start for me in the morning because i don't want to use all my energy.

 

  2.     8:00 time for school!


After breakfast i go to a one room school house it has many people in it i learn the same stuff every other kid does. I have test, essays, and i get a report card.
There are many other people in the school house, and they speak many other languages like French, Russian, and Italian.

 

  3.     2:00 time for a quick break


 On break you can play with unicycles and juggling balls. You live in trailers and u cant have big animals because if their to big then you will have no room in your trailer.

 

 4.      2:30 Chores and practice


I do my chores i have to take care of the horses that we use in horseback acts. I am trying to do some more tricks with animals and its working out very good.

 

 5.       5:30 Time to EAT!


At dinner time me and my family go to the pie cart, we don't eat much because we don't want to get sick wile performing.

 

 6.       9:30 time to sleep


The show is over I am tired and sleepy no more work for today its not time for me, and my family to go to sleep.

       

 

 

                    This is the life of a circus performer.

TAKING CARE OF CIRCUS HORSES

 

                   My name is Julia and I am 15. My Dad owns a circus and I am a big help with the horses. I help put them in thier trailers when we travel on the road, and I brush and groom them. I also train them to do very cool tricks for the shows!

                  Usually, I wake up around 7:00 A.M. When I get dressed, grab some breakfast from the pie car, and go to horses while everyone sets up tents, lights, etc. By 8:30 I've fed all the horses, and now it's time to go brush my teeth and hair. At 9:00 school starts, and I am very excited to get back to the horses. Finally school's over by around 3:00. I get to the horses, and begin cleaning them up. I first fill up all their water buckets, though. I then start brushing them with a more stiff brush, and next move on to a soft brush that shines their fur a bit. I finish by putting some fly spray on them.

               I take a break from the horses, and complete some homework and chores. I make my small bed and make myself a little snack. While I eat, I review with myself the steps of my horseback act. Then I stop by my friends bed."Hey Jenna!" I say. "Want to come help me with the horses?" "Sorry, I can't right now, I've got to practice my quadrupel back hand spring. But I'll stop by later!" She says. So I get my helmet and boots, then tell my dad to meet me in 5 minutes by the riding area, and head down.

                      Once we're both ready to practice,I put a big, white, square pad on my horse Lily, a snow white horse, with long eye lashes, and a white mane and tail, then I slip on her bridle, and hop on. "Okay, lets warm up with a hand stand with Lily standing still." My dad says. I do it fine, then for about a half hour practice my back flip off her and landing it on the ground perfectly.

                     At 6:30, we eat a small dinner, because we have a show. The makeup and hair artists apply sparkly makeup, and bright lipstick. I wait about a half hour before my part comes in. I walk out on Lily and I stand up on her. I stay determined and confident, something I will always need to do here. Then I slowly swing my and back... And PUSH OFF! I curve my body back like a rainbow, then I slowly bend my knees as I land. The crowd goes wild. Every time I do this, I always smile big. Then do it again but with a double back flip. If I thought they were cheering before, well they were screaming this time! I smiled at everyone, and then walked out, the noise fading.

                     I was wiped out, I put Lily back, took of her saddle pad, and headed "home".

I put my two piece rainbow pajamas on, and waited for my dad to come home. i finished my homework, then put it in my backpack, to go to school in the morning. When i returned to the small table in our trailer cabins living room, my dad came in. "Who wants hot coacoa!?" he asked as he set down four cups for all the girls staying in the trailer we all gathered aroud the cups, grabbed on and sat down slurping our hot chocolate. Then we all crawled into bed, falling asleep right away.

                Every morning I go through the same routine. I never get tired of being with horses all day. When we are done at one destination, we drive to another, and always have a blast att the shows. I am so glad to have such a cool life. I get get to meet kids all around the world! And make new friens, every year.

A DAY AT THE CIRCUS

                                             BY: BRYAN G.R

  

    You might think that the circus is a rampage in side,but it isn't.I Leon S.Kenndy,know difrently.I live in a huge treailer with my companianes.They travel day and night.We travel 20,000miles in seven months.They visit over 150 cities.We work day and night.From sun up to sun down.

  

           *Hear's my terrifing day*

 


  6:30 a.m.I wake up,get breakfast from the pie car.I eat bacon and eggs.I go see the crue and set up tents for to nights show.
8:26 a.m.It's school time for me.I take out all my homework.School time is the same thing like a regular school.You have tests computers and even homework.Must of our circus performers are from all over the world so many of them speak other languages like French,Russian,and Mexican.The more we learn we improve.
2:16 p.m.House chores and practice.I feed,groom,water the horses that we use our horseback acts.My mom practices on leaping from trampoline onto the horse's back.Other kids are practicing acrobatics and juggling.A lady is walking panthers,and trainers are training chimpanzees,lamas,lions.
5:31 p.m Dinnertime.My companiens and I go eat at the pie car,but we don't eat much because we have to perform tonight.We do 10 shows a week,one each weekday,plus a afternoon show.
11:26 p.m.The show is over. I'm pooped.Walking back to our trailer,we pass the circus offices.Two days from now ,we're back to our home town.
1:00 a.m. Im in bed.I think that what on earth did I do.It would be nice to go back home to Racoon city.When I grow up do I still want to be a circus performer.Who even knows.The circus might be fun,buts a torcher.It's a tough life to put on with.
