   I wake up in the morning and watch the suns light hit my car.  Today was the big day.   All our practice in acrobatics  will finally come to use.  My name is  Bella Lindini.  Otherwise know to the croud "The Beauty of Italy " I work in an Italian traveling circus with my parents.  I am 11 years old . Today we were going to do the biggest show we had ever put on in my life time.  I had never done this big of an act.  Today we were going to go to america. I had never been to america in my life though my parents had been many times.  I started getting dressed slowly in to my outfit for the show we had practiced many times for this show.  we were performing in Los Angeles, California.  It was not at all like home. There were no forests just palm trees every where to be seen. there were no big neighborhoods just streets and big glass buildings.  The time change really got to me but I had been traveling in america for 6 months so i had gotten used to it.

      I got out of the car and went down to the pie car for some pasta with sauce.  " well you are up earily" said my mother behind me.  "Hello mama" i said. I could hear the tiredness in my voice.  I saw my mother was tired to.

     I finished my pasta and went down to the big top to pracitice my act. I did my flips onto the trapize and shaped my self into God knows what.  flipped myself off landed in the net bowed and jumped off.  I had anthor act to but i needed my partner who was not awake or was still at the pie car so I practiced that again. When I finished I turned to the floor and saw my partner.  " Lovely" he said finally.  "Gratzi" I said. I looked into his eyes and he nodded he knew i was asking him to practice we did our routine. I started on the trapize and did flips and turns then i hung by my feet and waited 5 seconds then I flipped back up and saw his reaching for mine.  

         I went on through out the day.  finally it was time for the show.  My feet were tingling.  I was nervous I was fine with doing the act ifront of  italians but i had never done this in front of americans.

       when I heard my name I went out I heard them speaking english yes i was fluent enough to under stand them bu t they spoke it so clearly that i had never heard something like that.  

I went up on the trapizeand did my solo act in the stiff dress that would hardly let me move.  twist turn twist turn i thought. then i jumped of did a flip in mid air and came down.  there was silence from the croud.   then they burst with clapping and shouts and hoots and hollers flowers were shooting tword me like bullets.  I bowed and climbed up the trapize again once i was on the trapize every one was silent i could hear crickets  then I began the act.  5,4,3,2,1 up i thought then i saw his hands and i was thrown into the air and then i landed on the ground with him behind me we bowed and went in they cheered louder than before and my eyes filled with tears i had done it I had made forien smiles.

The Amazing Circus                                                               

 

 

 

          I wake up in the morning at 7:00 A.M. and get dressed and I walk all the way to the pie car to eat pancakes and delicious bacon. I walk outside after eating and all the crews are setting up the tents, lights, and music for tonight's show.

 

9:00 A.M. is school time. Our schoolhouse travels with us. Like any other school ours has computers, tests, and report cards with grades. Because many of the performers are from all different places in the world many of my classmates speak different languages:French, Russian, and Italian like my family. As we travel around the different states in the country our geography becomes more and more alive.

 

         After those we have to do many,many more things throughout the hole entire rest of the day. After I groom my dog, feed, water, and groom the horses we use in our acts we take a break. The clowns let me play with their unicycles and and juggling balls. After all the rest of the jobs are done we get dressed and ready for tonight's show. After the show is over we all eat dinner then go to bed excited for tomorrow's show.

I was 4 years old when i started my life as a juggler.  For my birthday I got a juggling set and I was off juggling.  By the time I was 8 I was already juggling knifes.  One day I saw a sign on the door of a pub, new employees for the circus.  It said March 24, 2:00 at my local amusement park, Magic Mountain.  I told my mom and on that day she took me.  I performed last so I had a lot of pressure.  I went home very nervous and weeks later I got a letter that said I got the part.

 

  I had met all my performers that I would be working with and they told me I came right in time.  They said that we have a circus in a month.  I said great lets get practicing.  We had practiced and practiced until it was a week before. We had to drive to Maine so we needed to get going.  We got to Mine and got some sleep.  The next day was the performance.  We practiced all day until it was time for the show.

 

  We got to the theatre.  I was so nervous that I would mess up because it was my first show. The host announced now performing Ron Gooding.  It was gonna be my first time juggling with knifes on fire.  I got out there and the music started.  I started juggling.  I then walked on top of the tight rope and started walking on it and juggling the knifes.  But then I fell.  Luckily there was a net but the knife went in to my eye.

 

I got rushed to the hospital but it was to lated the docter had told me that i needed a glass eye.

My name is Lucas and I joined the circus 5 years ago. It is very hard work. I have been working all day preparing for the show. First I ate breakfast, then I had to feed the animals, and then I had to practice.

 

 It's almost time for the show to start and we have been practicing for the past 2 hours. I will be doing a trapeze act. The announcer is getting ready to say my name. "Now, for our trapeze act!" I step out and start to climb the ladder. At the top start to feel nervous.

I feel like I'm going to fall. I grab my swing. My partner grabs theirs and we both jump. I did a flip and my partner grabbed me. The crowd is cheering when we get to the other side!

 

 After the show my parents come and congradulate me. After a long days work I go to the pie car for dinner. Back at my car I get ready for bed. I think about today's show and feel happy. But tomorrow I'll have to do it all again.

You have to be determined, you have to now you want to be in the circus. You also have to study hard to get into the circus but not like study in school, you have to study acting and do a bunch of performances when your a kid.   The circus is a great place to go get a laugh or hang out with your friends and watch a show, it is also is a place to see amazing tricks. "Ready.Set.Go!" Yelled my trainer. You see, I am a trapeze artist who is practicing for the big show tonight. I work hard for every show to make sure I do it just right. As I am back stage practicing my act, I can see all of the other circus performers practicing their act. Being in the circus is fun, but it's lots of hard work. You always need to practice, know what you're doing, and you have to have a certain talent. You can't just learn it! So, if you keep on reading you'll find out I what mean.

                   When you are practicing you have to know what your doing and how you are going to perform it. Are you going to  have a partner? Or are you doing a solo act? These may soud like easy questions but when you're a circus performer these are very inportant questions. Then when you have it figured out you have to practice for hours a day. You have to keep going over and over and over your routine until you know it's perfect. Then when you are positive you're ready you wait until the everyone else ready then you put on the show.

               Now that you know what it means to practice for the show, let's talk about the fun part. As soon as you step foot on stage you get this amazing feeling inside. It's definitely a rush! You see all of those cheerful faces in the fantastic audience and you know they're all watching you and know you'll put on a great show. You want to have a great show too. But in order to do that you have to remember every step of your act. You are for going to feel nervous but then the music starts and when you do the first move of your act it comes to naturally and are no longer nervous about doing it. In fact you feel like your just at home messing around with equipment. You hardly notice the crowd. but when you finish your act, you see all the smiles and you put a smile on your face, take a bow, and make room for the next performer.

           Now that you've heard about the hard work and the fun it's about time you know the schedule. At 8:00.a.m. you go the pie car. That's where all of us circus performers eat. At around 9:00 we head over to the circus arena. We all practice there until about 12:00. Soon after that we put on our costumes, get hair and make-up done, then practice some more until it's our turn to go up. Soon after we put on new costumes and give the crowd a grand finally. After the show is over we wait until  the next show and are to do it all over again.

               So that's what's it like to be a circus performer. It's lot's of hard work but it all pays off in the end. Lot's of people may think it's we just figure it out and have fun with it but it's not. Even professionals need training. So next time you go see a circus think about how hard they worked to make it perfect. Then ask yourself this question,"Do I really want to become a circus performer?"

People who think life in a circus is awsome and fun well your right but this is how much you need to do in order to become a real  circus member. The Circus Surprise

     

     My parents left me a farmers market when I was two. I had no where to go I kept calling for them, but they would never come. Then the unspeakable happened, Some one found me! He nursed me to a three year old baby, then he explained to me the way I was saved and told me his name(Voric Oglar). As I got older Voric noticed my muscles starting to grow. By the time I was eight I could lift a horse.

    

     Then Voric mentioned the circus, I knew what it was because my old parents used to work their. I said I would love to go to the circus, so we did. When we got their I saw tall people, short people, hairy people, and magic people. We got to the end of the line to sign up, and he said,"State you talent and your name". I said my talent is strength, and my name is George Wringling. The man stopped and said,"hold on just a little bit" and left the booth and entered the circus tent.

    

     The man from the booth came back and said,"George meet Mr. and Mrs. Wringling.

Then everything went silent so quiet you could hear a pin drop a pin in confusion, and hatered all circling around that one day they left me. Then it went back to normal. "We're sorry", the Wringling's said. "Their's nothing to be sorry about. You left me that day I don't know why but you did, and you can't be forgiven," I said.

   

     "We can explain", they said. It all started the day at that farmers market. We put you in your baby stroller. Before we left, you fell out, but we didn't know you did until we left and got back to our tent. We came back as soon as possible but then you were gone. "I guess it's resolved then," I said. "Now we're a family," The Wringlings said? "Now we're a family,"I said!

Hi my name is Jeffery Lienes. I am a elephant traner for the Salt Lake City circus. I am the traner for an elephant named Bungo. One day there was a terible accident that happend. This accedint involved Bungo and a very rude citizen. It was my first day on the job and I was out practicing when I was hit straight in the face.

 

     It was a peanut! a peanut, then I heard some laughing in the stands. I looked up and saw a dad and a kid sitting there and laughing at me. The next thing I know the security comes and takes them away. I think to my self how rude that was.

 

     then I hear some yelling coming from the security. next thing I know the dad and kid are in the same spot doing the same thing. Throwing peanuts at me and laughing. then I yelled and said security get these people out of here. The next thing I know I hear what sonds like a gun shot. Boom!

 

      The kid has just been shot! what the heck is going on shouts another person whating for the show to start. Then Bungo starts getting scared. It is not good when Bungo gets scared because as you may know elephants are 20 times bigger than humans, and can do a lot of damage to a helpless citezen. then some of the other elephants start to get scared. the next thing I know Bungo is charging full speed at the stands.

 

     Then the worst thing possible happens the rest of the crowd starts going bonkers. They are screaming, yelling, and shouting at each other to move out of the way. Then I hear it. CRASH!! The whole group of people over by the stands where the dad and kid were start screaming and crying in pain. The police come and they are forced to tranculize the elephant so that no one else gets heart.

 

      And that my freinds is my story.

                                        

 

                                                   The End

Hi my name is Angela, I am a trapeze artist in the Wonder Circus. Right now myself and the rest of the crews and performers are pulling into our next location for our show!

  Now, that I can start my fun I get out my leatard and big box of makeup. First,I need to of course get on my outfit so later I won't mess up my makeup. Then, when I finish with my outfit I first need to put on my powder pink blush and my aqua mascera. Next, I put on the purple eyeliner, navy eyeshadow, and best of all my favroite light pink lipstick.

  Once, I'm done I head to the pie car for a light dinner. So, once I reach the car everybody is already there talking and eating dinner. Then, when I get my food and start chowing down the food everybody is gone.

Circus Life

       My name is Aaron Rodgers. My family and I travel 20,000 miles in 7 months each year, visiting 150 cities. We work from sunup to sundown. Circus life is fun.

       I wake up at 7:00 A.M.I go to the pie car for pancakes and bacon.Then we get ready for tonight's show by setting up tents, lights, and music. I schedule my day out. I go to school at 9:00 A.M. School ends at 3:00 P.M. From 3:00 to 3:30 I have a break.At 3:30 I do chores and practice. One of the things I am trying to master is leaping from a trampoline onto a horse's back.

       Then, at 6:30 P.M. it's dinnertime.Our family does 10 shows a week. The show ends at 10:30. I get to bed at midnight. I am exhausted from the hard days work.

        If you want to join the circus you need to have a specific talent, the right body type, and be very determined. You have to concentrate on dancing and performing. One good thing about being in the circus is that you get to travel around the world. One bad thing about it is that you miss your family.
The circus is a hard job you have to feed and take care of the animals and you have to practice running a circu would be a very hard job.

A Wish Come True

                                                                   by Nerveen Gerges

   

There is an eleven year old girl named Crystal Levine. She was very flexible and nice she also had a kind of spark to her face that made her look both pretty and mysterious at the same time. She has always wanted to visit the circus but her parents never let her because they didnt want her to be influenced and grow up to be a circus clown. They wanted her to have a nice and educated life so she could grow up to be a doctor.

     

       One day on her way home from school she saw a flyer taped to a post lamp. She couldn't believe her  eyes . It was a flyer that said there was a circus coming to the town of Buckross. That was the town she lived in . Right away ideas started flowing to her mind and she began thinking of ways she could go to the circus without her parents knowing . She ripped the flyer off the lamp and read the words printed in a small font at the bottom: Saturday October 18. Five dollars to get in she had 15 in savings.Later that day she went up to her room and started writing down the possibilities. That's it! She finally figured it out after after almost an hour. She looked at the flyer one more time it starts at 2:30. She would tell her parents that she had to go to study at that time until 7:30.

       

      Saturday morning finally came she told her parents at 1:45 until  that she was going to meet her friend at the library for a study session. They agreed and asked if she needed a ride. She reasoned with them until they agreed to let her ride her bike there. She almost forgot her back pack because if she went without it her parents would become suspicous  so she emptied out her back pack and got out her water bottle and some snacks. When she got there,there was a big man at the trailer door . She gave him 5 dollars and he let her in. She saw amazing stunts , acrobats, silly clowns, crazy jugglers, and even circus horses . The time got away from her as she watched with all her interest.

       When she looked at her watch it was 6:45. Oh no! She told her parents that she would be home at 6:15 . She rushed home and and when she walked in her parents were sitting in the guest room waiting for her. They were very upset that she was late. They sent her to her room in anger. When she got to her room the guilt was eating at her gut. She went  downstairs and spilled her guts to her parents . She apologized as they stared at her in dissapointment and surprise. She felt terrible but better that she had told them everything. They gave her the same old speach and sent her up . She felt bad . But when she went to bed that night she dreamed that she was one of those acrobats swinging by ropes feeling as if she was flying happily.

One day, a person named  Saul found out that he wanted to be in the circus.  Saul knew that he had to go to circus school  and travel world wide and wake up early. So, he trained himself as hard as he could and when he went to join the circus of his dreams.They rejected him. Saul was sad, but then a person got fired from the circus and left mad. Saul heard the news and went to try it out to see if they wanted him. And they did. Saul was so happy and said"This is the happiest day of my life"! And so, Saul became famous and  more people started coming to see him more than the one that didn't except him.

 

   They walked over to him and begged for him and Saul said "You rejected me thought I was garbage and you think that I'm gonna go with  you guys?  How pathetic.  Noway I'm going with you guys.And so, they left all sad." Saul was feeling great that he told  the people  that didn't except him.He knew that his dream has come true and that  he must've been the greatest entertainer in the world. This was  his time and knew that he had to take a break.

 

      Now, Saul is retired from the circus, but now owns the one he used to work for.  He still makes a lot of money today and lives in Ontario, California. People still enjoy the circus even though Saul doesn't work as a entertainer.But they are glad that he took over as the owner of the circus he used to work for.  The circus though go nationwide it just stays in Ontario.  He might even make other circus's look cheap around the world.

 

      Saul has inspired other people to join the circus.  Everybody around the world has been inspired by him. In Japan, China, Russia, Europe, Spain, and Germany. Saul, was so famous that when he was a  entertainer they showed it on tv everywhere. Thats why people know him around the world.  Saul, still to people everywhere around the world  is the best entertainer in the world.

One day there was a man named Danny Powel.  Danny worked at a circus and enjoyed working there.  He was an acrobat.  But he wasn't just any acrobat, he was a daring acrobat.  He does the most frightening stunts as an acrobat.

 

Danny desided he would do the most impossible stunt ever at tonights act.  Jumping off a tower it the circus and grabbing a rope upsidown in middair then jumping off the rope and do a tripple twirl in middair into a mini pool.  Later, it was time for his act.  He was ready like always.  He jumped and...

 

He has succeded with his epic stunt.  And broken a world record.  The next day he looked in the world record book of 2013.  It showed "Most daring man Danny Powel."

This circus is great. I just saw Bob the clown juggle 8 balls. The horses just jumped up in the air, right before the elephants walked in. The elephants were dark gray and they had enormous ears. Then all of a sudden some of the acrobats swung across each other and they did the most amazing tricks. Some of the tricks were spinning in mid air and doing flips.

     Then Bob the clown started juggling 10 balls. The acrobats caught them then started juggling them then they would grab the rope again. Then one man started walking on a tight rope. He was wearing a suit and he had a top hat. There were trains going around the building. This was an amazing circus.

Life as a circus performer is very hard work. I have to wake up at seven in the morning and go to school at nine and it ends at three. At three thirty I have to do chores and thakr care of the horses. I am in the progress of learning new tricks. My family is in the circus too. It is a family buisiness.

 

  The show starts at seven and ends at ten. I am always tired after shows. I go to bed at twelve and think about the circus life. I think to myself, 'Why is this life to hard? It is a fun life and I'm tired so I am going to go to sleep.'. So i went to sleep.

 

  I never thought I would be a circus performer. I was always the normal kid in school. How did this happen?I have always loved the circus that came to town twice a year. I just found out my uncle was a performer so I asked if i could join it, he asked his boss. After a day of waiting he said I could be in it! That was a long time ago though.

 

  The good thing about the circus is that I get to travel around the world and sometimes see my friends at shows! I love how people look at me and say I am good at my job. I have learne to tell when people are impressed.

 

  The bad thing about being in the circus is that it is very hard work! I travel alot and I am never home to see my other family. I work long days and I cant take a break or I won't be ready to perform. I have to work on weekends too, but this life is fun because some people do funny acts and it makes me laugh!

I am in the cuicus I am the balancer I balance on a rope if I fall there is no net under me so if I fall it will hurt so I have a show later so it is time to eat we are having steak and green beans so it is time to go on  I made it the first time thhe second time I made it and it was it was time for bbed I am wiped out I went to sleep and I woke up the next morning it was time to eat breakfast ten practice my routine i practice different today I used a unicycle and I made it it was not that hard I did it again and I made it it was fifteen minutes till show time I had to get ready and I am going to do somthing awesome I will do this the third time frontflips on the way over backflips on the way back now iI did it regular the first time I did the unicycle the second time and I started I made it with the frontflips now for the backflips I made it and everyone went crazy they where cheering my namethey wanted me to do it again even the first one than the second one then the last one and I made it again but it was time to stop the show I was pooped time for bed and we are some where eles it was time to go practice my act and there was twenty minutes till show time I ate and I practice for the show and I just did the last act thin went to bed the end.

"Get up everyone"!  Maris and I are the trapeze artist when we wake up wer have to eat breakfast and then we all have to go and practice our trapeze skills.  We jump on trampolines until the horses came then we had to jump on the backs of the horses.Then we all head back to the pie trailer to have dinner but we don't eat much because the show is tonight. The show is about to start we rush back to our trailers to get ready I had this amazing costume on Maris had on this beutiful costume same as mine she looked prettier though.We are all gasping for breath this is the best moment of my life.

 

 

 When we get back to the trailer we are so tired  we just fall down right there and go to sleep.

"Get up everyone!", that is the normal sound I hear every morning. Life in the circus can have the upsides and its downsides. My trailor is medium size and its taken good care of. I get up each morning throw on some sweat and a t-shirt and head down to the pie car where we all eat. I sit at the table with all of my friends and watch the crew all set up for tonights performance. Me and my friends all talk about tonights performance. We get two hours to eat then we have to go to the schoolhouse. It's like any other school, we have computers, tests, and report cards. All through class I was thinking about tonights performance. We are in Austrailia tonight and it has been my dream to perform here ever since I joined the circus. As soon as I knew it class was over and we all left the schoolhouse. This is the time where me and mt friends have a fun time.

 

     Sam, Emily, and me all run out and go play with the performers before we have to practice. We play with the juggling balls, the unicycle, which I am terrible at, and we play with the elephants. We all run over to the horses and feed them. I am in all the horse acts with Emily. Sam gets to go on the high blance beam. We all say goodbye and go practice. We all had to get ready for the big performance tonight.

 

 

     Me and Emily are on the trampolines practicing our flips when the horses come over. We jump fromm the trampoline onto the horses back, we have to be concentrated and worry about our balance. We all tired after that! Me and Emily walk over to Sam where she is practicing her acrobatics. She is the best at them. We all decided that we should eat dinner together and get pumped up for the big show.

 

 

     We all had to rush back to our trailors after dinner and get ready. The show was getting ready to start, this is my dream coming true. I knew my family was out in the crowd supporting me. The time came is was out performing. The best part is I get to perform with my best friend. I just feel like I am in a different world. That was the best feeling ever.

 

 

Tonights show was the best! I am wiped out though. I walked back to my trailor slowly. I took off my costumes and got on my pjs. I sat there thinking about the performance and how it was the best! I sat there thinking about my family until sleep came over me.

The best part of being in the circus having fun while others are to. I am the clown in the circus. My friends are clowns to. We get to travel all over the country.

In our circus we have acrobats. We also have tight rope walkers,circus horses to. We have a ferris wheel and other rides. We sell drinks and food.

I love the circus do you. I hope you can come see us some time

Hello, my name is Leah Stalwarts. I am in the circus, and it vary fun and exciting. The crew is like my family, my family lives in Idaho. I see them every few mouths and sometimes they will come and watch me preform. I am 21 years old, I finished school and went to collage for about 2 and a half years. Then i found out that I could do so much more. I bet your wondering why I just dident finish collage right? He made me train for 2 years before he would let me preform. So I worked long and hard before I could do what I really wanted and thats the tightrope. One of the haredset things known to man, walking on a thin long line was just as bout as close to impossible as you can get. After three long years I was able to pro forum.

 

 As a circus prefourmer there's not a time that im not busy. Hers my morning routine-

 


feed lions at 6:00 am.
practice from 6:30 to 7:30 am.
clean cages at 8:30am
hang and make posters for are next show at 9:00am.

give all 5 show dogs a bath at 10:00 am

 

Every has there part. You have to do your chores like every other house hold only ares are a little bit more extreme.

 

 We have a show every other mouth and in every mouth is a different place. We travel all across the world finding good spots to hold are circus.

 

 Well that's just a small part of my big everyday life. As you can see we do a lot around here. We are always busy but we always have fun.

Life as a circus actor isn't all playing around and fun there are many things you have to do. Just like sports you have to pratice over and over and do the same thing in the circus. You start off with eating breakfest while your crew sets up things such as lights, and music for the upcoming show.

 

                   After finishing up eating breakfest you will go to school, like any other school you have test, computers, and report cards. Many of your classmates may speak different languages you haven't heard because people come from all over the world. Your classmates may speak languages such as Italian, German, French, and spanish.

                  

                    When school is over you get a quick break many people may start doing differnt things like juggle balls. Clowns might even ride their unicycles.

 

                     Once it's almost time to start people practice or do chores. The trainer will feed, water, and groom all the animals for the act. While the trainer does that everyone else will be practicing what they will do at the act.

 

                       Just a few hours away from the act people go to the pie car to eat dinner, since they are going to preforming that night most of them don't eat much. Some circuses will do usually 10 shows in one single week.

 

                       Finally when the show is over everyone is tired and start to walk toward their trailer to go to sleep as they pass by they see the circus offices, concession stands, and stables.

  

                       While this must sound fun they must continue on their tour without their family with them to support them and talk to them. So life as a circus actor isn't as easy as you think.

    Hi my name is Maison, and I am going to tell you everything I know about the circus. First thing you should know is that your going to wake up at 7:00 A.M.,and get ready for breakfest.After breakfest your going to go help the crew set up the tents,lights, and music for tonight's show. 9:00 A.M. is school time. Theirs a one-room schoolhouse travels with you. Like any school, it has computers, test,and report cards.

Because the circus performers are from all over the world, many of the classmates speak other languages: French, Russian, and Italian.As you travel around the country, the geography lessons come alive. 3:00 P.M. school is over time for quik break. 3:30 P.M. dinnertime. your also going to do 10 shows a week: one each weekend , plus afternoon show on Wednesday, two on Saturday, and two on Sunday.10:30 P.M. The show is over.12:00 A.M. In bed.

 

As you can see, that the circus is fun, but it's a busy and tough life.

I don't like circus clown because they look ugly and do crazy. But I like view of circus,  like circus horses, circus tightrope walker, circus juggler,and circus acrobats

My Life in the Circus    

 

 

     8:30 am I wake up, get dressed, and then go to my kitchen and make myself something to eat like: eggs, pancakes, or sometimes bacon. Next, I will go to the circus and get things ready so the circus crew can practice all their routines for the show.    

   

  10:00 am I will go to school. The school I go to is not a regular school. This school that travels with us for everyone who needs to be at school and is in the circus. Many of my classmates speak a lot of different languages like: Italian, Russian, and Spanish like my family.  

    

    3:30 pm School is over. Then, I will start heading to the circus and start practicing my juggling and acrobats. I really like my routines. They are so fun. But sometimes they are scary because I feel like I am going to fall.     

   

   5:00 pm I will come home and eat dinner. I eat dinner with my family. Sometimes my family and I eat food like: hamburgers, tacos, and chicken. But we do not eat so much because we are performing. If we eat a lot on the night we are performing we might have an accident during the show. We do 5 shows a week: one Monday, Wednesday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.  

    

     9:30 pm The show is over. I`m really tired. My family and I are going home. Two days from now we will have another show. Now I am home. I`m in bed thinking about my next show. I can`t wait until my next show. I really like my shows. They are really fun because I like to practice my juggling and acrobats.  

 

    10:00 pm I`m trying to go to sleep. But still thinking about when the tour is over. When our tour is over we will go back to our regular home in Hemet CA. When I grow up, will I still be a circus performer? Who knows? The circus is fun but tough.

The life of a circus preformer

 

                                              By: Byron J. Guillot

 

                   

     George was 11 years old, and wanted to be a circus preformer when he grew up. He had talent and confidence, and knew he could do it some day. George could do flips and jumps like never before. He was simply a dare-devil. He was a very brave boy with very good reflexes. He saw a flier that read, " We are looking for people with great talent that is confident and brave enough to be shot out of a canon! Join the circus today!" George kept the flier for years and years.

 

     Years later, George was eighteen years old. He was at his beautiful, new house, unpacking the last box. When he unpacked that box, he saw the same flier that he had kept since he was 11. He had just remembered that he wanted to be a circus preformer. He went to the new contest to join, and showed his skills and bravery!

 

     A week later, he got a note reading, "Congrats! You won the contest to join the circus! Come to the same place as you did last time for the show tomorrow night. See you there!" George was very happy to hear this news, since it has been his dream for years! He finally got to his goal in life! George always knew that he had what it takes!

 

     The night of the circus, George had to sign a contract in order to preform. When he went into the stadium, he was a little nervous. He was mostly amazed of all of the obsticals and animals. He warmed up and went into the stadium on a tight rope! When he got down from the rope, he got launched out of a canon, and hung his feet on the bars connected to the ceiling. George landed on an elephant, and rode it out of the stadium.

 

     After the show, George was wiped out! He went into a trailor to sleep in while he is changing into pajamas and sleeping there. George knew that the show was great, and it amazed the crowd of people! He had a dream about what will happen in the next show.

 

    

 

     In the morning, George felt great. He went to the pie car for eggs and bacon. He also had orange juice to drink, because he didn't want to drink soda for breakfast. George was exited to go to the next show in Louisiana! It was far, but worth the long wait. He was just so exited about it though.

 

     That night, he arrived in New Orleans, Louisiana. Another clown told George that they would be in a parade for Mardi Gras! He knew that Mardi Gras was a big holiday in the whole state! Alot of people were there for the parade to start. George was throwing necklaces and dabloons into the crowds from a float. After that, he started doing backflips in the very top of it! The parade was over, and George was even more tired than the last show. He did the same thing as he did at the end of the last show, and in the morning.

 

     After George ate breakfast, he was ready to go back home for a while. When he got home, he was happy to have a job as a circus preformer, and loved it! He was wore out after every show, but he didn't care. The only thing he really cared about is accomplishing his dreams.

Life in the Circus

 

           I live in a trailor with my family, and others from the circus. in the mornings I do Just what any ordinary 10 year old girl may do. But overall my life is not ordinary!

           Every morning when I wake up, I eat breakfeast, and get dressed to go to school. But I don't go to a reagular school. We have a one room school house in our trailer. That's where I go to school. Like any normal school we take test, and have grades, and report cards' and all that stuff. But unlike other schools ours is of course only one room, and it travels with us on the trailer. Also many of my classmates speak a forien language.

         When school is over insted of going straight to homework, and chores like a normal girl would do I actually get a short break. During my break I juggle, and ride unicycles.

          But, after that I have to do my chores. Some of my chores are things like taking care of the circus animals, and  helping get ready for our next show.

           Once I am finished with my chores it is dinnner time. We must eat lightly or we will be to full to perform. Once we are finished we head down to tonights show.

            I am exited tok watch the show, and know that someday I will be a part of that. But I am also exited to come home and get some sleep. Living life in the circus is both complecated and exiting. I hope that some day you will live your dream just like I am mine.

Jasper The Elephant

                                   By: Jasper Keefauver

 

 

            I am Jasper the elephant.  Before the show starts and after the show,they let people ride on my back.  In the show I do a special trick, me and my fellow elephants stand up on our hind legs and balance a ball on our trunk and toss it to another elephant,until we get our ball back.  Another trick we do is stick our trunks into a bucket of water and stand on our hind legs and SQUIRT WATER EVERY WHERE.

 

 

 

           After the circus is over we load up and go to bed and we are at another city by the morning.We practice in the morning and all the way to when the show is about to start and people start to pile in.  I always want to make the little kids smile and be happy.

 

 

 

  We just love to make every body happy. I love what I do as an  elaphant.  Otherwise, I would be in Africa doing nothing not making anybody smile or laugh.  I would just be an elaphant.

Being a circus performer isn't an easy life. It actually is vary hard.You need to be good at a ton of things to be in the circus.You have to travel from place to place every few days, you have to practice a lot, and you have to every stunt well or else the crowd might leave the show.There are upsides and downsides.

   Getting started as a clown isn't as easy as you think. You have to be determined and be in good shape. You also have to be good at performing and doing whatever you are asked to do.

   Some upsides are that you get to travel the world performing circus acts. Some downsides are that you have to practice a lot, you spend a lot of time away from home, and you have to work long days.

   It takes a lot of skill to be in the circus. You have to be good at doing lots of things. Plus you get to travel the world performing.

Being a circus performer isn't easy to do.

Calypso

This is a story about a black, talented, and sweet horse who grew up in the Circus and became the star of the show.

                            Hello I'm Calypso, an Arabian Circus horse born with an attitude. When I came into the world it was in the middle of the Circus. My mother who was pregnant had such cruel care givers that they didn't notice that she was pregnant until in the middle of a show she gave birth to me. Some little 11 year old girl ran from the stands and helped my mother with everything. Now that little girl is my owner and she is not so little anymore. She is now 22 and her name is Brooklyn. Brooklyn and I are the stars of the show in the Barnum and Bailey Circus. Our signature move is when Brooklyn is standing on my back while I'm loping and I jump a 5 ft fire lit pole and we make it every time because we trust eachother so much. When she is on me she becomes part of me. It is just so magnificent. Well anyway today we were doing our signature trick and the pole was not balanced right so the pole fell right of when I jumped over. Before we knew it the whole tent was on fire. Brooklyn ran me outside and when everyone else ran all over the place  Brooklyn called the Fire Depatment. Then she ran back into the tent and sprinted back out with as many animals or animal halters with an animal atached to the end as she could. She raced in and out until everyone and every animal was out of the burning tent. She went in to take one last look around and thats when a beam that held the tent up fell directly on her. She was screaming for help. I raced in there as fast as I could and pushed and pushed until the beam was off Brooklyn. Then I helped hr onto my back and carried her all the way to the hospital. She turned out all right but if I had not gotten the beam off of her that fast she would of died. When we got back to the Circus the fire was put out and I was known as the horse her saved her owners life.

 

                                       The End

The Jiggly-Doo Circus

 

Bella Wakefield just woke up after a long, tiring day. She had

just started the circus life. Bella woke up to the loud noise of horses running around. She had slept at the Jiggly-Doo Circus! Bella quickly went to the trailer, changed her clothes, and did her hair. She was ready to practice at the Jiggly-Doo Circus. Her father was training the lions to jump through a ring of fire. Her mother was doing gymnastics. Bella's job was to do tricks on a horse.

 

 

The next circus show was going to start in a couple of hours.

All of the performers were practicing their hardest because the mayor of the town was going to watch. It was very loud in the Jiggly-Doo Circus because all the performers were there. Bella was so nervous that she did not even feel like practicing. It was hard to work in a circus, for Bella, because none of her friends were with her. She did not have anyone to talk to nor did she have anyone to play with.

 

The circus was going to start in a couple of minutes. The circus

manager came in with a worried look on his face. "Bella Wakefield, you're going to have to walk on the tightrope. Our tightrope walker went home, sick." Bella wanted to burst into tears because she did not know how to walk on a tightrope. Finally, her father said," Don't worry, Bella. If you think you can do it, you know you can do it." Bella was comforted by this and stood headstrong. The Jiggly-Doo Circus was off to a great start. The host, Jim West, welcomed everybody with a warm smile. Bella was going to walk on the tightrope.

Juggle had used his knives as a spear for rats.  Bob snatched the knives and told the others what happened. that night st the circus, Bob was able to juggle again.

My Circus Life

       

        Hello, my name is Miranda Gomez. I work in the amazing circus called THE EXTRAVAGANZA. I started working there when I was only a little girl. People may think that working in a circus is fun, and that you get to play around all the time. But no, it's not like that. If you want to be in a circus, remember there is a whole lot of work ahead of you. But at the same time, it is not torture.

                

        Everyday, I wake up at 7:00 A.M. I get ready, and go to the pie car for breakfast. Today is the big show, so the crew is getting everything ready. Then, at 9:00 A.M. it's school time. We have a tiny one-room schoolhouse that travels with us. We have all the advantages that a normal school would have such as, computer, tests, report cards, etc. My classmates are from all over the world, so we experience many different languages. As we travel around the country, our geography lessons come alive.

 

        At 3:00, school is finally over. I get to play with my little dog, Brownie. We are not allowed to keep big dogs because of our miniature trailer. Later, at 3:30 P.M. I do my chores like, grooming, feeding the animals for tonight's show. My parents are practicing their solo act. My dad is going to somersault off a running horse, and my mom is going to walk a tightrope. I am going to train animals to do tricks. At 6:30, we eat our dinner. Finally, it is time for the show!

 

        It is 10:45, and the show is over. I am exhausted. Then, at 12:00, I am ready to sleep. Every show night, I go to sleep thinking that two days from now I will have to do another show.

 

        As you can see, my life is not only fun, but tough. My life is a circus!

The Life of a Circus Performer

       

 

              I hear the claps and cheers from the crowd as I finish jumping through the hoop of fire. I am Emma, the tightrope walker. As a circus performer, we do many different jobs. For example, you may be wondering, why is a tightrope walker jumping through a hoop of fire? Well, that is why I am going to take you on a journey to see what a circus performer does and how I got interested in being one.

 

              First, in a circus, you have to be and early bird because we sleep at  12:00 and we have to wake up at 7:00. In a typical day, I go to the pie car, go to school, have some free time, have dinner, and have a circus performance. After all my shows I am wiped out! As a tightrope walker, it takes a lot of balance and concentration, so I have to practice five hours everyday!

 

              Next, let me tell you how I got interested in being a  tightrope walker. When I was young, I had a habit of balancing myself and walking on the terrace. My whole family performed in circuses, but I was too young to start performing. But, when the day came, I showed the crowd what my talent was, walking on a tightrope. Later, it was said, I was going to be the tightrope walker for all my shows.

 

             Lastly, as I got older, my dad told me that I was old enough to do different stunts, not only the tightrope walk. You may be wondering, is'nt it hard doing different performances at once? Yes, it is very hard, but being in the circus meant a lot of training and I wanted to win my dream and be a circus performer. There are many ups and downs of being a circus performer, but I don't want to let down my family and quit the circus.

 

             Today is my last show and I want to show the world who I really am. Today, I am walking on the tightrope, getting shot out of a canon, and jumping through a hoop of fire. As I walk on the tightrope step by step, I see the crowd staring at me in astoshment as I jumping off the tightrope and land perfectly in the canon. I get shot and make an amazing flip through the hoop of fire. I was the star of the show. As you can see, being a circus performer means a lot of hard work in order to accomplish your goals.

The Circus Mystery

 

     Glurp Glurp Glurp. The pie car doesn't have the best food, but it is the best you will get around here. I then heard a scream when I was in the middle of biting my bacon. I ran to the tent to see our show host looking at the broken leopard cage. I then saw a shade of blue on the lock. All of the circus performers then walked out of the tent to find the leopard. I then met up with my close friend Puly, which is his obvious nickname. He is always bugging me about not having a pet and always about his nails. This might seem odd, but his favorite hobby is painting his nails blue. He paints a different shade every day. Other than that, he is a pretty cool person.

 

     We were both looking for the leopard together, but he wasn't that worried or paying much attention. But whenever i got near his trailer, he would wonder off another way as if he didn't want me near his trailer. I probably figured it was because that was where he kept his nail polish stashed. And since he is always braging about it, he might think that I am jealous and I want some. That's when I relized were the leopard went. God, icould notice that shade of blue any where by now. I felt dumb not knowing that it was him.

 

     I then aproached Puly and dragged him to his trailer and kicked the door open. The leopard was found.

The Circus Boy

         There once was a very poor boy. He had no money and didn't have any parents. One day while he was begging for money and food, he saw a poster. The poster said that the circus needed one more person to start performing. The boy was excited about the offer, but he was also worried. He always wanted to be a juggler, but he couldn't juggle.

         Then he decided to go to the circus and see how the professionals juggled. He took two bottles from the dumpster and decided to juggle the way the professional did. It was very hard and he couldn't keep the bottles in the air for ten seconds. He tried again and again, but couldn't seem to improve. He wanted to quit, but he would rather keep trying than go back to the dumpster. He practiced in the circus for weeks and weeks. Finally he got the hang of two bottles and then started adding more. After a month of practicing, he decided to juggle in the circus. He went to the circus owner and showed him how he could juggle. He was very tensed and couldn't keep the bottles in the air.

         Then he decided to leave when the owner said that he could be a clown. That seemed to be a good idea at that time. He messed up a lot, but that was what made that funny. He was hired to be a clown and, if he could improve juggling, he could be a juggler too.

          It was the day to perform everybody was waiting for my tricks, and it was very funny.

          These days, you can still see him in the circus. He is a famous juggler and a clown. He sometimes says that life in the circus is hard, but he likes it a lot better than the dumpster.

It is 7:00 A.M. I wake up rubbing my eyes. I looked around. I was in my trailer. You see, I work at a circus and we constantly travel. So, we live in these. A thought was nagging me at the back of my mind. I knew it was important, but I just couldn't place it.

 

     Suddenly, my mom, in her acrobat's suit jumped into my room. "Get up, you need to have a good breakfast, so you will energy to parctice for tonight!" Tonight, I thought. What was tonight? But, I sat up groggily and changed out of my pajamas.

 

     I went to the pie car and grabbed a bagel. I ate it slowly, still not fully awake. After that I went to school. Today, I had a test. Was that what I forgot? No, my mom said tonight.

 

     At 3:30 I went to take care of and train the animals. I saw my friend Annie waiting or me. We both trained the animals but I had to do the acts on stage. "I suppose you know what to do for tonight," she said. There it was again. Tonight.  What was so important that happened tonight? "Uh, I guess so," I replied. I started handing out meat for the tigers. They ate happily.

 

     At dinner everyone was a little nervous.They didn't eat much. But I took a baked potato and slice of pizza with fries on the side. I sat down at the table my mom was sitting at. "Why are you eating so much?" she asked. "Is there something wrong with that?" I wondered. "Yes, tonight is the biggest show of the year." she hissed. I gasped. How could I forget that? I only ate my slice of pizza and ran off to practice even more.

 

    Before I knew it, show time came. I ran on to the stage for my part and did my acts: jumping from a diving board, twirling in the air, and landing on a circus elephant. I did it. The crowd roared in approval. After that everyone clapped me on the back saying I did great. I was a little uncomfortable with all the attentinon, but I was still glad. The day had ended on a happy note.

Hi, I'm Christine, and I am a circus performer. I joined the circus when I was eight, and now I am ten. I haven't been home in a long time, and I really miss my family. But sometimes, when I am performing, I know my family is watching me on T.V. But on the bright side, I have made many good friends in the circus. My life is busy, busy, busy. We visit a lot of cities every week to perform. The act I am now learning is very dangerous. I am practicing how to juggle knives.

 

I have always wanted to be on a basketball team, but we don't have time. We do have school though, our classroom is full of people who speaks languages that I don't understand because, they are different people from around the world. It is really fun to travel as we can really see what the teacher was talking about in the geography lesson.

 

Becoming a circus performer takes a lot of practice and skill. Everybody has always asked me, "What did you always want to do in a circus?" I would always reply, "A circus acrobat."

"Honk!" What is that sound? It's an elephant of course. We are

at a circus after all. My name is Emily Johnson , and my family is at the circus. It will be in our town for the next three days. When my brother, David, and I found out that we were going to the circus, we were both ecstatic. In fact, I want to be a circus performer when I grow up. We got into the car and drove until we reached the circus. Once we are inside, we sit down in our seats and wait for the performance to start. It is noisy , and everyone is anxious to see the trapeze artists, the acrobats, and all of the animals.

At last, the performance begins, and everyone is suddenly

silent. The music starts and we see the animals start to file out. There are elephants, horses, monkeys, and many more. They are all doing tricks with their trainers. We all watch in awe as the trapeze artists and tightrope walkers start their peformance. Next come the acrobats. It must take balance, hard work, and concentration to be a circus performer. Before I know it, the performance is over.

We are led to the back where we are informed that we have the

lucky seat numbers and that we are allowed to meet the circus performers. Because I am interested the most by the tightrope walkers, I ask to meet them. When I ask them how they decided to become a circus performer, one replies. "I knew that I wanted to be a performer at a young age. You just have to go for it and give everything else up." she says. "Is it fun to travel around a lot?" I ask. "Yes, because we get to travel the world, go to so many places, and meet different people that all enjoy watching us perform. However, we sometimes miss our family and our home. When we are performing we have to move constantly. We also work from sunup to sundown." another circus performer says.

Before, I wanted to be a circus performer when I grew up. Now,

I know that circus life is fun but also has its downsides. They experience the joy of performing in front of a live audience, and get to travel to many places, performing tricks. However, they have to travel often, work from sunup to sundown, and give up everything else. For now, I'll just settle for watching the circus performance instead.

My name is Callia Catini. I am a trapeze artist. I wake up at 7:00 AM sharp and eat breakfast in the pie car, it is a trailer where we eat. While then the crew gets the tent ready. It is huge. Now it is 9:00, time for school. My school is a small room where there are computers, desks, and a teacher that travels with us. There are children who speak Russian, Italian, and French. Now I look outside and I see the geograhy lesson in real life.       

            Now it is 3:00 school is out for today. I go and groom a horse. My father calls to me he says," I finally figured out how to do a handstand on a ball while holding rings with my feet." I say great and go and practice my trick. It is doing a juggling act on a tightrope. I fall but luckly there is a net under me. My mother is practicing tricks with a lepord. Them suddenly I hear someone saying," Callia. Can you help me here." Right a way I knew that was my mother. I raced to her. I thought she was in danger because of the lepord but to my suprise the lepord sat down and wouldn't get up. I helped my mom and went back to my practice.

   Now it is time for the show I was nervous but my mom said,"I  don't think there is anything to worry about Callia. You did great in your practice and you will do great in this show too." So I did do great in my show and my mom and dad had no trouble at all.

I am a circus performer. I know that many people think circus actors live a fun and easy life, but that is not true. There are both upsides and downsides to living in a circus.

         As a circus performer, I get a chance to travel around the world and visit many places. But I work from sunup to sundown and spend a lot of time away from home. If you decide to work in a circus, you need to have a specific talent, the right body type and be very determined. Not everyone can become and acrobat or a trapeze artist.

         You have to wake up early and live in a train most of the time. You might need to learn to understand many different languages because circus performers come from all around the world.

         To be a circus actor, you need to have patience, balance, and concentration. The stunts might seem a bit dangerous. You might be bitten by a lion or a tiger. You might crack your skull somersaulting off a running horse of leaping from a trampoline onto a running horse.

         In a circus, you have to perform every day and usually 10 times a week.

         So now you see what hard work it is to be in a circus. You might change your mind now about wanting to perform in a circus.

Hi, my name is Gwendolyn. I have been part of the circus for as long as I can remember. My father is the ringmaster, my mother is the trapeze artist, my brother is a clown, and I am an acrobatist. I have been to every state in America at least once, and I have been to Japan, Turkey, Costa Rica, and Italy for a world tour.

Most people think that being in a circus would be the best thing ever, but it isn't. I have to wake up a 6:30 every morning, eat a quick, light breakfast, go do a few hours of school, then go and practice my act until lunch at 11:45. After lunch, I do my chores and help anyone who needs help with something. Then I do an hour or two of more practice, and then it's time for the show. We do two shows each night (sometimes three) and always three on Saturday and Sunday too. Another bad thing about circus life is accidents. I lost concentration a few years ago on an act, and I fell and broke my leg, a rib, and my wrist. One year, my dad also lost three fingers when a lion got too excited. There have been other accidents too, but those we're the worst.

Circus Life

        Welcome. I am going to introduce you to my amazing yet tough circus life.

         Early in the morning at 7:00 A.M. I wake up and go eat breakfast. In the pie car, I eat bacon and pancakes everyday. You may think that is luxurious but it gets boring after a while. Then I go to school at 9:00 A.M. like every other kid. Just because I live in a circus, doesn't mean I can skip school. Class is in one big schoolhouse that travels with us wherever we go. Parents may be thinking that kids won't learn as much, but the truth is, we all learn the samethings even if the schoolhouse is portable. We also get tests and report cards like everyone else.

         School ends at 3:00 P.M. Then, we get a quick break for about 30 minutes. Then, we have to practice for 3 hours. Some people would practice juggling and others would practice aerobatics. At 6:30 P.M. I would eat dinner. I don't want to eat too much because I might vomit while performing. When performing, you think about all the practice you have done and say to yourself,"I cannot fail," as you do your amazing trick. Once the performance is done you feel proud as the audience gives you a standing ovation, amazed of what everyone thought about the circus.

         At 10:30 P.M. the circus is over. You feel very tired and you are ready to hit the hay. At midnight, you go to bed thinking about your family wishing you could meet them or even call them.

It is 7:00 and my dad knocks on the door of my trailer. Yes, trailer. I live in a circus, doing acrobatics and horse-stunts. I was probably destined to be a horse-stunter, as my dad is the ringmaster. As for acrobatics, I'm like a rubberband- elastic. I am so flexible that one could twist me into a pretzel. Hi, I'm Yvonne Lutz, your average 11-year-old circus performer. I always wake up this early, so I'm so used to it, I don't even stretch anymore. I get dressed, brush my teeth, and go to the pie cart for breakfast. The pie cart is like a dining hall, except it is a moving dining hall. As usual, on the menu is pancakes and bacon. I eat up quickly so that I have time to rest before school at 9:00.

             It is school time now.We only have one room, and like the pie cart, it is a moving school. My classmates all speak different languages from all over the world. I am French. We all get to learn about our lessons like history and geography hands-on, because as we move around, we get to experience many places with a wide range of historical and geographical views. Today we learn about Hopi Indians, as we are in Arizona, quite near to the Grand Canyon. We even get to see a medley of varieties of Hopi dances. Girls my age and even younger dance intricate foot patterns in noisy dresses. Noisy because they have shells that clang together, and as in loud, like gaudy. We go on a short one hour round-trip hike down into the canyon, learing about different plants we had never seen or heard of before, and their needs, adaptation, survival skills, and habitat, going deeper into it than 'desert' or 'canyon' or 'hot weather climate area.'

             Now school is over at 3:00, and I can take a half hour break to let loose. This is when I write. I have a diary and a journal. I record the events that occur daily and school notes in my journal, why my diary holds my feelings, like my on-and-off hate for this hectic life. Sometimes I feel like I am going to explode.

              It is 3:30 now. Break time is over. I have to do chores and practice. My favorite routines are the trapeze, tightrope walk, and anything to do with horses catches my fancy as long as I get to ride in the routine. And sometimes, the stunts don't involve riding. I practice crazy stunts on galloping horses, and many dangerous acrobatics like the tightrope. Sometimes I lose my balance and fall into the net that is not very far down. I only stunt when there is a safety feature involved. I never mess up in a show, luckily. That would be extremely embarassing. I pratice for three hours so that everything is perfect for the show. After I practice, I quickly try on my costumes before dinner. My acrobatics outfit is a neon sequined head-to-toe suit. It is cross-hatched metallic pink, bright yellow, electric blue, neon orange, and a neon or metallic version of almost every color of the rainbow. There is an argyle pattern of red-orange, yellow-green, blue-purple, and pink-purple. Clear and silver sequins dot the entire thing. It is like feety pajamas in style. But it is tight on the body, and flexible, too. The back of it also extends above the neck, grasping tightly to the shape of my body until halfway up my head, where it flares out. A Marti-Gras type mask, patterned the same as my suit is attached, perfectly fitting my face. My horse-stunting cosume is the same pattern, but with different colors, like a sparkly black, white, cream, tan, and peach, and for the argyle print a metallic mahogany, cadet blue, cerulian, and mauve. The style is breeches, with a silk button down shirt and a velvet coat with a pea-coat collar. The helmet, I wear none of. That is just more of the danger, and to add on, my boots, patterned just as my riding clothes, are high heeled. They are knee-high, and cut off in triangle shapes on the two sides, the cut-outs about four inches deep. I stare at them in awe, as they are lovely. I am a colorful person, and therefore love them both, but the acrobatics outfit to a higher extent.

             It is 6:30. I have a light dinner, and then go to the Big Top to perform, as that is the tent for the major acts. I perform, always nervous yet excited, and think about how amazingly I did in practice, and my confidence soars. As I finish my routine for the millionth- and last- time this night, I wipe the sweat of my face and smile, taking a bow with the rest of the crew.

              Wow! It was a long show as usual, but I'm always surprised by how long it is. It is now 10:30, and the show is over. I walk back to my trailer as slowly as a slug, as I am really tired. Once I get back, I brush my teeth and change.

               Now it is around 12:00. It is really late, and I pretty much collapse into my bed, falling asleep before the sheets even settle down.

You  also  have to  have       talent.some  people  enter  the  circus  with  out  talent  , but  they practice  and   practice  until  they  are  experts  on  what  they  are  doing  . Some  people think  that  working  in  a  circus  is  humiliating  and  embarrassing.The  people that  work  there  don't  think    that  way.Some  people  work  in  the  circus  because  they  need   money.                                                                                                                                                        Let  me   introduce     my  self   my  name  is  Rosaline  my   family   works  in  the   circus.My parents  decided to  work  at the  circus  because  they  needed  money. My  parents  also  work  in  different  places  we  travel  all  over  the  world.Now  they  don't  have  to   take  me  to  school  so  early  in  the  morning.Our  school  is  a  little   different from  the   normal   schools .Our  school  is  a room  like  a  house.  We   also    get  report cards  .                                                                                              ?                                                                                                                                                                  People  in  the   circus  have  different  jobs . Some  people  are  the  ones  who  preform.Other people take  care  of  the  animals.Some  people  build the  tent  and  then    bring  it  down.Some  people  cook breakfast and  dinner .There are  lots  of  different    jobs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Almost  all  of  the   people  that  work  in  our  circus  are  our  relatives.The  only  person  that  does  not  work in the the  circus  are  like  20  of   them .  My  mothers  family  is  really  big.My  fathers  family is  not  to  small  and  not  to   big   either.We   also  have  people  that  are  not  part  of  our  family,but  most  of them  are  .                                                                                                                                                                 We  also  have  people  that  speak  different  languages.Some  speak   Italian  ,french,Russian. My family   speaks  french. Me  and my  family  learned  how  to  speak    Spanish  and  other  languages  too.We  learned  different  languages  because  we  travel  almost  every were.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Some  of  the  tools  we  use  are   a   one  wheel  bicycle.juggling  balls.We  also  use  animals  to  do  acts  like  for  example:horses,seals,elephants.some  acts  we  do   are  juggling  while  riding  a  one  wheel  bicycle.We  also do  acrobats  .                                                                                                                                                                                  We  perform   all  weekend   and   months  we  always  work  .  When  we  finish   our  acts  we  eat dinner  and  wake  up  the  other  day   and  it is the  same  routine.         We also  have  chores .We eat  on   a   pie  car  a  pie  car  is   where  circus  performers  eat.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Circus  acts  may  look  easy  for  some people   but  for  some  people  they  think    they  are  hard  .  The  circus  is  really  tough  .
